I love Jermey and he has been very accessible outside of the class and he makes sure to thoroughly explain topics to students. He is very understanding and is one of the best professors I have ever had and I would definitely recommend him. He doesn't make you feel dumb for asking questions either
God Professor

Jeremy Grifski was an amazing teacher. One of, if not the best, instructors Ive ever had. He was absolutely fantastic, always open to any questions, and very accessible. He was also really understanding of any unlucky circumstances that may happen to students. Definitely take his class if you can. Youll not only enjoy it, but also learn a lot!

If you have the chance, take this class with Jeremy! He really cares about his students and goes out of his way to help make sure they understand the course content. He focuses his lectures on whats actually relevant and useful. The software courses can sometimes be downright painful but he made this class interesting and fun.

Gives very thorough feedback and is very accessible outside of class. Actively tries to make the course better for current and future students. Has extensive knowledge of what he teaches, and is very relatable. Would definitely recommend him.

Don't take Systems with this professor no matter what. Has been very rude and even raised her voice at me for not understanding certain topics. Not much empathy for students and extremely strict with grading. Projects take so much time and are worth so little, with the exams being worth entirely too much.

Avoid at all costs. 

-Unclear project instructions
-Automatic 0 if you have any warning on project
-Long monotone lectures
-Unsympathetic towards tough grading
-Midterm 30%, final 40%
-Takes long to respond outside of class
-Condescending when you don't understand topics
-Acknowledges her bad teaching, unwilling to change, blames course.
-Unfunny

Her refusal to draw parallels with other CS concepts and languages other than what she was intimately familiar with made it hard to like her. She would state plainly that "I don't know Java, so don't ask if this is like anything in there" and repeated that multiple times throughout the course. Her attitude is definitely "my way or the highway".

I thought Dr. Jones was a fine professor. The labs did take an extremely long time but if you were paying attention in class I never found them to be impossible. Her lectures weren't the greatest but were informative and engaging enough. I think these reviews are way too negative compared to what that class is actually like.

She knows her stuff WELL. Exams are not easy, but definitely fair. She provides a study guide before exam. Labs are long and not easy for sure, but not undoable. Just start them early and go to office hour. She's willing to help so don't be scared. Over 1/3 of the students earning an A/A-, 50% earning a B or better, and 70% earning a C or better.

Do labs early and study and you'll do fine. Content can be overwhelming esp if u have no prior experience w C and assembly. V knowledgeable professor tho. Don't understand the hate on here but sounds like a skill issue to me :P.

Rude, condescending, has a really high ego. Terribly boring lectures, horrible slides, extremely difficult labs with bad directions given. You must memorize everything taught to do well on her exams (and no study guides given). PLEASE stay away if you can help it. If you have her, good luck.
Please take any other professor!
Atrocious.

If you enjoy 20-30 hour bi-weekly labs that are 1.7% of your grade each, the most mediocre powerpoint presentations, and knowing every question you ask will be met with the most useless and patronizing answer imaginable, this is the class for you. You also get a marginally better understanding of the content compared to the other sections!

I truly wonder if these positive reviews are fake or written by brown nosers as the overwhelmingly general consensus among CS students is to avoid at all costs even if means having to take the course at 8 am or late in the evening.

She was not approachable and often got mad at students for asking questions. Her lectures are just her reading from the slides and very boring. Her labs are very long and difficult and worth almost none of the final grade. She made me truly hate the material of a class more than in any class I have taken before.

Invest in a good therapist if you even think about taking this course with Janis as she will obliterate your mental health (and that might not even help). Being "successful" in the industry DOES NOT translate to having even an iota of teaching skill.

The lectures were long and confusing but once you actually put it into practice it made sense. The labs were hard and took a long time but you had multiple weeks to do them and they helped made the content understandable. She gave clear outlines of what the test will be on. Everyone is just blaming her for the course naturally being a hard course.

I wonder if she wrote some of these high ratings herself. Jones seemingly did everything in her power to make a course with already challenging material even more confusing. The labs took an egregious amount of time and barely even counted towards your grade. Run while you still have some enjoyment of computer science. She'll take it all.
Avoid at all costs if you want to retain some semblance of joy in your life.

Avoid taking her sections AT ALL COSTS. Unlike every other professor who teaches the course, she intentionally makes lab work difficult, has more labs, and doesn't allow her students to drop a lab grade. The lectures are dry and do not have all the information you will need to complete labs. Easily the most evil computer science class I have taken.

Do everything in your power to avoid her as a professor. After having her as a professor I no longer enjoy computer science as a subject and find no joy in the understanding of computational systems. Taking her course will be the single biggest mistake you can make in the Ohio State college of engineering.

I asked one question in the class and she yelled at me for getting "too ahead" of the class. I tried emailing her throughout a seven week time period and she completely blew off every single email. I confronted her about this and clearly had no excuse to ignore my emails. I am sick of these people who cannot have basic respect for others.
Just take anyone else, it will make your life so much easier

Janis was a good professor. She can be condescending when answering questions if you are lost. Labs take an insane amount of time but are extremely low impact on your grade with strict guidelines that make it really easy to get a zero if you miss one. Tests are very heavily weighted but fair (she doesn't play trick the student, which I respect).

Systems 1 is a difficult class, but Jones covers the material very fairly. The exams are long but fair, and she offers a ton of extra credit on them. If you go to class and put in the effort, you'll do well. I thought she was a great professor, her expertise from working in industry for many years is insightful and interesting to hear about.

I think a lot of the reviews on here are being unfair. This was a pretty tough course with a lot of information jammed into it. I know for a fact that there are worse professors. Her lectures were very long and information heavy, which can be hard for some people to digest. Her tests were very difficult, but topics were given before hand.

Janis is truly a good instructor. She teaches a difficult course that many students struggle with due to the massive amount of content covered. Nonetheless, she cares about her students and is genuinely passionate about teaching. She also provides a unique perspective having owned a tech company and working in industry for many years.

Janis is an amazing professor! Labs are long, but they are excellent preparation for the exams. Janis will also cancel class several times to give you time to work on the labs. Her lectures have all of the information you'll need. Come to office hours and start work on labs as soon as they're assigned and you'll have a great semester.

I had a fantastic experience in Sys1 with Jones. It was clear in class and during her office hours that she truly cares about her students. Her lectures are very clear, and she gives you the notes ahead of time so you don't have to just blindly copy. She is big on attendance and being in class. If you show her that you care, you will succeed.

Easily the worst professor. For someone who has been "doing this for many years" her class seems totally disorganized. We didn't get our lab grades until the day grades were due. She also missed the deadline for reporting our grades (surprise surprise). Her lectures were horrible, and she is condescending and rude when asked questions. 0/10

I am unsure how Janis has got such a low score on RMP. She was a phenomenal professor and did everything in her power to clarify questions and keep us engaged in class. She is a tough grader and the labs can take a bit of time, but office hours are plentiful and she will take the time to work with you. Tons of real world knowledge to be gained.

She's not as bad as the other ratings make her out to be. Her slides are good. She does try to be reasonable and moves due dates.

Her recordings were very blurry so try to go in person. If you don't regularly attend, she's condescending when you ask questions.

It took a long time for labs to be graded. Grades are heavily influenced by exams.

Jones is horrible. I have her for Systems 1 and her lectures are drab and all over the place. There is no schedule, and huge projects are assigned with no notice that take exorbitant amounts of time to complete. Also, we are now on Lab 7, and only one lab has been graded. Worst of all, the exams are HARD & the only major contributor to your grade.

She has good slides and lectures but something about her makes her not very approachable. The labs are extremely difficult and there are a lot of constraints on how to do them. The exams are also hard and are worth a lot. She's good at teaching content but her way of testing the knowledge is not good.
Hard lab. Hard exam. Boring class. Just don't take this class with this instructor.

While I don't hate her as a teacher, the weights made it so labs that had been worked on for 10 hours each were worth 5% of our grade total while homework problems were each .5% of our grade. In addition the final was 40% of our grade. Overall I think she does a decent job with content but the difficulty with the weights makes this class very hard.

I had to drop from her Systems I class midway through the spring semester. Note that most classes were online at the time including her Systems class. Anyways, professor Jones lectured in a very condescending manner. and answered student questions in a similar manner. Retake 2421 with a different professor that expects students to struggle a bit.
She doesn't know how to respect her students. Never care about her ridiculous project and homework. Avoid if all possible.

Her labs are literally going to become your entire life and will break you down bit by bit. Condescending instructions and ridiculous requirements. Lectures are dry and extremely boring. Can be mean when asking questions and her grading is extremely strict.

Avoid her to the best of your ability. She intentionally designs her lab rubrics to make life difficult. Insane requirements you won't even see in industry. Not to mention labs take up so much of your energy and you won't even get anything above 5 points. Exams are crazy hard and difficult to pass. Skip this class if you care about your wellbeing.
SO hard.
lab is so hard

She can be hard at times, she gives bonus credit if you turn in your projects early. Although her grading criteria are pretty clear for projects. Careful though, once you fall behind it'll be a lot of work to catch up. Although at least the stuff from first half of the semester doesn't carry over to the second half so the final will all be for new.

Drop her class if you have a chance. Regardless of how hard you study, an average person could probably get a grade within the Cs or the low Bs. Gotta work really hard just to get a c. Rude lab instructions and just threatens to take so many points away for making one simple mistake.

The stuff in lecture is relatively straightforward but Prof. Jones made the labs extremely difficult. You can literally spend 20 hours doing them and still only get 6% of your grade. Would not recommend! Don't get me started on the final, impossible but still gotta pass to pass the course. Run if you can.

She intentionally places important exam questions on the back, and pop quizes at the beggining or end of classes; the lab instructions contain a lot of condecending statements instead of being objective; she puts absolutely 0 effort into lectures, and posts the slides just before the class so you cant ask questions; rude behavior towards students.

Well shes knowledgeable and knows her stuff but not totally focused on teaching. More concerned about drowning you in labs and homeworks that arent even worth much. Midterms and final are your entire grade. Look elsewhere if your just a beginner.

Just like other RMPs for her, drop while you can. If you care about your mental health. Jones aims to teach you what she would want to see if hiring someone in the industry. But, instead of focusing on the learning, she drowns you in labs that could take anywhere between 15-30 hours each. Run, while you can.

Dry but not difficult. Dr. Jones gives a lot of extra credit w/early due dates. Attendance isn't mandatory (read the slides) but she does have pop quizzes. Homework is long and tedious but there are only 3. Sometimes I feel like her explanations just comprise of repeating herself, but you don't need a deep understanding to do well anyway.

She's the absolute worst professor I have ever seen in my entire life. Her grading is very strict. Her whole policy is to be fair, so she does things to make students feel the class is fair but in reality she makes it so much difficult that it needs to be. Good lectures but can be really boring. Make sure you keep up, or else you are retaking it.

Jones is one of the worst professors in the CSE department not because she just reads off the slides, but because she is very rude and condescending. The labs are extremely hard and long. She canceled class three times just to give us time to work on the long labs. Tests are heavy. Avoid her if you care about your mental health.

There are so many ways to clarify the content, Jones can always find a short path to humiliate you and repeat the same content again instead of clarify it. Yes, she was "successful" in the industry (maybe?), but I do not believe she is a good instructor. Avoid her if you care about your mental health -- mental health matter!

She does give out extra credit which is good. But she's really terrible at explaining things. Asking for clarification just ends up with her reiterating the material/instructions again (verbatim). Crazy grading criterias. Labs can be confusing and take a lot of time (or not a lot of time depends on the lab). Exams are very long. She is very rude.

The course content is difficult and Jones is a dull lecturer who just reads the notes off the PowerPoint. The labs take lots of time and effort, but she gives extra credit. Her exams are difficult and will take the entire test period. Her answers to questions are too vague and don't help you unless you already know what you're looking for.

Shes a good C teacher. However she lacks any ability to teach X86. Shes very rude. Often, she will just repeat what she said earlier, instead of trying to clarifying things. You can get the majority of your points off on projects (even if your code works). The final is not cumulative, but you still need to pass it, to pass the class. Avoid her!
Difficult labs, extremely long exams, and just a rude person overall.

Professor Jones is great. The class is not easy but she's a good lecturer, and it really shows that she knows her stuff. Some labs take a ton of work (I think the longest I've worked on took me more than 10 hours), but they definitely help cement understanding of the concepts. The exams are incredibly long.

Boring lectures like every other prof for this class. CSE2421 content is really important to cse majors. She does a good job teaching material. Her Midterm was stupid hard... fair but just so dang dense. Haven't taken final yet. Would recommend. Does have an edge you need to pretend doesn't exist to talk or ask questions unfortunately.
She's a really good professor, both in terms of content and delivery. The course itself is hard and worthwhile. I wish it were easier but had I redone this semester, I would have had her again
She is very mean. You can learn nothing from her class. Every time you ask her question, she will make fun of you first. She doesn't know how to respect her students.

Prof. Jones is great. She can be kind of mean sometimes, but otherwise gives good advice and will make you learn from your mistakes. Her homeworks, labs, and exams were fair and straightforward, and she gives you the topics to study for the exams. The labs take a while, so start early - you can get extra credit if you finish them early, too.

She's tolerable... Class is boring and she can be really mean when you ask her questions. She can be very nice to you if you're white though... She's very knowledgeable but sometimes she doesn't even answer your quesiton. Also don't trust the syllabus. We had half the number of homeworks specified in the syllabus and I was depending on them

She is okay. Experienced and knowledgeable, but lectures are meh. She tries her best though and is super helpful in office hours. I can see why she has such mixed reviews. You'll learn most of the content as you fumble through projects, read up on things, and reread powerpoints. Projects take forever, beware. Grading and weights are weird.
The WORST CSE lecturer at Ohio State EVER! She is mean and cynical and does't know how to teach. It's really a big challenge not to sleep in her class. If you want an A, AVOID her.

Jones is a great choice for Systems 1 if you have the option. She teaches well and it is clear she really knows her stuff, plus she is kind of fun. She runs off of few but large assignments and you get bonus points for turning those in early, so you should do that.

Janis is a great professor and the grading in the class was very fair. The homework assignments sometimes took a long time, but there weren't very many of them so overall it wasn't too bad. There were also extra credit opportunities on the labs and the exams. Lectures could be a bit boring but her stories from working in industry were interesting.

We had a total of 9 assignments the whole semester, so the homeworks end up being stupidly long and the labs can feel like fumbling around in the dark until you figure them out. You get tested on things you don't really use at all. She's a nice enough person and has industry experience, so I'm not sure if this is her fault or just the course.

Lectures are a bit boring but slides are posted online. Attendance is required due to the in-class exercises (which are very easy and serve as way to take attendance). Jones posts study sheets with all the content that will be tested prior to the exam. Final exam is not cumulative. Extra Credit for Labs if submitted early. Overall great instructor.
Lectures were not great. Random in-class exercises (graded gently, but you have to show up every day...). Labs, HW, and tests were fair.

I learned a lot from Janis. Her industry experience provides insight into the applications of the material, and if you have the desire to learn what many see as an uninteresting topic, you will be rewarded.

Janis Jones is by far one of the worst lecturers. Her lectures are her reading off the powerpoint slides. I HIGHLY recommend reading the class textbook. She grossly underestimated the time it takes to complete her exams, and, after a majority of the class did poorly, decided to deflate low scores by increasing coursework.

She doesn't know how to teach. I have not learned anything from her lectures so I have to try and learn everything outside class. I went to office hours twice to get help on labs and both times she just sat there while I ended up finding the mistake myself. Terrible experience.

Janis Jones is a great, caring professor who brings in her many years of industry experience. She has a lot of useful anecdotes and examples. The content can be dry and the slides are a bit disorganized sometimes, and I think it's also her first time teaching the class. Occasional graded in-class assignments, so be sure to attend class.

Andrew is the perfect example of a genius who has no business teaching.  You're supposed to teach yourself based off slides but the slides are horrendous and he spend all of class time just solving long problems on the board. He gives no solutions to HW so good luck knowing the right answer. He essentially provides no review for the exams too.
Brilliant man, but if you get an average of 63 for your students on your final with a 6 page cheat sheet, then you might be doing something wrong.
45 percent for the final
The final exam is weighted like CRAZY.
45% of your grade being the final is ridiculous, and he does almost no final review, so good luck studying for his exams.

The class is difficult but he is a very reasonable professor who cares about his students. Will make accommodations and set fair curves. Relates to his students more as a friend than a typical professor does.

Such a good professor. He's caring and very willing to help in office hours, I went all the time despite rarely going in other classes. He also has not been teaching for 40 years so he's good at focusing on what's relevant vs. what is a relic of past curriculum. Also generous note sheets allowed on exams, and they are very similar to the homework.
You can really learn a lot of useful thing about AI from his lectures. The requirement of the class is clear. As long as you understand all the homework problems, the exam won't be a problem.

Naeem is condescending and unfunny, no way around it. He just yaps about how excited we should be to learn algorithms. Lab reports are strict with no example to follow, and the final is 33.5% with barely any prep. Labs feel unrelated, and you're left to teach yourself. If you're here for Unity, take ACCAD. I'm CIS and wish there were other options.

The labs are graded leniently. Daily Tophat attendance check, regularly runs overtime, condescending. He has a piazza but its useless because if he ever replies its usually a half answer. The labs are fun but have nothing to do with lecture, which is pretty much a math class. Difficult comprehensive exam. Doesn't seem like he likes his job. Avoid.

This class is a struggle. The lectures and labs don't align, and the professor can't even answer basic Unity questions. But unstuckstudy was a lifesaver for study prep. Just be ready to learn Unity on your own.

One of the most controversial CS teachers. On one hand, he answers questions well and lectures well. On another, he expects you to complete assignments requiring code he hasn't yet covered with strict deadlines. He may rip your bad code apart one moment, then compliment you on what you did right another. He's like an Asian dad. VERY tough deadlines

He explains things well during lecture but the hardest thing in this class was the graded assignments. The TA gave massive deductions for not working on our code everyday. they expect you to focus entirely on this class. Only way to do good is to work on code everyday and to study whatever shareef points out in his lecture which will be on the exam

Do not even bother with this professor. He expects you to devote your life to this class and coding Ruby while you have other responsibilities outside of his class. He is very very rude and doesn't want you to ask questions and makes you feel stupid. The grading guidelines on projects are very harsh and absurd.
Worst professor ever!!!
So sad he is the only one who teaches CSE3531 and OSU requires credit for this. Most comments said exactly what I want to say, just don't take this class if you don't have to.

I literally **do not** know what any of the negative reviews are talking about.  Dr. Shareef may be a bit opinionated, sure, and he is certainly a bit more on the strict side, but he's actually pretty awesome to talk to.  He is strict as explained by himself precisely because he *cares* about you and making sure that you succeed once you graduate.
Tough course, but if you pay attention to his lectures, you will be completely fine.

He makes the class unnecessarily difficult by grading hard and an overwhelming amount of assignments with overlapping due dates. The content of this class is too much and extremely time consuming. Also, you will not know your overall class grade until the end of the semester when you are given an excel sheet to calculate the overall grade yourself.
Overall a very bad professor, doesn't respect time of students, talks down to students frequently. Doesn't make asking questions easy. Way too much work for a 4 credit hour class.

Tried to give me a 0 because an assignment registered as 2 seconds late on Carmen, had to get 2 TAs with me proving that the time stamp meant it was still valid because I hit the upload button 3 minutes before. Also tried to scam students through top hat by marking people as absent when they were still there

He sent emails telling us to following health and safety protocols while other profs did not. He should stay in his lane and teach actual game design which he does not anyway. Knows nothing about unity himself and can offer no help. The graders prob know more than him. Ridiculous

Ridiculous prof. Like all the other ratings said. Also he told us to social distance in his class during the omicron surge which was completely unnecessary at that point since this thing was gonna spread anyway.
just run..

There are pros to this class but the cons far outweigh the pros. The labs take forever and there is no guidance on learning unity. Also, the lecture slides are nearly completely unrelated to the labs. Shareef himself could not answer my Unity questions. Be ready to learn Unity on your own cause class is not even related to labs.

Might seem nice on the outside, but is truly mean and rude on the inside. Slides/labs are taken from other professors. Doesn't accommodate and makes you go to the doctor when you are clearly sick to prove it. It's ridiculous OSU requires this class or AI to graduate but not some tech electives that are foundational for success in the real world!

Possibly the worst CSE professor at OSU. He does not seem to understand the material he teaches(I have taken many classes with him) and clearly does not care. He is rude to students and expects participation just to insult students. He also does not do any actual work. All of his slide decks are outdated and stolen from retired professors.

Get ready to learn Unity and C# all on your own. Lecture is a math/physics class. The projects are very disconnected from the lecture material and are made unnecessarily difficult. You are given a half complete project to finish with minimal comments/instructions. Funniest of all: he spent class time telling us to never bring code to office hours.

Extremely rude and condescending to students. Clearly doesn't care about teaching and only exists in the university to drag grad students into dead-end research projects while treating teaching as a side gig. His lab instructions make an easy subject unnecessarily difficult through vague directions and insulting tone. Avoid like the plague!

Tough homework grades but overall fair on the projects. A few projects in particular had their trouble spots for the class that made the overall class grade low. Would recommend avoiding or assuming you will be doing a lot of work.

Very tough class and very lecture heavy. You have to learn Unity by yourself and the earlier you learn, the more time you will save during the class! The graders for the Unity projects were pretty petty too at times, however, their office hours are pretty useful. There is one exam, the final, and you get a cheat sheet, however no solutions allowed.

Avoid this guy like the plague! Literally I was excited to take this class yet he literally sucked the passion out of me and made me hate game development! Your on your own to learn Unity and he can't help too much in office hours even if you asked! Lectures are almost completely disconnected from labs and have nothing to do with game dev!

3901 isn't supposed to be as hard as he makes it. I was so excited to take this class and he sucked the passion out of me. He taught the lectures after we needed them for the project, so we knew nothing before the projects. It would be worth not even taking the class if all you can get is Shareef for that semester. He will make your life miserable.

Shareef is the most insufferable person I have ever met. He using his teaching platform to powertrip students and make you feel stupid. I was lucky to have a great group, but I still did poorly due to the exams. He takes attendance randomly in class to get you to lose points for skipping. Makes online exams almost impossible to take as well.

Not only did he expect you to submit an assignment well before instructing you about the contents, but he is also terribly picky and intentionally misleading. For example, he told us that the final would be in-depth with material we learned after the midterm and vague with stuff before, but material after the final made up 1/3rd of the final.

You could be on your deathbed and he won't give you any extensions. I found myself in numerous situations where I knew I would need an extension to make things work. Had to come home to deal with a situation regarding a family member of mine. Still said no.

An okay class turned into a nightmare because I could not adjust anything.

Your experience almost entirely depends on the group you get. Thankfully, he is very willing to move unproductive members out of group, and give people individual grades if they don't contribute to the group solution. 80% is an A- and doesn't grade harshly. Only issue is he is very hands off and teaches material close to deadlines.

Prof. Shareef provided little instruction on projects, only teaching the material close to the projects' final due dates. In addition, he often declared new requirements for these projects during lectures, forcing students to go back and redo code mid-project. He forced many extra time commitments outside of scheduled class time. Not recommended.

The course is very well organized. The stand ups are great and he tells us exactly what we need to implement He is fair in determining who did what in the teams. The exams cover exactly what is in the lecture notes and review material. He covers lecture material well before projects are due and gives suggestions for the projects during lectures.

This is the absolute worst class I have taken at Ohio State! Literally, no teaching at all and the labs have nothing to do with lecture and you are forced to spend days and hours on it. Just drop this class if you even have a choice and take it with someone else.

Shareef is by far the worst professor I have ever had. He is passive-aggressive during lectures and treats you like you are dumb. Lecture is basically a math class that has 0 connection to labs. Need help? During office hours he won't help and make you feel even more lost. Terrible class. DON'T THINK YOUR EXPERIENCE WILL BE DIFFERENT. AVOID!!
Avoid like the plague
Horrible!
Absolutely the worst teacher I've ever had. Doesn't care for students, doesn't accommodate, required proctorio but literally made us clear our entire desk. Literally the worst.

In my 4 years at osu professor shareef is by far the worst professor I have had the displeasure of taking. He seems to find joy in overloading students with many projects at a time to "simulate a workplace environment." The problem is shareef has no non-academic experience and does not understand how the real world works. Avoid shareef at all costs
This class is miserable! He just reads off the slides which have nothing to do with the projects! No one should ever take this class

Don't do it to yourself. It's like having a jaded customer service rep as your professor. He makes simple things difficult by not teaching you how to do them. You will teach yourself entirely how to do the labs. I'm a senior, and this is the worst CSE prof I've had. Sick? He'll reply with a passive aggressive denial that'll leave you confused + sad

Do not take this class without taking linear algebra and physics first. Even though these aren't pre-reqs, they basically are and Shareef assumes you have taken them already. The lectures also have very little to do with the labs, so prepare to spend a lot of time teaching yourself Unity. This class honestly has very little do with animation.

Majority of the course grade is from labs in Unity. Lectures are only theoretically related to the labs, you'll implement things that are underpinned with lecture content, but not practically or technically related at all otherwise. No support for learning Unity. Told to watch Youtube tutorials. Course has a LOT of linear algebra despite no prereq.

Absolutely do not ignore any of these ratings and expect this class to be different for you. He makes you struggle through long labs with no instructions and he is not helpful for them at all. Also class content has nothing to do with the labs. You also won’t know your actual grade until the end of the semester. Final warning avoid him!

Please, drop this class while you can. Take only if you have to. He lectures 24/7 and reads straight from the slides and they literally have nothing to do with the labs. You are on your own to figure everything out and it's incredibly time-consuming.

DO NOT take this class unless you absolutely have to!!! The labs are long with little instructions. He basically expects you to learn unity yourself. His office hour isnt that helpful either. There is a Piazza for the course but its just mostly the students answer each others questions. WOULD NOT recommend!
Please, AVOID taking a class with him!!! he is literally the worst!! He will make your life miserable.

Dr. Shareef is passionate about the material and he likes to show stuff off. He does kind of struggle to emphasize what you need to know and what is important though. The class is 50% projects, which you will have to teach yourself a lot of specific unity stuff, but the general stuff you are taught. As long as you do the projects you'll be okay

The worst professor ever!!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESSOR!!!! The lectures are just terrible, I had to teach myself everything in the class. Don't ignore all these bad reviews expecting the class to be different for you.

This guy cannot deliver a lecture to save his life. The lecture slides do not contain complete examples of anything we are expected to do on homework or exams. He repeats himself, rambles for many minutes, asks the class if any of what he said made sense, and gets annoyed when no one has a clue what he's talking about.

This professor is the driest lecturer I have ever encountered. So boring. Also, his slides are very disorganized, very hard to determine what is being communicated. I cannot believe I am paying $1000 for this course only to get such an incompetent "teacher." This man does not belong in the field of education.

He is good at explaining concepts and I feel he is a nice guy. To me he is the best professor I have ever met in the CSE department. I guess the reason that he didn't get a high rate here is that he sticks to his own principles and won't lower the requirements to please students.

Seriously I feel I learned all the things by myself. Basically he just posts videos online, you need to learn by yourself from textbook. The lecture videos are really easy and definitely not the same level as quiz or midterms.

Most professors at Ohio State hate having to deal with COAM for academic misconduct and it ruins their day if they have to. Naeem however is the exact opposite. His whole goal is to try to report as many people to COAM as possible and doesn't care if we learn anything. Strict proctoring on quizzes and exams. Don't expect him to buy your excuses.

Terrible. I wasn't going to write any prof. reviews this semester but this guy goes below and beyond. On Sunday, May 9th, weeks after class was over, he told me one of my assignments was flagged and to respond by May 10th or the Office of Misconduct is getting involved. I didn't check my school email their of these days so now I have an incomplete!

Don't take 3521 with him if you can, if you have to don't take the online version. The exams are like a nightmare when they are fully online, and you can't use any paper or pen during the exam. And Do not expect to see your real letter grade on carmen until the very end. The percentage on carmen has nothing to do with your real grade.

Professor Shareef was really chill and down to earth. Always ready to help with whatever. Genuinely seems to care a lot about teaching. Only complaint is he likes to go over really simple things repeatedly and at length.

If you have a good grasp of programming beforehand, this class is not going to be bad. It starts off very easy but the pacing gets faster and faster as the class goes on. Be prepared for homework and lab assignments to be time-consuming and harder than expected. This class is not easy for those new to programming. Some graders are also harsh too

I think Naeem throws a lot of people off because when you ask questions, he won't spoonfeed the answers to you, but rather encourages you to think for yourself. Once you have some understanding of the material learned, he'll be happy to explain further. Attending the online lectures helped a lot, as did watching the recorded ones repeatedly.

One of the worst classes that I've taken at OSU. The notes are at a basic level, but the homework and labs are irrelevant to the notes, as they are 100x harder than what the notes provide. Whenever you ask a question, he always responds, "go look at the notes." Office hours are a joke, as well as the TA's. If you're seeking help, GOOD LUCK!
Avoid him or he will make your life miserable. He is the worst

One of the worst professor that I had in my life. He always try to make things more difficult for students. And if a student ask him a question or to explain a concept, he always say "go back read the lecture". Also, he does not allow students to go back and see their exams and quizzes, so you can't know where you lose points in the exam

This is the worst class I've taken at OSU, rude teaching instructors, tough graders, exams are like hell, and super difficult for a class that you probably won't ever use again. OSU forcing students to take this class is the stupidest thing I've ever seen. A 3 freaking credits hrs seems like 20 and lectures are way different than hw or the labs.
He never thinks about teaching but creating burdens to students. Extremely bad teaching and offers utterly useless lectures. He talks softly but really is jerk

Worst prof/course Ive come across. It seems to me that these OSU profs have little going for them in life and only seek to punish students for their poor life decisions. If you are considering this class or OSU in general AVOID!!! you will be much happier and learn more elsewhere. This institution is a joke ran by miserable people.

Dr. Shareef is a nice person, but unfortunately, he was asking us to take a lot of time on his materials. Questions on his exams are relevant with our actual project and guess what, you have to answer questions like that in short amount of time. Workload balance is fair, if you really know how to write good codes. Otherwise, you will get in trouble

Take this class elsewhere. Dude sucks and his graduate student TAs are even worse. They are foreign exchange students who dont speak English well enough to relay information in a proper manner that you would expect from a state institution. Weed out course for sure. Look elsewhere!!!

My grandmother died mid-semester and I requested an incomplete because I wasn't handling it well. I think he's very suspicious of cheating because he questioned me about it to the point that it felt intrusive. I was telling the truth so it definitely made me resent the guy. As a professor he's OK. It's an intro class so expect a lot of busy work.

He is awful! The worst professor that OSU can have. He is not helpful at all. No grading criteria, will give you what ever he feels like. MOST STRESSFUL CLASS EVER! OSU must not hire professors like this considering that we are here to learn.

He made most confusing instructions about projects among all instructrors I've been met. He will deduck whole group's project grade and assign you a 50% less grade if you contribute a little less than the others. He will ask you to spend 6 hours each day to study for this course, and rambing from Earth to Mars when he giving the lecture.

Dr. Shareef is a fine person, however, this class was a nightmare. You'll need to spend at least half the day six days a week doing an exorbitant amount of work to not fall behind. Every aspect of this course was made unnecessarily difficult coupled with the fact that he is a very harsh grader. Easily the most stressful class I've ever taken.

If you get a chance, please please avoid him. He is extremely passive aggressive. He will ask you to drop the class. He will make you feel stupid. Gives you up to 50% lesser grade than the group even if the contributions are a little lesser. The midterms are very hard and are graded very harshly. Other professors can make it much better. AVOID HIM!
He's an okay guy but this class in insufferable. It's so much work and he as an incredibly hard grader. Lectures are very long and very boring. Avoid him if you can.

Has no respect for students whatsoever. Anytime a student has a question or concern, he gives absolutely no help and makes the student feel inferior. Makes me sad sometimes ngl. Not to mention the fact that he essentially lied about our grades for 90 percent of the semester. I hope I never have another professor that cares less about teaching.

Although it is a 3 credit course, it is designed like 10 credit hours. I spent half of the daily time for the assignment and lab, and get nothing deserved. For my other low level courses, I can get easy A with only less than 1 hour everday. But for this, I nearly spent my whole energy on it, but just got C.

I do not normally complain about professor but this guy is an utter jerk. He gives vibes that he is trying to punish students or make it hard for students because that's how he was treated. If you can help it do not take this class with this professor... The CSE dept uses this class to weed out students already.
please, please, please, do not choose him. If having no choice, just skip 1222.
If you can see this comment, please avoid him by all means.

Prof. Shareef seems like a good person but isn't great at coordinating this class. He and the department refuse to attempt to use canvas for the purpose of properly weighting grades. Instead, they are doing it by hand in Excel. Additionally 75% of your grade is in exams. If you goof one, you're gonna be stuck. Overly complicated for an intro class.

The worst course coordinator and lecturer, please avoid if possible. Acts completely rude to students who ask questions and he makes them feel dumb, just look at how he responds to students on piazza. Sees something learned outside of class and calls it cheating. Will take off points for the smallest things even if you get the correct outputs.

He made this class way more confusing and challenging then it should be. This is a basic coding class with most of the students not having any background in coding. The begging of the class is simple then out of nowhere it becomes extremely complicated and confusing. All assignments are grade unfairly.

This class was unreasonably difficult for so many reasons. The quizzes are timed, with not nearly enough time to complete the tasks given and the homework and assignments take ages with horrible instructions. I went into the third to last week of classes with a high B+, and still made the class pass/ fail because the amount of work wasn't worth it.

Considering the fact that I had a much easier time in my higher level CSE classes than I did in an intro to C++ class (a language I had already known very well going in) is indicative of how poorly constructed this class is. The Zybooks were a mess, the quizzes were poorly constructed, and the HW and labs, albeit easy, were very time consuming.

This guy. He's extremely unclear during lecture, his powerpoint presentation make no sense, and he overcomplicates EVERYTHING. He'll send you running around on Zybooks completing a disorganized pile of chapters, then quiz you on something mentioned once. Labs and homework are either super easy, or ridiculously hard. Avoid this guy if you can.
avoid if possible. outside class help is poor

Utterly the worst professor in OSU, never stupid stuff that you can learn from any youtube and do way worse than youtube. He never helps in office hour, only ask a ton even if you just need clarification. Always rude, suspicious on students. If you know something beyond course he thinks you are cheating

Probably one of the worst professors I've had at OSU. He will not help you at all. He expects you to understand everything, and if you don't then it is your fault. His office hours suck. He told me to drop the course because I have failed the first midterm. He is not one bit of helpful to you.

His class is one of the hardest classes for CSE3901. He has almost weekly quizzes and his exams are difficult. There are projects due almost every other week where the project requirements are super unclear. The only part that was good was the TA who tried to help as much as he could.

Worst professor I've met at OSU. This professor will not work with you. His office hours are unhelpful and a waste of time. Lectures does not add any value. Don't except getting help from him. He will not move any of his quizzes or exams. No make up unless you are in the emergency room. Don't expect for a make up cuz you have interviews.

Literally one of the worst professors I've had. Just reads off slides in lecture. I once emailed him a simple question on a completed homework and instead of helping he wrote 3 paragraphs on how to complete the assignment (after I expressed that I ALREADY finished it) (the mistake was in the literal first line of hw, he didn't even look at it)

He moves fast and expects class participation. If you don't go to lecture, you're missing out on all the elaboration and examples he does. Take notes and you'll be fine - cramming with lectures won't work, not enough info on those. Start projects early, go to his office hours. Projects requirements are relatively flexible, depending on the TA.
the worst professor I have ever met in Ohio State
the worst professor I have ever met in Ohio State. The only thing he will do during class is reading words from slides! Unuseful class for students!

Memorize slides in addition to outside research to succeed on exams. 6 intensive projects on topics that are briefly mentioned in class AFTER the project is due. The slides are thorough, but lectures can be summed up in 1 quote: Come on, are you guys really CSE majors? Seriously? - Shareef after recieving a guess on a brand new topic.

His lectures are literally the readings he assigns, but that wont stop him from getting annoyed that no one pays attention to him. The actual class work is fairly difficult and requires a lot of time, but he doesn't want you to ask about that because it isn't "real material". Also if you want to reschedule anything it aint gonna happen.

His class isn't for creative people, tans of rules that you have to fellow . I had problem with his quizzes, 80% of his quizzes reading,10% a problem, and 10% typing. Most of his instructions does not solve the problem as much as placing rule of. He enforce the solution to be the same for every one. You can pass his class if you are not busy.

If there is another professor teaching 3901, take them. Naeem expects way too much out of his students and if you are a busy person he makes it incredibly hard to do well. You have to learn half of the material for projects on your own. He also never sides with the student. Even if you bring him a legit excuse for missing class, he will deny it.

Good guy but he's the worst at looking out for the students. He says he'll take hws late if there is an emergency, told him I was sick and he said "I don't buy that excuse" even though I had a doc note. Took the homework with the 10% deduction after arguing with me for 2 hours. lot of hws, lost lot of points on little things.

Gives informative, usually engaging lectures. Grades projects incredibly leniently and grades exams fairly. Exams come directly from the slides and you will not do well if you are not prepared. He often has several questions that require you to have memorized specific Ruby/Javascript methods to get full credit.

While he is a generally good lecturer and seems genuinely interested in the success of his students, Shareef also grades incredibly hard on exams. He also assigns a of lot (often tedious) graded homework, and his labs aren't as well done as other AI teachers. AI is a great class, but look to see if you can take it with someone else if possible.

Naeem Shareef is a very respectable teacher whom I highly recommend. The class itself is very time consuming, but lectures are enjoyable because he is such a good teacher. Be prepared to spend many, many, many hours on group projects that get graded toughly. Also, the midterms are fairly difficult and require quite a bit of studying to do well.

Its a project based course where most of the work is done with your group. I liked that I could explore topics and use what I learned in the projects. The lectures helped out a lot in understanding the material. He explains the subject well and very helpful in office hours.

Great teacher. Very organized and clear in class. He pretty much tells you what is on the assignments and exams in his Powerpoint slides and in lecture.  Really good lecture style. Knows the material very well and gives advice on interviews and after graduation. Overall very good.

There are many questions in midterms and final which are not difficult but cost lots of time. The grade criteria is tough and you may lose some points even if it is a tiny mistake. However, the course content is useful in job or internship interview.

This class in itself is very difficult as a majority of the stuff used in the projects is stuff you have to learn outside class. However the midterms are based completely on the lectures and notes. I think he is a great teacher who may expect a little more from us than he should but he really wants us to learn. Very clear in class, and helpful too!

Naeem Shareef is a respectable teacher for CSE 2331. You get HW once a week, which can take several hours to complete, but are normally not too difficult if you go to class and read the slides. The Midterms can be difficult, but if you do well on the HW, you will do well on the Midterms. Overall, Naeem Sareef is a great teacher.
He is a terrible lecturer. Constantly correcting himself the next day after students point out his mistakes. This makes homework impossible to complete accurately. Avoid at all costs.

I had him for CSE 3901 on Sp. 2015. He's lecture notes are detailed and all his exam material comes from them. Read the material and attend the lectures, then you'll be fine. Also group project is big part of this class, so make sure you choose hardworking people. I had a teammate who didn't care about the class, but I talked to Shareef about it.

I took his web app project course and unfortunately got saddled with bad partners at the start of the class (as sometimes happens in these courses) so the class was not fun for me. However Shareef was very helpful whenever I had problems with group work or with general questions.  Ask questions or go to office hours and he's always willing to help.
Not a cooperative teacher for students with disabilities. Avoid if possible.
Very disappoint about him

Mandatory attendance, poor lecture. Get ready to write code and you definitely can learn the stuff by yourself. Very surprise he often makes mistake in writing demo in class, that is just 10 line codes........ Not very helpful in lecture

Maybe he has some good feedbacks from students, but mostly, are bad. Talk nearly nothing about the project and let you explore yourself. He may not helpful when you face problem. Most of the part of your final grade depends on who is your teammate.

He is a good teacher and explains things well. The group projects are graded fairly(maybe generously) and you learn a lot. Dr. Shareef emphasizes things that every software engineer should know. He understands if you need to turn in things past due during busy times. Don't expect a lot of sleep when taking this class with a full CSE load and wjob
He assigns a lot of projects but the lecture cover very little. Also his knowledge is not enough to answer student's answer. You need a lot of time to learn by yourself.
Super boring lecture! No detail and point
Not helpful in lecture, need a lot of time after class.

Shares is one of those instructors who thinks we have an infinite amount of time to devote to his single class. This is not an easy class and I would recommend not taking it with more than 3 other challenging courses. Group projects are brought. Get a good group early or you will not sane throughout the semester.
The class is not really hard, the grade is fair but the instructor is really suck! Bad time management, bad organized, no point.
He needs to work hard to prove he is a qualify teacher. He takes attendance, if not, maybe no one show up in class.

I really enjoyed this class. The material was interesting and straight-forward, and the lectures did a good job of presenting the material. Labs and homeworks were also straightforward, though they required putting time into them.
Boring lecture. He will smile and let you search online when you ask him question he doesn't know the answer and it happens very often.
He is a very lazy guy. Just read the slide and seem does't know the material very much. He will let you learn by yourself a lot and he will not help you. Avoid him is a good idea.
Uncompromising, but knows what he is talking about. This leads him to not listen very well.
He doesn't know the material about the programming language and the tests are irrelevant to the topic. I got every A at other CSE classes but B at his. One reason, he is a really bad instructor.
One word, terrible!!!!!!!!!

I don't think he know web dev all that well. Barely learn at lecture so you need to spend a lot of time learn by yourself after class. The exam is memory stuff and some concepts. Consider this is a CSE project class, most of the questions at the exam is useless and unnecessary. Don't expect learn a lot from him, he is not a good lecturer.

Absolute the worst CSE lecturer I ever meet. Don't know the material very well.  Let the student search online and learn from themselves. That is so funny spend money at school and learn from myself. Maybe worse than the grader. If you do want to learn something, avoid him.

Probably the worst teacher in the entire CSE department. Do not ask him questions in class. He may give you wrong answer or let you search online after class. He just read the slide and the class is super boring. Read the book seem better than go to his class.

The labs are fine but the test are totally stupid! The questions are ridiculous like let you explain what is 'css' in one sentence. If you write more than one sentence or the sentence is too long, you will lose points. He likes test the memory but useless stuff.

Its a  project based course (before your capstone), so expect little hand holding. Many projects from small one to a final project. You are expected to learn as much web techonology as you can. He provided a lot of links and references, but you had to find more material on your own. Great lectures but ran a little behind. Final project was fun.

Is good at explaining concepts, he acted like his class was the only one we were taking. He got 2 weeks behind in the syllabus and then lectured us about time management. Slammed us with projects near the end of the semester and said it "simulated a real job". Micro-managed group work. I was looking forward to this class, but now I regret it. AVOID

The class is project-based where you do assignments in groups. Class lectures are used to create a cool web application in a final project. But you are allowed to use frameworks and api's outside of lecture material. So you should want to go beyond this to do cool things. His lectures have nice interactive examples and demos. Learned a lot.

He was very knowledgeable on web development and even covered knowledge about networking and http. A lot of the group final projects were very neat and pretty sophisticated. I was able to use it in an interview for a job using Rails. I got the job. He is all about letting you explore what you want to learn and makes that clear. He takes attendance.

He doesn't seem to know web dev all that well. Additionally you're expected to learn pretty much all of the material on your own. He's a pretty nice guy if you talk with him during office hours but I feel the class could be done better. Grading-wise I'd say he's fair, not easy or hard.

Very clear and very helpful.  You take quizzes at the end of the class period and throughout that class period he reviews material for it.  Attendance is mandatory, but honestly you need to attend class anyway if you want to do well. You want him as your professor if you take this class.

The class was really easy.  The material was not the most interesting in the world, which put me to sleep often, but Naeem handled it well.  He was also very lenient and fair on the project and exams.
Definitely take this course with him over others. Very cool guy. Keeps you interested in class.

OMG, whiners on here. The word is that this is the only person to take this class with hands down. Speaks clearly, explains well if you come to class, gives lots of extra credit, and lots of sample quizzes, exams, etc. Very nice and pretty cool. You cannot escape the labs since he does not design the course. All the sections use the same labs.

He speaks to the board and himself.He nice only to local students. Grading is illogical.if international student dont take his class. knows stuffs but bad at teaching. lots of extra credits. Attendance has marks. suitable for undergrads.needs more experience. But flexible with deadlines.

Worst class at Ohio State. He takes the material too seriously for an intro computer class that wont be used unless you're a MIS or CSE major. His grading is unfair, basically gives terrible partial credit on exams/quizzes/labs. Everything is handwritten which  makes it way unfair. Take a different professor.
His swag is off the charts.  Attendance mandatory.  Prelabs take forever.  But he prepares you well for the exams and quizzes.  He also gives out extra credit throughout the course.  He's awesome.

Naeem seems to be the go-t0 cse intstructor, don't let that silly name fool you he speaks american and he speaks it well. just do the practice problems and go to class and you can pull it off. i believe in you guys, good luck fellow students of higher education!
He is so strict that two attendence sheets per class. Too much pre-lab...
Did a good job. Nice slides and exams were fair.
As opposed to all of the other professors who teach this course and only give homework and exams, he gave labs. I liked that a lot especially for a computer networking course.

He didn't design the course and was supposed to follow what another professor responsible for the course set up. Lectures were done by the other professor and available online. These were ok. He made the material clearer in class and the in-class exercises helped a lot. He made the term project much easier than the write-up made it out to be.

Did a very good job. Slides are valuable. Lecture was not boring. He can keep your attention throughout. We had a whole lab as extra credit. First Exam was tough, but the Final was no problem. I would definitely take him again.

Post said: "only have classes with him when you're about to graduate". Dude, read the posts on here. He teaches everything from CSE200 and CSE201 all the way to 700 level courses. The guy knows the material.

Not so much in this course. The extra credits were very helpful, exams were fair, and he was available in office hours a lot. Much better experience this time around.

Most people don't rate this guy because you only have classes with him when you're about to graduate. worst teacher i've ever had, ends sentences with things like "...what do you think?...anyone know this?...anyone interested in learning this?" constantly talks to himself and doesn't know the answers to questions when asked about material in class
Gave a lot of EC. At least when you teaches this class he gives a lot of cool labs. The other profs don't give labs. Just boring homework. I did learn a lot in this course.
The guy was teaching 4 courses during the quarter and did pretty darn good I think. Probably why he turned in grades when they were due on Monday. How can you knock a guy because you are impatient?

I was in the same class as you. How were the exams tougher because it was open book/open notes??? The questions were much easier than the HW and were right out of the notes if you came to class. He even had a problem right from the HW where he gave you answers. Did you come to class???

He is more than Ok. He is excellent. I tried taking this class with another professor and it was disasterous. I also had him for another class and he is definitely much better than the other profs. You will learn the material with him.

He is an ok teacher. He is very interested in teaching but doesn't get the material across very clearly. Also, the exams are open book and notes, but they are harder and longer than necessary. Also, I think he has to get President Gee's signature in order to give out the final grades, it took forever.
Does so much better than all the other profs. Material is much more understandable.

His teaching style is way better than so many other professors. He wants you to come to class and learn. He is able to present material clearly. Those who don't see this either don't come to class or got a bad grade because you didn't study. Extra credits help out a lot and provide an incentive for you to come to class. Overall great.
For CSE200, he gives us extra credits, which are really great!

CSE200 demands a lot of studying time if you want an A+. READ THE BOOK, PRACTICE and PRACTICE! That's how I got my A. DON'T come late to class, he made all announcements + xtra credit in the first 5 mins of class & won't repeat them. Course notes need to be updated since the pt slides aren't in the exact same order. Did give us a curve. He's good!
Good teacher.  Was kind of rude to some people who asked silly questions.  He was very good at explaining everything tho and I think overall, he did a very good job!

Those who give this guy a bad rating are just plain stupid because they probably didn't study and didn't put in the effort to get a bad grade in the end. This is guy is communicates clearly at a great level of difficulty. Slides are awesome. Lots of extra credit. He rewards those who attend. He wants you to get an A in the course. Plain and simple.

Class is hard and demands a lot of your time, but he doesn't really design the class.  I've compared his class with other instructors, and I'd say he's the better one.  Very patient guy and very helpful during his office hours.

The material is pretty standard across all sections. Homework and labs are easy As and the midterm and final were straightforward. Attendance is not mandatory, but Shareef gives extra credit for coming and for doing extra assignments. I'd definitely take him over Bair as her class struggled to understand the material more than ours.

I previously reviewed this professor that I'd taken 670 with him and went on to take 660. The class material was rather dry, but all in all it was presented in a rather interesting manner. I enjoy his style of teaching. he offers frequent extra credit if you attend class, and if you're not getting an A, show up to class.I would recommend this prof.
Was very helpful and clear when explaining material. Don't know why people give him bad ratings at all, very good instructor. Just do the work and you'll be fine.

Professor did a great job of explaining the material.  Homework is not graded but necessary to do well on the weekly quizzes.  Provides an opportunity for an extra credit project.  Overall a nice guy and very helpful.  Grading will depend on the grader however.

Very Clear & Concise. Overall a great professor. I would take another class taught by him as I've learned a great deal. I signed up for CSE 660 for Wi10 simply because he was teaching it. Don't take the CSE 200 reviews to heart, that class is rough and those are non-cse students. Take this professor if you can.
Very good professor and very helpful. Just do the work and study and you'll be just fine. If you need help he is in his office and helps with your problems. Great!

Labs take forever--mostly busy work. He, and his TA's take the material and class to seriously. Must sign attendance sheet twice, before and after break. They are all sticklers, makes the material harder than it is, desperatly trying to make the class seem that it is the most important course in your entire college career! DUMB!
I got the impression that he does not care for business students. Seems like they are not up to his "standards". Lots of work. Overall bad. Attendance is taken, but not worth anything.
tough materials! Needs A LOT OF PRACTICE to get an A!

Material is hard if your not use to computers. Pre-labs take forever. Listen to the guy cause he says whats going to be on the tests. he always encouraged participation and visiting him during office hours.

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!! No Integrity!! Told me straight to my face that if I was within 5 points of a grade and I attended every class he would bump me up. I was within 5 points at the end of the class and I emailed him and he told me he never said that. Class is not that bad, but Shareef is flat out TERRIBLE.

Horrible. He made you feel like you didn't know anything and if you had a question, he treated you like you were dumb for not knowing. The quizes and tests are really hard and he grades unfairly. You need the book and course notes so buy them.

Attendance is taken twice in the two-hour lecture and doesn't count (unless in borderline cases at the end of the quarter--not sure if that's true yet).  Not very interesting to listen to, but he's very upfront about what he expects of you.  Buy the book and course notes.  Class is designed as a weed-out.  Expect 2-5 hours of pre-lab work each week
He was extremely helpful and nice to me. His tests are definitely harder than others, but I don't have that much problem. Just do the practice problems and review sheets and you'll be fine.

This professor is excellent. Probably the best I have had yet. His lectures are so clear that I did not even purchase the book for this class. Whenever I had something I didn't understand, I went to him during his very open office hours and he was extremely helpful. Don't listen to anyone who tells you this guy isn't amazing.

Lectures are boring and not helpful, he drones on for two straight hours. I didn't think the class was that hard though, he does provide a ton of practice problems in the course notes which is nice and helps very much. I'd say try and get a different professor.
HORRIBLE professor. Listen to all other reviews about him. Very boring, condescending, and rude. His grading rules are very unfair.

Material itself is rough because they dont let you use Computer for quizes/exams.  all hand-written answers.This guys is rude, has an arrogant demeanor, and comes off as a know-it-all.  Makes you feel stupid if you as him questions. Material is tough, but Shareef doesnt help nor make it worse. This is just a hard weed-out class.

horrible professor, if you ask a question during lecture either A.) he does not aknowlage you or B.) he responds to your question by telling you that you should already know it and does not help.  he is not helpful at all and grades very hard.  he does not care about his students, TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR
The class itself and the labs are ridiculously hard.  He does a pretty good job explaining and he's nice.  It's a difficult class, he doesn't make the material any harder or easier.

I attended several review sessions taught by other Profs. and they stated that material required by Shareef on quizes is unnecessary. Has TA's grade very hard and takes attendance even though it counts nothing towards grade. TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR!

I liked this professor well enough until the very end. I had an A- average and got a C+ on the final. This was mainly due to the length of the exam. Half of the class, 70 people, were still working when time was up. He made no attempt to curve the exam or round up grades that were within tenths of a point. Just keep this in mind.

One word BORING.  Lectures suck.  If you can take this class online DO IT! He isn't a bad guy, willing to help if you need it, but the best thing to do to learn is doing the labs.  Going to lecture is a waste of time except on Quiz and Exam days!
Not very fair or practical. Is a stickler when he dosen't have to be and takes the class way to seriously.
Nothing else needed to be said about Painter but what a teacher! Love his teaching style and how he teaches the course.
Great professor, actually cares about students and is very fair
Awesome professor, very caring
the goat of profs at osu. Extremely considerate cares a lot for students.
He is the best.

BEST professor for CSE no doubt. Exams are easy if you watch the video and do homework. Super chill and accept late work. HW are effort based and always harder than actual exam. Nick is super approachable and always willing to help. 10000/10 recommand.

Nick is the best professor in the CSE department by far, probably the best professor at OSU. He cares so much about his students and is also a genius when it comes to all things data structures and algorithms. His lectures are super easy to understand and funny, but the videos and notes he created are also insane if you don't want to go to lecture.

He is a good professor, but he talks too fast and assigns a lot of homework, which makes me confused and always behind. I dropped one semester with him, and the other semester, I got a D. Nick is a pretty nice guy; he gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. for me, the material he provided was too much and overwhelming, leading to confusion.

Great professor. Flipped classroom, consisted of about 2-3 homeworks due each week. Two midterms and a final. If you watch lectures, do homeworks, and study a decent amount for exams you will do good.

I didn't even have painter for CSE 2331but his youtube videos were the only reason that I was able to do so good in my foundations class. Painter is an amazing professor and explains the content so well.
Honestly one of the best professors with explaining confusing topics in a easy to understand way. Just watch lectures and complete homework assignments and exams are just like the homeworks.
GOAT of the department
Excellent!!!!! Really enjoy the classes!!!

Nick is the best around. He assigns lecture videos to watch before each class, then you work on the homework in class with peers and ask questions. Homeworks are very reasonable but informative. Exams cover the material very fairly. Nick is incredibly compassionate and understands the stress of being in college. Thanks for a great semester, Nick!

The best of the best. He teaches flipped-classroom style, with lecture videos on Youtube and homework done in class. There are three homeworks a week, but they're not too hard and he is happy to help in class and in office hours. He teaches in a very clear and easy to understand way, and is very fair with regards to exams.

Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. Personally, the content was still hard for me, but he would make sure to go above and beyond for his students. Recommend chatting with him in office hours, something I wish I did more of! Don't skip class though, it's important to do homework in class to make sure you are aware of what's going on
I would literally pay double tuition to have Nick teach all of my classes.
Best professor in the CSE department. Teaches in a very systematic and consistent way which makes difficult content very easy to learn. Truly cares about his students as well.
Always matches his shirt with his mask!
Best professor ever.

Before the semester I saw his rating here and thought "No way he has a perfect rating". But there's a reason for it. Probably the best professor I have ever had (and will ever have). He's very good at teaching the material and really makes sure we can understand it. I wish he could teach every course I take, he is seriously an incredible professor.

One of the best lecturers at OSU, hands-down. Homeworks are collaborative & not too difficult if you pay attention in class, exams feel very fair, and he's easy to reach on Discord if you need help. We did a flipped-classroom style which gave a lot of flexibility to lecture attendance

Nice and accomodating. 

Homeworks are harder than quizzes and exams.

Vote for flipped classroom model, this way he has much more time to help you on hw.
Professor Painter was incredible and genuinely the best professor I've had. The only reason I didn't do better in his class was my own lack of effort, not anything he did.

Nick makes Foundations really interesting and easy to understand! He cares a lot about his students and goes out of his way to help them succeed in any way he can. I really appreciate his passion and knowledge on the subject - he knows what he's talking about and wants to help students understand why what we're learning is useful.

Stud. He presents class material in a way that will actually help you understand data structures rather than just math. Beyond the course topics though, he clearly wants to see everyone succeed and is very helpful.
The GOAT, nuff said

Nick was a lovely prof to have, I would highly recommend! He is extremely knowledgeable and talented at communicating pretty complex topics in an easy-to-understand manner. His empathy and genuine passion for teaching are palpable. He uses Discord and is extremely available to students in and out of class, and always kept everything fun!
Wish this guy taught all CSE classes at OSU

Easily the best professor I have ever had. Is empathetic towards students having an actual life outside classes. Great at explaining course content, and if you do not understand something, Nick will go out of his way to help you.
Literally the best professor Ive ever had.

amazing professor, tries his absolute best to help his students understand the material. foundations 2 is a hard class but professor painter provides a multitude of resources for students to do well on exams.
Nick is one of the best professors out there. He teaches his class in a way that makes even the worst concepts seem easy. 10/10 would take any class with him

Took during SP20 online. Class consisted of lecture videos and office hours. Lecture videos are extremely concise and to the point, but some videos are a bit vague in certain areas, however, office hours helped fill in those gaps of understanding and expanded upon concepts. Hosted AMAs and non-academic things to help de-stress students.

If you can't pass the class with Nick Painter you won't pass. He is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. He has personally constructed hundreds of YouTube videos to explain the concepts of the class. His course is designed in favor of your success. He's also just a friendly and, consequently, very approachable guy in general.

If OSU had a Professor Painter to teach every class it would be a tower casting a shadow over every university in the world. Build your entire schedule around getting into one of his sections and enjoy some real learning.

I can confidently say that Nick is the best professor I have ever had. Had him for foundations 1 and he made that class a great learning experience that was not overtly stressful or difficult despite that misconception that older students had lead me to believe that class would be. Taking him for foundations 2 right now and feel the same way.

Real nice guy. Cares about students and knows how it actually feels to be in college. Only catch though is the probabilistic analysis portion of class was tough and took up the majority of one midterm and the final which made them difficult.
Nice professor, but exams are tricky.

Awesome professor! Really cares about students and their success. The textbook he uses is unnecessary to purchase for this class and I've learned so much more from him than from the actual book. Really interested in adapting to student's needs. One time, I told him that the pacing was too fast and he shortened the lectures to accommodate.

Just the best dude, tries so hard for his students, cares tremendously, and offers a multitude of resources. That being said, while his homework and quizzes are not bad, 2331 is still a hard class so don't let the midterms pass you by because they're not easy. 10/10 professor.

foundations II is known as the hardest cse class at osu but he made it my favorite class all semester. the first half of the course is harder than the second half. exams are fair. homework and quizzes are harder than exams. he will go to great lengths to help you succeed. he really cares about his students. i wish i could have him again.

TAKE. THIS. PROFESSOR!! For either foundations 1 or 2, this is the guy you want teaching you. SUPER super caring, and amazing lectures. Gets points across easily and is ALWAYS accessible to help you if you need it! The absolute best professor I've had at OSU so far. I cannot recommend him enough, an absolute god tier professor.
The best teacher I've ever meet in my life. He is passionate about teaching and he really cares about students (both in your study but also in your life). You will enjoy the time on his classes.
This professor is always willing to help you learn. Whether it is in office hours or after class he is always willing to help guide you in the right direction.
Passionate, engaging professor, never a dull lecture. Genuinely cares about his students learning the material. Tests not bad, homework is reasonable amount and graded reasonably.
Does a lot of examples in class so you know how to do questions.
Foundations I- amazing lectures.
