The best professor! Take his course and than you got A. Some question (only one or two in one exam and not counted much point) may be hard but most of problems is pretty and pretty easy. I end with total point 98.3/100 and the average point of the final is over 90 point.

Painter is a really chill guy. He has passions outside of the classroom which he finds an excellent way to put into his lectures and apply to the topic at hand. He handles a lot of things really well. Definitely take the class with him.
He handled the transition to online the best of all my professors this semester by being ridiculously available to help us through it. Great teacher, great person and 100% recommend him to anyone.

Painter is the only professor that made me enjoy learning CSE. His enthusiasm and kindness is really something I would never find anywhere else and visiting his office hours was not intimidating at all. He also gets frustrated at himself if he felt like he didn't teach it right, so you know he really cares about his teaching!

I can't say enough good things about this guy. I was a bit scared going in cuz I knew he was new but Holy cow. A breath of fresh air compared to the other CSE professors. Clear grading criteria, clear lectures, and SUPER detailed lecture notes if you miss any content. No way would've been able to understand the material this well with anyone else.

Best professor Ive ever had. Lectures were carefully thought out and the exams were extremely straightforward. He posts very detailed notes and examples online to supplement the lectures throughout the year that are very helpful.
Funny professor, knowledgeable and really good at teaching the course material. A bit of a tough grade but still fair. He is secretly evil tho, I still rock with him, but he has malice in his soul.

Midterms were challenging but in my opinion Software 2 is an inherently difficult class. Amazing professor and lecturer. Very accessible during office hours/after class and genuinely wants to see his students succeed.

He is such a fun professor and he makes the class laugh every lecture. The main downside is that his exams were difficult (more than other sections) and graded very strictly. Otherwise, I had a great time in his class. His prerecorded lectures have questionable audio but they're pretty good. Still remember when he crashed the groupme for his class

Similar sentiment to other review. Excellent teacher -- if you are looking for a professor that will genuinely help you learn concepts and show you real industry application of them, this is your guy. Also hilarious. However, exams and grading were definitely rough -- my first non-A here at Ohio State. Felt that studying provided marginal returns.

Zaccai is funny and gives good lectures, but the course is really hard. He moves quite fast in lectures with the notes and the TAs grade quite harshly with the homework. The exams are difficult too. He does provide some online material which is decent, but lectures and office hours are crucial. Good professor but get ready to do a lot of work.

Great prof! Exam medians for my section were 64-73, but imo the questions were mostly fair. I am salty I did not get an A- tho. :( I believe that the curve is only to ensure that the class median is a B-/B, so do not expect much of a curve. Number 1 advice: show up to class and go to office hours.

Lectures: He makes the dry slideshows enjoyable (his humor isn't for everyone tho).
Labs: Same as SW1.
Projects: Pretty difficult and TAs grade harsh, but most of the time you'll be fine as long as u ask questions.
Exams: Really difficult with minimal curve. Although I enjoyed the class, I failed cuz of exams. Gives barely any partial credit.
i hated this professor
Diego is one of the best lecturers I've met. He makes boring slideshows funny and really tries to connect with his students. He's a tough grader but you'll learn a ton by talking things out with him.
Exams were extremely difficult, and the curve was minimal. Humor was used in a degrading fashion.

The version of 3341 he teaches (Michael Bond's curriculum) is really difficult, but I feel like I learned a lot from it. Keeps lecture interesting and worthwhile to go to. Cares about students and is easily accessible outside of class. Projects are graded objectively on how many test cases they pass, so it's easy to get a low grade if you mess up
Was skeptical at first because of his humor, but was actually a great lecturer. Keeps content entertaining and is always willing to explain more complicated topics in depth.

Professor Zaccai is first and foremost a teacher and cares about the success of his students. He makes the dry slides of the OSU Software sequence bearable and always clarifies when students are stuck. The exams are tough, but the class is curved to compensate if the grades are especially rough.
Nice guy and a decent lecturer. Exams were very diffcult however, and there was not much curve.

I think Prof Zaccai was very funny and entertaining and great at teaching the material. My only real complaint is that the exams were for the most part very very difficult. The class was curved though which helps. (unrelated - Rate My Professor needs to increase their word limit!)
I enjoy this professor a lot, he makes content that would be hard to pay attention to more engaging by cracking the occasional dad joke.

I found professor Zaccai to be a good lecturer due to his humor and knowledge of the material. However, his midterms and final were unbearable due to their difficulty. I had good marks on the projects with my partner but the exams tanked my grade. We were expected to memorize and write lines of code from the projects without prior warning.

Very knowledgeable prof with a good sense of humor. A little intimidating at first, but he's super nice and is always willing to clarify and answer questions. Definitely speak up in lecture or go to office hours when you need clarification. I do wish he would make the midterms easier since this class is rough grade wise.

Did not care my partner didn't participate in group projects leaving me to do all the work. Most of the class stopped showing up to class by the end of the semester because lectures were difficult to actually learn anything from due to half the class being dry sarcastic humor between the prof and students.

Diego is extremely knowledgeable, funny, and caring. His dry sense of humor can make him intimidating, especially in a large group setting, but he was nothing but kind when answering questions and interacting with students individually. His exams are challenging but the overall class is set up to be graded very fairly, and he usually curves!

Had him for software 2 and really enjoyed him as a professor. Probably the funniest instructor I've ever had and uses that humor to help keep students focused. Also super knowledgeable in general, really glad I got him as a professor.

Zaccais lectures were a true joy to attend, he had a great energy about every subject and I regret not participating more. The class is tough, but just attending lectures and office hours as needed will get you through it. Ignore all comments about drinking students tears online, every interaction I had with him was fantastic.

Don't let his sarcasm scare you; he genuinely cares about his students and his humor will grow on you. It's not often that you have a professor who can provide insight that is useful outside of the classroom either, so attend class. Lastly, the material can be difficult depending on your prior knowledge.

Just had a test with him today. He did not remotely prepare us for it in that it was extremely time constraining. He makes annoying dumb jokes to cover up his attitude and poor teaching style. I did probably fine on the test, but the practice midterm took about half the time or less than the real deal so nobody knew they needed to rush that much.
Cool guy! Only catch, really hard tests. Take only if you already know a lot of things in advance
Man uses Linux over Windows. Zaccai is the real deal
He does tell jokes, but they are all offensive and makes students feel dumb. Tests are difficult. Most time consuming class I ever taken. Avoid if you have any social life.

He is the worst professor I ever had. He doesn't care about your grade and will tank your GPA easily with his hard quizzes and his difficult structure. His lectures aren't interactive and don't correspond to the actual tests. Don't want a bad grade don't take him.

Dr. Zaccai is one of the better, if not best professors in the CSE department. His lectures get you where you need to go, but he's always willing to explain in detail if you have any questions and genuinely cares about his students. Tests can be tough and project grading can be strange, but he usually curves to make up for it.

Very annoying professor! He makes impossible quizzes and doesn't explain anything well in his prerecorded lectures, which are boring due to them not being live or in person. One of the most difficult professors I ever had. Avoid him to save your GPA from sinking

Diego is very annoying and not a good professor at all. His async lecture videos are way too long and filled with info that is irrelevant to the class. He jokes around too much and tells offensive jokes. He also makes tests hard on purpose to fail as many students as possible. Don't take this guy. He doesn't care about anyone's grade.

Not an easy professor. His quizzes are insanely difficult and he has Proctorio enabled on for all of them. Like other reviews, he spends too much time socializing and getting too close to students that he forgets he is supposed to be teaching us what we need to know. Avoid if you care about your grade.
Zaccai seems like a good person, but he is very sarcastic during lectures. In these lectures he is boring and reads fron the slides without doing any additional explanation of minor concepts.

Such a good professor. Willing to help at any cost. I am so sorry for cheating and sincerely sorry for making you write coam case for me and I am truly sorry for making you spend time write my coam case. Hope you can forgive me for using GitHub repository homeworks. Stay safe, happy, and humble. Thanks.

He flat out did not handle online learning well. Lectures are asynchronous and hard to keep up compared to live lectures or in person classes. Labs are synchronous but you can get sidetracked with him joking around too much. The quizzes are also difficult so be prepared to do a lot of work for this class.

Very easy to get a long with. Answers most of your questions. Advises people about the class. Not really a strict professor. You just need to know what you are doing and there shouldn't be any problem.
Hard to understand. Lectures are asynchronous and they tend to be long. Quizzes are difficult.

Diego is by far the best professor I had on OSU so far. Diego is accommodating and helpful and willing to find alternatives if you have busy schedule. Unique guy that loves to connect with students. I enjoyed my time in his class.

Hes lenient and curves his class. Make sure you study well and hard for the quizzes. Diego is fun to interact with and he likes to mess with students on Piazza and Discord with his jokes. I think hes different than the other professors and hes one of a kind. Make sure to ask him questions if needed. he will sometimes lecture in Spanish for fun.

Diego is caring and social. He calls people out in class and you can start a conversation with him. Very approachable and kind. If you like easy professor and want some enjoyment, then pick him because he will best suit you for that.
Diego is sweet and kind and I love him. His irony makes this class fun and enjoyable. Diego is very comfortable and easy to talk to. He is relax guy and just wants to have fun.

He's pretty knowledgeable on the content matter and knows his stuff. Zaccai will try his best to explain things for you to understand. Loves to joke around every once in a while. I recommend him to take for every course, he will make you enjoy. He always has something to laugh about and learn from him.

His class isn't that hard. If you study for his online quizzes and do well, then I'm pretty sure you can get an A in his class. The projects are easier and they are done with a partner. The homework is just for effort so you can just try your best and will get full credit. The labs/Piazza are just for participation and the most easiest points.

Diego is pretty chill and you can talk to him like your regular average friend. He talks and mess with students in a very nice way. Diego is outgoing, so don't be shy. He's very energetic and cool. I wish I had him in my foundation 2 class. I'll miss his sense of humor and a professor like no other.

He has many respects from other students. Easy to get a long with and you can talk to him about anything really. He's humorous as to everyday in class he will say something hilarious. Easy on the inside and will answer any questions on anywhere honestly. I realized he's open with people and shares info about himself. Overall, I recommend him.

Very cool and nice professor. He is willing to help you at any cost if you ask him questions. Very funny and has a nice personality. He truly cares for his students that he reminds them not to copy from GitHub. He will reach out to people who dont understand the material and help them out. I am truly SORRY for the people that makes you not happy.

His class is basically has just asynchronous lectures and labs on zoom. I think he isn't a good teacher in the online format in this class. He tends to go off topic a lot. Your basically on your own and will have to teach/understand yourself if you want to do well. You should possibly not pick him if you really want to learn this class with teacher

Professor Zaccai actually cares about his students. He has a very funny personality and he's very personable. The class is not the easiest, but Professor Zaccai ACTUALLY cares about his students so you can always ask him questions and 99% of the time he will be very helpful in helping you understand.

He is a bit hard professor on the quizzes and doesn't mind to take off points. He tends to easily go off topic too easily during lab time. He's more relaxed and very chill guy and it seems like he's a helpful guy and will just act like your regular friend. He literally follows students on social media and communicates with without office hours.

Zaccai has very rough quizzes, but it is definitely possible to do well, if not very well, in all of them. He takes the time to edit his asynchronous lectures, so they tend to be short and sweet as effective compliments to the slides. He has a great sense of humor, and he definitely handled online class far better than others in the CSE department.

Would not recommend to take if you aren't the best in Java. He will get you lost and tend to go off topic a lot. He is not the best professor, but if you know the material very well. Then I'm sure you'll do well in his class. If you are a beginner, I would definitely prefer Heym or Wolf over him. Zaccai is a bit more stickler and has trick question

Diego is super fun and an overall amazing professor. His humor is an acquired taste sometimes, but you can tell he does care about his students (even when he jokes around saying that he collects students' tears.) A solid choice for Software II and Foundations. However, everyone can agree that the use of Proctorio is TOO much!

He doesn't really teach the material very good. If your good at teaching yourself then you shouldn't have problem with him. However, STEER CLEAR if you're trying to literally learn from, because he will just joke around most of the lab. Lectures are asynchronous.

There are definitely better options than him out there. He makes the material much more difficult than it needs to be. Proctorio quizzes are difficult and there is no expectation of privacy while taking them. Also, his sarcasm is kinda annoying. All in all, stay away at all costs if possible.

I would personally not recommend him at all. He goes off long tangents and talks about himself. He also jokes around too much and doesn't explain the material very thorough. Instead, he discusses his biography and talks about different stuff that isn't related to the class.
Very annoying and teacher. Made the material much harder than it needed to be. Change to a different professor if you can.

Very hard professor. His exams are way too difficult for the material itself. Takes points off quickly if you miss minor mistakes. Most people in the class got really low score on online quizzes. He has Proctorio enabled on all quizzes which is annoying extension to have in your browser and no privacy while recording. Stay away if you want an A!!!!

The exam averages were pretty tough this semester (think 60-low 70s) depending on the tests. Other than that, Diego is extremely bright and a star, IMO. He is funny and cares about his students. He is sarcastic in a manner that reminds me of Greggory House, but he makes time for all of his students which is unlike Gregory.

The class didnt transfer to online only well. Theres no feedback on homeworks or labs and the quiz material is entirely different from the projects. Some of the quiz material was similar to the homework but considering theres no feedback its hard to know what you did right or wrong. Kiel is prob a better choice

Diego was a hilarious and perhaps the most helpful professor Ive had at OSU. He gives great feedback and is incredibly helpful. The downside of Foundation 2 with him is there are A LOT of assignments to include programming assignments. They were very helpful, but if you arent ready for the extra work you might be better off with another professor

Incredibly charismatic and engaging lecturer-- funny, too. He did a really good job even with everything online and clearly cares about education. Grading was sometimes a bit rough (2-3%+ on exam for a single MC question), but he more than makes up for it in other areas!
Overall super nice guy and a really passionate teacher; would definitely recommend/take again
Excellent lecturer and enjoyable class. The written exams are quite difficult and his grading is difficult, but the content is similar to the practice exams. Overall, good but difficult class.

Professor Zaccai is great. Even with transforming to online lectures (COVID), the quality of lectures was still good. Tough grader, the in-person exams are lengthy and unforgiving, but doable. Class supposedly has a nice curve though. Projects aren't hard if you understand the material. Overall made dry material very interesting.
Zaccai is one of the best professors in the department. His lectures were hilarious and he knew the material well. The exams are tough, but fairly graded.

Zaccai is a funny guy. There are easier professors, but there are also harder professors (supowit). Zaccai is not an easy grader, but he's definitely fair. The content of the class was varied and I enjoyed it overall.
tough grader

Diego is a great lecturer. He doesn't use the slides very much during class. Rather, he knows the material very well and is very prepared. He does lecture pretty much from memory on the chalkboard. Despite his joking about "staying young by drinking students' tears after exams," he cares about his students and is available outside of class to help.

Funniest professor I've ever had--made this difficult class bearable. The class isn't easy by any measure, but with him, you're at least prepared for the tough exams and homework. And he's also really accessible for office hours or via Piazza to answer questions. Homework is time-consuming, but isn't impossible like some other CS classes.
The course was incredibly hard. He was helpful during office hours and pretty funny in class but I am sure there are other good professors that grade more leniently that you could take.
Nice person, has fun with teaching. Grading leans towards the tough/rigorous.
He makes some awesome jokes. I promise if you make it to the Red/Black trees section of the course his jokes will not disappoint. Unless youre PC, then youll cry.

Have his own sense of "humor"... Also in sw2, I think to get good grade you need to look the slides before class because he goes through the content really fast. Fair exam content, a little harsh on projects. Also there is an about 3.5% curve on my session.

Sarcastic. Beneath the hilarity is a man willing to mark your exam if even a single word is off. Don't expect any credit back. No bargain. Otherwise, He is hilarious and a fun professor. Programming Assignments were from the slides. HWs were easy enough.

Great professor; one of the best I've had at Ohio State. Funny, engaging, and knowledgeable. Teaches in a straightforward manner, and assignments and midterms are very reasonable. Would highly recommend.

This was a difficult class, but Diego made the lectures entertaining and the grading was pretty fair. I would definitely recommend him as a professor. The first exam was tough, but the class was curved and I learned the material well.

This my second time having Diego as a professor and don't have any good things to say about him. He has decent lectures where he over-utilizes sarcasm in attempt to be funny. He grades exams harshly which are heavily-weighted in his courses. Sometime he comes off rude in class/office hours. I would look into other professors before taking him.
He cares about what he teaches and makes the material fun during lecture. Best part, if you do not understand what is going on during lecture, then he will help you during his office hours.

Very nice and funny guy. The only person on earth who can put 5 sarcastic jokes into 1 sentence. Has a sadistic side as well. A bit tough, but the lectures are never boring. I would strongly recommend!
Best lecturer I have ever met so far. He is humorous, handsome and inspirational. He explains things very clearly during class. Would definitely take again.
I think it was first year teaching, but he didn't know what he was teaching and gave the wrong examples during class multiple times! Harsh grader and barely gives any partial credit :(
Great lecturer. He's clear and humorous during lecture. Very likely to help after class and gives good feedback. If you follow him during lecture, everything shouldn't be hard. Highly recommend.

Meh. His failed attempts at humor irritated me more than anything, and his lectures just weren't clear enough for me or other classmates to comprehend. I'd recommend him if you have no better options.

Okay professor. He explains things decently and is helpful during office hours. Beware: he makes his TAs grade projects harsher than other sections, then says there is a curve at the end. Don't expect a large curve (ours was 1%). The curve is set so the final median class grade is an 80 (half the class get's C+ or below). This is normal for CSE2221

This was the first time he taught this class. He tried his best to make himself clearly in the class. But he always made mistakes. He was willing to help everyone. And his office hour was really useful. He gave a curve.

He tries very hard to be helpful and is very nice and funny.  Since this was his first time teaching this class, the lectures were pretty hard to follow and the homework and tests were difficult.  He put a generous curve at the end of the class though, so he's an alright option for this class, but I definitely had to put a ton of time into it.

He's just alright. Funny funny guy so if you like some jokes and entertainment in your lectures this might be for you, but the lectures arent anything special and if you struggle to understand the material you could get lost fast. He's willing to help outside of class, is approachable, and does care, but the actual helpfulness is iffy.
fun teacher. had him for 2321. told alot of jokes. has spanish accent but can still hear fine. not an easy professor but you'll definitely learn

This professor once wrote a personalized email to me, answering a very specific question I had... at 2 am the night before the final. He answered my question and wished me good luck.  That's all you need to know.

Really funny and enjoys teaching. He has a lot of office hours for questions which wsa nice. The tests can be hard but if you go to office hours to clear up questions and review the slides and projects you can do alright on the tests. Also make sure to pick a good partner becuase the projects can take a while to do if you don't have a good partner

He is very sarcastic and funny. Really knows his stuff and makes the lectures interesting. Class is difficult but manageable. Make sure you get a good partner for the projects because you will have to work with them all semester.
this guy's tests are impossible

He seems like a nice person but his lectures are really boring. They are all in a really monotonous tone which makes it hard to pay attention. His midterms are difficult and it's important to study if you want to do even remotely well on them. Overall projects weren't too hard, and the grading for them depends on your TAs.

Overall a very nice dude. He is always willing to answer questions and clearly wants you to succeed. Allows you to have a notecard on all exams as well. The class itself is somewhat difficult but he is a great teacher!!
I dropped out

Deeply knowledgable of course material and very open to answering any questions you have. Lectures are very clear and concise, though expect a good amount of homework. Although grading is somewhat strict it is nonetheless quite fair. Exams are also very fair; as long as you put the time into labs/homeworks/etc this can be a very fulfilling class!

He's a nice person, always willing to help, and often provides extra study resources. His grading is fair. The course content, slides, and assignments are all department-designed, so there's not much to comment on. The exams get progressively harder, but overall they're reasonable and within the standard range.

"Tough but fair" is the best description I can give. The course itself is hard, and if you fall behind on lectures you will struggle. However, Grupa is helpful if you ask questions in class or during labs. Sometimes he delivers the lectures monotonously, but he still understands the material and will help you understand it too if you need help.

Lectures are kind of boring, but he gets the job done and is open to questions. He might not always give the best feedback, but he's always open to questions. Exams weren't that bad, just make sure to understand all the labs/lectures and you're good. TLDR: He's a good and smart guy but kind of quiet/shy

Just show up to and genuinely pay attention to lectures, and make sure you do/understand every lab and HW, and you should be fine. It's borderline useless to study for any exams if you just do these two things, because they're pretty much all you need to understand everything on the exams. He's always willing to explain anything that's confusing.
He's generally very helpful, although he can be a bit intimidating at first.  Asking questions about the projects is very helpful as well.

Professor Grupa is a nice professor, although somewhat dry. He and the TAs are always willing to answer questions about projects, so completing them early can be very helpful for grading as attention to detail is important. I found the exams he wrote to be somewhat difficult, so make sure to study for them if you want to do well.

Prof Grupa cares a lot about his students and was very approachable during the semester make sure to have good time management and get the projects done ahead of time to ask Prof questions at office hours

He's okay, he speaks in the most monotone voice ever and he's not super fun, but once or twice a semester he will be in a good mood and say the funniest thing you've ever heard as if he didn't just decimate your GPA on the last exam.
Very good teacher.

In the words of Gus Fring, "Acceptable." He tries his best. Good enough at teaching the course. He is more willing to help than he seems to be. Offers a pretty pure software 2 experience. Doesn't make anything easier or harder than it needs to be.

He's a good professor, knowledgable on the content of the course, and is willing to answer questions. A little bit intimidating at first, but tests were relatively straightforward and graded fairly. Lectures are pretty boring, but get the job done.
Great lecturer, willing to help outside of class, and an "A" grade is obtainable in this course.
He's okay, he tries. I almost fell asleep during 50% of his lectures, all of his lecture is in a single tone, and classes were boring. Exams were okay though, not terribly hard.
Man's got a more bland voice than Justin Bieber

The class isnt easy by any stretch of the imagination, yet it is still doable. The lectures are prerecorded. Adam does a great job presenting the material and explaining the concepts. The quizzes arent easy, best advice I can give is read the question carefully and relook at the slides and labs before attempting the quiz. Would recommend!!

Hardest CSE class I have ever taken until now. The projects are fine however this class is based on tests not based on projects. Took this class online and quizzes make up 60% of your grade. You really need to think during the quiz because some of the answers can't be found on the lecture slides. There will be a lot of coding questions. Not enjoy.

The older reviews seem like it's a different person. The class was essentially without a professor, the labs were all done alone and all the lectures are pre-recorded. Anytime he would be asked questions he gave back a grumpy response. The quizzes were absurdly difficult. The TAs carried the class

Do not take him. Please don't. His quizzes are extremely difficult and timed, so it's very very hard to do well on them and they make up a lot of your grade. I had him on line and he required cameras to be OFF, so I never saw him or any of my classmates, which made working together on labs difficult. He was unapproachable and didn't explain well

Quizzes were so difficult considering how little time you got, and complexity of the questions. One time I attended his office hours to ask a question about lecture. He didn't like my question so he made someone else explain to me. Never attended another office hour again. Take advantage of TA's if you are in his class.

I had Adam's class online. His labs were very frustrating because he does not require labs to be checked off and does not allow cameras to vie on, which makes it hard to work with other classmates, and know if you are doing labs correctly. He does though give detailed lectures which helps a lot and is very open to help in office hours

I had Grupa fall 2020 so it was all online. His lectures were very well put together and he was good at explaining harder concepts. You're gonna have to study well for the quizzes since they're timed and a good percentage of the final grade. Sometimes he seems hard to approach but he has the best intentions and cares for his students success.

The quizes are the killer. You really do need to look through all the slides before the quiz. Other than that the course is pretty good, not having final saved my life cause I was about to fail another class.

I would say he is a good teacher, but I'm taking it online for this semester, and the quiz are extremely hard and short on time, you would have very limited time to do the quiz, and most of the question aren't "text book answers" in which you would have to apply a lot more on your own thinking. you would haveonly 40 mins to do extremely hard quiz.

I took the summer online COVID version of this class and was not a fan. He's kind of scary to approach in office hours and feels impatient to helping. The quizzes are also really hard like worse than exams on paper because they expect you to be cheating. I think he's an ok prof but didn't translate well to virtual in my opinion.

Professor Grupa consistently asked the class if we had questions and explained concepts further if necessary. He was reasonable with grading and accessible for help outside of class. Lectures were not the most interesting, but I think thats just the nature of the course.

Not much to say that the other responses haven't: professor Grupa can seem intimidating at first, but he is a nice guy that truly cares about the students. He's available during office hours and is happy to help. The 4.0 difficulty is if you're shooting for an A; if you just want a B or a pass, call it a 3.

He's awesome! I didn't like him at first because he seemed intimidating, but he cares a lot about his students and will go out of his way to help you. He's passionate and knowledgeable about CS, and can explain difficult concepts in a way that's easy to understand. His lectures were enjoyable and he can be pretty funny. Wish he taught more classes.

At first, he seems really intimidating but GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS and talk to him cause he's a really nice person. He's very passionate about teaching so he'll answer any question you have until he's sure you understand the material. He's also very fair in grading but make sure you know the material and pay attention to the slides in class!

He is a funny guy and is great at explaining the lecture slides. His exams are fair; not incredibly easy nor hard, and he tells you exactly what you will and won't be tested on. Generous with partial credit for exams. He also recognizes when he makes an exam harder than usual and will grade easier or make the next exam easier to compensate.

Professor Grupa is there to help you, he also does a good job of explaining the material and making sure students are following along okay. I enjoyed this class a lot because he doesn't get sidetracked and makes things as clear as possible, there are also times where he'll discuss cool events happening in the modern CSE world.

For him, there is a time to play and their is a time to study. By play, he would sometimes start lectures by going over something significant happening in the news on any given day. That being said, he still made sure that he went through everything as much as possible so students would not be left on their own and he was very accessible during of.

Grupas extremely dry. Goes through material quickly and its all conceptual. Get accustomed to strange way material is presented for 2221/31 series, the entire sequence is presented like this, exactly like this. Its a difficult class with a ton of work, and he doesn't do examples in class, you have to teach yourself how to apply nearly all of it.

Grupa initially came off as condescending, but it soon became clear that his demeanor is simply easily misconstrued as uncaring. In reality, he really cares about his students and does everything he can to help out.
Very passionate about computer science. If you attend his lectures and pay attention you'll do fine. Will take time both during and outside of class to help you.

Very knowledgeable guy, and a good teacher. Lecture was usually just going through slides, answering questions, and sometimes a funny or interesting story beforehand. I don't ask questions during class, but he created a good learning environment, and was also very helpful in office hours. Exams are hard, but he wasn't out to get you in grading.

If he does not get fired this semester, make sure you never take his class. He is basically throwing information at you that you don't understand yet and just reading off the slides. He isn't helpful in office hours either.

He's very accessible outside of class and willing to help you with the projects. His exam questions are basically what you have seen he drew out on the black board so be sure to attend the classes. Lecture can get kind of dry but he's open to questions.

Go to his office hours, they're good. If you can't, make appointments, it's probably worth it. Grading is pretty lenient, and his lectures are alright, though he often makes mistakes that students have to correct. My only big criticism is that there isn't enough practice to hone your understanding. Ask lots of questions to help with that.

Tough course, but Carpenter is by far one of the best CSE professors at OSU. He will answer your questions, delivers every lecture nicely, and prepare you for exams. He uses Piazza to answer almost, if not every, student question, allowing for really manageable projects

Dr. Carpenter is passionate about the topics that he teaches in this course and it comes across in his lectures. The homework had a fair share of difficult questions, but he had lots of office hours during the week. Tests also had a mix of easy and hard questions, but his grading made it difficult to get lower than a 70 if you have decent attempts.

Great teacher, genuinely cares about you and always willing to answer questions. Exams were fair and you're allowed to bring a cheat sheet for each one. HWs can be a little difficult, but you have a week to do them and going to office hours really helps. He posts his lectures notes online, but it's much better to understand by going to class.

He is one of the best professors that I have had in a CSE course. I feel like he's very down to earth and super approachable. I do say he really loves the material that he teaches. In my opinion he is much too smart to be teaching such a low level class but still does an extremely good job at it. I would love to have him again.

Tim gives clear lectures and is pretty easy to follow. He really enjoys teaching the material and was very helpful and receptive to questions in office hours. He grades pretty easy also if he can tell you understand the question.
All I can say is Tim.
The man the myth the legend it's tim.
I love Tim

Tim not only he made this dry course much easier. Always encouraged us to ask questions. He even dedicated some time at the start of every class for the projects. Very approachable in class or via piazza or email. Provides very detailed guidance for projects when they were assigned making the projects very easy. Midterms are not easy but fair.
Tim is a brilliant and great guy. Always happy to help and guide. Exams could be wordy/confusing at times but overall good professor. Would 100% take a class with him again.

Tim is an awesome professor. Always willing to help you debug your code during office hours. Lectures are engaging and he explains things exceptionally well. Always willing to help you if you are confused. You can tell he genuinely wants his students to succeed. The only things graded are 3 exams and 6 projects so be aware of that. 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Carpenter is a phenomenal guy and I had a fantastic semester with him. His projects can get really tough, but if you can get through those he teaches the class pretty well. His lectures are a little rambley but you will know everything for test and 80% of the things for projects if you take good notes.

A+ my fav last sem. Easy A, fun HW, kind caring friendly helpful prof, interesting material. He engages very well with student inquiry. Generous grader. Tells you exactly what he wants and how to deliver, so if you can't hack his class, pick a different major.
Knows his stuff.

Very good lecturer. Posts lectures online. Only 6 projects that build off of each other but he gives solutions after each one. Whole grade is basically just projects and 3 exams so put time into them; they are time consuming but they give good feedback on piazza. Concepts are pretty tough but he explains them very well

CSE 1223 is essentially a self-taught course. Most learning comes from Zybooks, video lectures, and labs/projects. Lectures are no more than 30 minutes, where he just briefly introduces what we will be reading. I received good feedback on assignments and he's very nice. Though I wish he were more available, and he lacks resources for more practice.
Professor Carpenter is very knowledgeable and easy going. Exams and homework are definitely challenging, but if you put in the effort and show up to class, you will succeed.

Lecture material was usually presented in a clear and easy to understand manner, despite the large amount of material. Professor was available to help with coding projects after class and during office hours and would help correct bugs and give ideas when stuck. Aside from one question, exams were fair and not too difficult.

Even though I did not go to the live lecture much, but I do like time even only through the recording, he is chill and easy-going, whenever you ask him aquestion he would respond to you, also There isn't much of homework for this class as well, yeah we need to do it with latex, but don't complain about that, latex is like the easiest thing to do.

Tim was very responsive and helpful to everyone who had questions. He does ask that you use LaTex for hw but its honestly not as bad as everyone is saying, just copy and paste lol. This guy genuinely wants you to get a good grade, and isn't stingy when it comes to giving out points. Chill and cool dude, would take again. also 10/10 cat cams

Very relaxed class, and the only homework assignments were projects that were pretty enjoyable. Exams had very few points which made it kind of hard to get a really good grade but he was a very lenient grader so it was also difficult to do really poorly. Seemed like a nice guy in lecture and always asked us how are day was going.

Great professor and passionate about graph theory. Gave great examples and explanations with the material. Class was not bad and actually very enjoyable. Highly recommend this professor for Foundations 1.
This professor is so annoying that he forces students to do homework using Latex, which takes two or three times of work than just writing on paper, definitely avoid him.

He's always confused but he doesn't care about deadlines so you can ask to extend every single assignment. People have said he's helpful during office hours but without office hours you can just skip class and try to learn on your own cause he'll just confuse you during class. Some people like himf or the low-stress and because he's down to earth.

Tim is the kind of guy you'd want to go get a beer with, but not have him teach a class. Lectures were all over the place, but they're not required. Homework and projects can easily be done from the slides online, and exams are similar to HW problems. It's easy to get a good grade provided you're willing to put in a little extra work on your own.

Im not sure why his ratings are so low. Tim was a great professor who explained things well, gave good examples, and reasonable exams, homeworks, and projects. Hes also a pretty funny dude. Would definitely recommend him, one of the better professors Ive had in the CSE department.

Tim is a freshly minted doctorate that is teaching full time now. Very accessible outside of class, if you have Q's, hes there. His lectures were dry, he confused terms and different things, and his midterms were harder than what was expected. He did prepare us by going over questions in class, so don't miss class. Grades hard-ish He's theoretical

Tim is a great guy, but not the best at teaching. He often messes up key terms on the board, and writes long proofs on the chalkboard that aren't very helpful. HW isn't too bad but Exams are very difficult. If you don't take notes there isn't much you can study. He is more than happy to help during office hours though.

Timothy is only a grad student but has been teaching some of the foundations courses at OSU due to lack of staff. When I had him a year ago, he opened up the first day of class by telling us that he "often confuses really important terms and concepts". He was really confusing at times and his best aspect was his use of colored chalk.
Dry lectures, doesn't care about students, doesn't care to listen to any views that don't align with his. Avoid.

As someone who took this class after reading this page, I was terrified. I don't feel that the grade accurately reflects his teaching, but more so the 3421 content itself. He tries his best to make all of the content inside of computer architecture as accessible as possible and does his best to give real world examples. Office hours help a lot!

Dr. Zhang makes computer architecture seem not as boring as it actually is in his lectures which is nice. His exams are also heavily based on the homework so as long as you do the homework and attend class when it's haded back you're golden. The fact that he takes attendance only when he hands back homework is lame though, so make sure you show up.

Don't skip his lectures, a lot of the content on the exams is based on in class discussion and examples, and when he hands back homework (which you can only turn in on paper...for a cse class) is the only time he will go over the answers. The exams are largely based on the problems in the hw, along with a lot of concepts. Very tough but fair.

Hard to understand but very smart. The material is incredibly dry and it wont get any better. If you take him and sys2 at the same time make sure your sys2 professor is good cause it's practically the same material. YOU HAVE TO ATTEND CLASS. If you don't you wont be able to hand in hw find out the answers to hw, find out what you got wrong.

I think his rating is a little misguided. His lectures are dry, its a computer architecture course, no one is going to make the material interesting, but he does a good job making comparisons to real-world examples. His class is very exam heavy, but they were pretty fair as long as you follow the slides/homework. He also does not give good feedback

There is a big language barrier between myself and the professor. His lectures lack appropriate English grammar which makes it even harder to study or recap material. While the professor himself seems very knowledgeable on the subject, he is not very accessible outside class. His homework assignments aren't extremely difficult but are hard to grasp

HIs lectures are incredibly dry, and while he tries to use analogies to real world scenarios this doesn't help. Homework is graded without any feedback, with only a number being posted, which isn't helpful in understanding the content. He refuses to give 100's on the exams, and hasn't posted the final because the distribution is likely awful. Avoid

Professor requires attendance and does not post solutions to homework online, even if you are out for a legitimate reason. Exams aren't terrible but it is hard to focus on lectures. Attending office hours can be helpful but, he is very busy to scheduling office hours outside of his one hour each week is difficult.

Dry Lectures, very unorganized slides, all the lectures are basically a review session. Always says every topic is a review of System 1&2. Very rude, never posts the grades on time. Requires everything turned-in during in-person class and answer keys are not posted online all due to the reason that "this is not an internet class".

Terrible slides. Terrible lectures. Everything is "review". Does not accept digital submissions because "this is not an internet class". Does not post homework keys. Very little material to study. I learn more going through old computer architecture PowerPoints on the internet than I do from going to lecture. I leave class everyday discouraged.

This class was horrific. He seems like someone who is very knowledgeable in the subject, but an absolutely terrible teacher. All he does is read off his slides (which are very poorly organized). He is very rude and posted barely any information on the course page (including the dates of exams) with the reasoning of "this is not an internet class."

Very nice professor, willing to help. The lectures are boring, very little homework. The only thing I want to recommend is to find the textbook and self-learn as soon as possible; it is very helpful, and all the content in this class is super important. If you don't want to learn anything by yourself, it is better to find another teacher.

Super long lectures I really could not focus on so just try to work on labs. Very very nice and generous with extensions, grading, and help. Exams were not too bad and he does curve. Labs take forever but they'd prob take longer with a different professor and the grading is so generous making the class a lot less stressful.

His lectures are boring and hard to focus as his tone is very monotonous, so I recommend doing labs/hw during his lectures. Labs usually take at least 4+ hours except for the first and last one, so just make sure to start asap. Midterms and Finals were challenging but curves at the end are very generous. Overall, a decent systems 1 professor.

This course is genuinely difficult, and I considered giving up multiple times, even reaching the brink of a breakdown. But I feel that he relieved a lot of my stress. He is always patient, caring, and considerate, making me feel that I could keep going. Yes the lectures are dull and labs are hard but it's the nature of this course tbh.
I liked the Professor, he was very caring and very understanding when you talked to him outside of class. Very generous about grading too! The lectures are material heavy though.
Dr. Abu-Shattal was a nice professor who was passionate about the subject and would go above and beyond to help at student understand the material
Abu-Shattal was not a great lecturer, but he was actually so nice and if you just asked him in person he would give you extensions and he also did online exams this semester

Systems I with Shattal is perhaps the single worst class I've had the displeasure of taking at OSU. The labs are both extremely tedious and educationally useless, while taking hours out of your week only to be worth pennies as far as your final grade goes. The 2 exams are completely incromphensible and worth a total of 70% of your grade. AVOID!!!!!
Very boring lectures combined with difficult exams.  Had him 2 times a week for 2 hours, recommend taking the 1-hour class 4 times a week.  Generous curve but felt unprepared for systems 2.

I took Dr. Abu-Shattal for CTCH2850, DBMS, online through OU Southern. If you show an honest want to succeed, he will work with you. Some of his homework can be difficult, but he follows a philosophy; as long as you are actively trying, then you deserve a chance to succeed. Very caring professor, extremely lenient if you give an honest try.
he has super boring lectures but records them. the exams are super hard, lab 4 was super hard. overall a nice guy if u go to his office hours and will help expain stuff thoroughly
Very nice professor and always be patient with students' questions. Explains things very well! Choose him if you can!

I was sick during the semester and he is the most caring professor I have had he allowed to to take an exam later and some hw extended. Also curved the class and I was .5 away from a B and he did it. The lab 4 was super hard so start early

The grade for this class is dictated by the amount of effort you put in. Prof.Abu Shattal is a very understanding professor and a fair/generous grader. If you show up to the lectures, take notes, and complete all of the labs the content of the exams will be very manageable and your grade will reflect that effort.

He is a nice and patient professor though he has a little accent. His lecture is very important, so listen to it carefully. Also the hw and projects are easy except for the lab4. Midterm is fine, but the final exam is not organized like the points distribution in his announcement. Also he has extra points.

Don't buy the textbook. Emphasis on tests and attendance. Gives a nice curve at the end of the semester based on a mix of attendance, turning things in on time, class participation, and even though his tests are hard his partial credit rewards overstudying the material.

For the sys1 course, there are a lot of knowledge points from the content involved in the slides. But the hw and exams assigned by Prof Abu-Shattal are very simple, except for lab4, which takes a long time. Professor's grading is also very generous. For the lecture, he can explain every knowledge point very well and he is a great professor.

Prof Abu-Shattal does not deserve these horrible ratings. Maybe back then he was not the best, but now he is a wonderful professor. His lectures were quick and straight to the point. He has rather quick responses if you need any help, and are a pro at google search, you will do just fine.

HW and Labs are easy compared to other sections. Only problem is that he always goes to every topic very slow so he extend 15 min in lecture in the last 5 weeks and also had to give an additional lecture that he wasn't able to cover because of that. He once gave an extra credit during his lecture so better to pay attention to get free points.

Class was online for 2 hours -- awful. He showed up late every time and went over time, sometimes 15 minutes extra. He said we could leave when the class ended, but then you would miss important material. Basically just read the slides word for word and they clearly were not his own material. Overall, I would try to take anyone else for Systems 1.

I think Prof. Abu-Shatter doesn't deserve such terrible ratings. In my experience, he was a wonderful professor who was caring and understanding . The course might seem disorganized, and people might find it a little difficult to understand his accent, but if you reach out to him, he is very helpful and grades leniently. His exams are super easy.

Hes a nice guy, but Id recommend taking it with anybody else. Labs were time consuming with vague grading criteria and graded very harsh. Nothing is announced with adequate time. Hes virtually unreachable outside of class hours. The only benefit was that there was a VERY generous curve, however it didnt balance the stress level for the class.
Has a pretty thick accent and often struggles to understand questions, but he grades assignments and exams fairly, curves heavily, and is a really nice guy!

Lectures were long, but interesting. I could understand the professor fairly well, but he also records lectures. Through the zoom chat, he will answer all student questions thoroughly. Labs and exams were straightforward and fair in terms of content and length. He does have office hours and email, but sometimes does not respond timely.

His lectures are long but he covers material well. He was extremely helpful outside of class for me. Few assignments. Exams were open book and were good. Massive curves which will bring your grade up significantly. He is new to teaching this class but constantly tries to learn from his mistakes. Would recommend!

English is so-so, however the interest in the subject is missing. There is attendance, yet he rambles and teaches nothing during the lecture - you just end up reading the book. His tests are difficult and there are few grades. 3 labs which focused on python programming rather than the networking course material... Change sections immediately!

Totally unhelpful on this course, never give you the answer you desire when you have difficulties on labs and HWs. Lectures are hard to understand, vague slides, and most of the time he's just reading the slides. He is going slower than every other sections of this course. Lab and homework instructions are not clear. Worst professor I've met.

Dr. Shattal seemed to improve his second semester, but still leaves a lot to be desired. Homework assignments are unclear and he often copies and pastes problems from the textbook he uses. This typically wouldn't be a problem, except there are many issues in his labs that he does not account for and, when asked HW, he may ghost you.
The lab he gave out is totally different idea from what he taught in class. Plus, you learn nothing from it.
This is more of an art class. You need to know how to draw and everything is abstract.
Average grade for the first midterm was 30/80.

Unorganized, and clearly not interested in teaching. No assignments to help in learning coursework, doesn't use online grading properly. We've had only one quiz and a setup lab so far, and only received more assignments when someone specifically requested it. It's really tough to state how disappointed I am in this course.

Absolutely terrible. He didnt understand the need for disability services, and will test you on every little thing that probably has nothing to do with networking in the grand scheme is things. Weve only had 2 things graded before the worst midterm Ive ever taken happened. Dont take if you can help it.

Week 10 of the class and we have had 2 assignments: a quiz on the overview chapter and a Lab where you just setup the lab environment for the future labs. Extremely boring lectures which add nothing to the slides, terrible class structure, no assignments prior to the exam that would help at all. This dude clearly doesnt care about teaching.

where did the school got this guy and why he is teaching?


the worst teacher ever, do not take with him.

The grading is also unfair and not transparent. 
he simply will go out of his way to take grades off, I guess it offends him to see his students do well.
No communication.

Terrible! Grades everything harshly (even takes off points for things that are right , and just says that it's not "best practice"). Is never available outside of office hours or email. During labs, he seems to not know what is going on, and instead of giving hints or answers (when we are stuck) he would just tell me to review concepts from lecture
Homework heavy, midterms are not too difficult, and cold calls sometimes.
One of the best professors in the CSE department.  Always willing to answer questions and meet outside of class.  Great lectures, provides tons of examples in class and practice.
Bro is a legend

Great professor, always looking to involve students in the lecture and ensure that we understand the content. Exams and homeworks are relatively difficult but he provides an ample amount of resources to master the material.

Great professor. Sometimes loses his train of thought mid-lecture, but recovers pretty well. Office hours are very helpful to clarify any doubts. HWs, exercises, and sample exams are very very helpful for the exams. If you watch the lectures and understand the problems from the hws, exercises, and sample exams, you're set in this class.
If you get this man you are lucky. He held extra office hours for the exam. Lowkey funny. Genuinely cares about his students and tries to learn their name.

While not the best professor, he's pretty good. Some of his lectures are dry and theres a lot of HW but if you show up to class and do your part, you won't have an issue getting a decent grade. He records the lectures which is super helpful and his HWs prepare you for the exams. Do your hw and the practice exams and you'll be well off in this class
The material is tough and at times his lectures can be confusing or just don't help with the homework.

There's nothing terrible about his teaching or his class, but he posted homework just a couple days before it was due, and there were quizzes on video lectures due before we were even taught the topic in class, so there was just no incentive to attend the lectures themselves

This was a 15 week class in 8 weeks.  On top of this, content wise I found it much more challenging than CSE 2321.  However Dr. Wenger's slides, supplemental problems, posted solutions, and sample tests are of superior quality.  He even makes videos of step by step analyses.  He is probably your best bet if you need to take this class.

He held review sessions and made himself available for help. However, he made Foundations 2 a lot harder than it needed to be. For a 3 credit hour class, the amount of reading, homework, and exam prep time was way too much. The class lectures moved at a very fast pace, which doesn't click with a lot of students. The final was excessively difficult.

Outstanding in all respects: thoroughly prepared, masterful, clear in his explanations, and very happy to help out. **Exams were harder than HW, and he warned us, but they're really very significantly harder.**
He's a really helpful teacher that made some very difficult material easy to understand. I missed the first week of summer class and he made time to reteach me everything I missed.

Overall, the material and homework was easy to understand, but he did teach the material quickly. Midterms/final were pretty long for the time given, and were fairly difficult compared to the homework (lots of proofs and difficult problems).

Wenger was a pretty good teacher. The only major gripe I have is that all of his midterms/final were very long. I felt very pressed for time. Also, the final was much more difficult than the midterms. This, combined with the final being worth 40% of your grade, made the final very unpleasant. Otherwise, good teacher.

Wenger is one of the best professors in the CSE department.  Very knowledgeable on the subject he teaches and very helpful in office hours.  One down side to his teaching style is that he covers material at very high speed which can get people confused easily. A few people had tape recorders to get everything he said.  Great professor over all.
Dr. Wenger was a great professor! Although it took me a few weeks to get used to the analytic way of thinking, he was very helpful in office hours and answering questions during class.
Great professor, very helpful. I learned a lot from his lectures. He is the best professor I have ever seen in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.
Great teacher. Spends a lot of time working through examples and explaining until everyone gets it. Very clear and helpful.

Great guy. One of the best professors I've ever had.  Really cares about his students and the class was not very hard if you kept up with the assignments and went to class.  Would recommend to anyone.

This prof is a decent guy. His lectures were understandable, the lab assignments reasonable, and his tests/exams doable. The final was a little on the tough side, but everything else was ok. I got quite a lot out of his class. I wouldn't mind taking another class with him as the professor.

Excellent teacher, gives great notes, very clear lectures, reasonable exams, and is very helpful in office hours. Very organized class. Gives very good sample midterms and finals, which give you a good idea of what he is looking for on his exams. Also allows you to bring a page of notes on the exam. Best teacher for cse 541.

First of all, really nice guy.  I mean, who else brings cookies to the final.  The only problem is, the hws are easy as pie but the exams are quite hard.  He doesnt state this outloud, but he drops ure lowest midterm if you do better on the final.  I flunked one and still got a B.  The subject sucks, but thats not his fault.

The content was not the most interesting, but the professor did a good job of presenting it in class, and the examples we went over were helpful.  Homework and tests were appropriate in terms of content and difficulty, and he even let me make up the final when I accidentally slept through it.

The labs and homeworks are fair in length and difficulty, same with the exams.  Goes over each subject throughly and often has an in-class exercise that is very helpful for learning the material.  Good teacher.

Some lectures leave you feeling slightly confused, but he's very helpful and his notes often explain any questions you might have. Tough but fair grading, and it's nice to have some easier written homeworks between labs. Overall, a great teacher.
Good teacher, speaks clearly, nice labs and homeworks.
Class was well paced. Homeworks interspersed with short labs. In class worksheets are gone over throughly on several subjects. Tests were of reasonable length and difficultly.

Isn't very prepared for lectures and can't explain the topics too well.  Had to read the book in order to understand anything.  You're whole grade is based on two exams that are impossible to finish -- a poor measure of knowledge in my opinion.
Goes through the material at dizzying speeds.  Notes, homework, and solutions often have errors.  Don't expect to finish exams in the allotted time.

Foundations 1 is an inherently difficult class and as far as her class goes it is definitely on the easier side. Lots of homework, but the homework and projects really help you learn the content. Her class is more "project focused" with projects making up 35% of your grade. Lots of extra credit, and she is very willing to help you on the projects.

I would say I found the other negative reviews here to be pretty representative of my experience with this professor.

I don't think they are quite ready to design their own course.

They claim to really value criticism but in my experience they do not seem interested implementing changes that would improve learning outcome.

Was worried taking this professor for CSE 2321 after hearing that her CSE 2221 class wasn't great. But man, she can teach the hell out of CSE 2231. Lectures are engaging and she is eager to help you learn anyway she can. Midterms aren't bad at all and HWs and Projects can be challenging but really help you learn the content. Lots of extra credit.

Teacher has the worst lectures by far. Thinks she gains something by introducing brand new topics in the most confusing way. Skims through one example and moves on to new topics. Gives way too much homework/projects that are often things that have not been covered yet. Does not provide exam study materials.

I wish I had checked this website before enrolling in this professor's class. Be prepared for extremely difficult exams that barely align with the course material and a harsh grading style with no partial credit. Every answer must be flawless and match her exact expectations. Definitely not recommended.

I wish I visited this website before taking the class with this professor. just be prepared for extremely hard exams that have nothing to do with course material + very tough grader who does not believe in partial credit. Every answer has to be perfect and the way she wants it to be. HIGHLY UNRECOMMENDED.

KT really tries to make the lectures engaging and you can tell she enjoys her job. I don't understand what other people are saying by she is never available as she had office hours 4/5 days of the week and provided 12 other times run by the TAs throughout the week. If you show up to class and legitimately do the work, she is a great teacher.

OSU's courses follow a sequence, with professors preparing students for the next level. Her lectures and tests, harder then other sections, introduce these complex topics for future classes; however, she provides limited exam materials and does not tell students about review sessions, so make friends in other classes.

I actually don't advise anyone to take a class with this professor. the exams are incredibly hard and you will feel like it has nothing to do with the lecture materials. She is such a tough grader who doesn't believe in partial credit for the question. Save time and money by investing them in a different professor.
The exams were incredibly hard and she was not very helpful if you did not understand a concept.

I can't imagine why there are so many fake positive reviews. Her ‘curve' is purely because her exams are unnecessarily difficult—it's just a form of torment. Her class is completely useless. I heard she's teaching Foundation 1 next semester—good luck to you all. Hopefully, your grades won't end up ridiculously low.

She lectures as if you have a background in coding but it's not needed to pass her class. I came in with only the prereq and did fine. Yes she is much harder than others, but every SW1 section is curved to the same level after the final, so her difficulty didn't make a difference. My raw scores were bad but if you can beat the curve you'll get an A

She's caring about her students and would ask if anyone need any more insight on a concept we'd be learning. Her tests weren't that horrible and completely doable if you just put in some effort into studying. Her class is really easy if you come in with some experience in Java, but even if you haven't just put in a little effort and you'd be fine.

If you like the concepts behind programming, you will like her lectures. The examples on the slides in lecture are too easy, the test requires you to think more. So overall, she is very informative but her tests are very difficult. The 2nd midterm and final were curved by +5 and +15 respectively. Her tests focus heavily on concepts and not coding.
Don't take it with her, trust me on this you will struggle and end up hating cse. She makes her own exams that are x10 more difficult from the other professors and is a tough grader

This is a reply 2 the post that said if you cant pass her SW1 class CS isnt for u. If u have an extensive coding background then ok, but if ur only background is the 1 CSE prereq class for this u will struggle and likely fail her class. HOWEVER this BS comment is NOT true this class is designed 2 make u fail if u dont have experience outside OSU.

She has high expectations for students and her class is hard, as expected for a weedout course. Her exams are definitely worse than Bucci's but not that bad after a curve. She infodumps in lab/lecture so I only recommend taking her class if you're actually passionate about CS but tbh, if you can't pass sw1 with her, CS might not be for you.

she's a nice person but i don't recommend her class. she expects you to have extensive prior knowledge (beyond what's taught in the prereqs) and the exams are harshly graded with questions that are purposefully tricky/confusing.
If you want a low enough grade, take her class, I regret immensely not dropping out of her class before it started

The exams are very difficult and the midterm is only out of 50,  meaning that one wrong multiple choice question (out of 2) turns your midterm grade into a 96%, whereas the other professors' are much more fair and reasonable. Her classes do little to nothing, you need to study on your own. If you want to get a low grade, take her class
Good professor IMO

Only 50% of students passed her class last semester.  Assumes every single student has an extensive background in coding. No chance to pass if you don't, and even if you do, like myself, you will struggle. Avoid at all costs.

Tests are way too hard and don't go over what you learn in the slides. She is a nice person, but an extremely difficult professor. Some of my friends in other classes got much easier and fairer tests, don't take her class. Probably half or more of my class failed.

She is knowledgeable and encourages you to think for yourself, but her exams are difficult because they are very conceptual and graded with little to no curve. You are required to get 60%+ on the final to pass and I think about half the class failed. Projects are hard too but they're not under her control.

i cannot emphasize how badly people need to avoid this prof. she can't explain any concept properly, will only do one example of a topic, and move on quickly. my notes don't even make sense when i write everything down. projects are very difficult. overall AWFUL!

No slides, no lecture notes, and attendance is worth 7% of your grade. The projects are virtually impossible to complete without going to office hours, they have content that is not covered in the lecture or textbook. You are expected to be able to learn material and know it 1 or 2 days later for quizzes and midterms.

JUST RUN FOR YOUR DEAR LIFE!!!!!!. She can't explain, does one example in class, and expects you to know everything. There are homeworks,quizzes and projects all of these have questions that she didn't explain. There are no slides or recordings to go back and review. AVOID.
Not nice

I loved KT as a professor. She is incredibly kind and willing to help. I learned a lot from the projects- but you NEED to go to office hours and class though (no recording or online notes if you miss).

If you put in the effort to go to her office hours for projects, you'll be fine and learn a lot for Foundations 2. Lot of work but really worth it.

I really liked how the course was set up. I thought she did a really good job teaching the subject matters, and I feel like the homeworks, projects, quizzes, and midterms were all pretty fair. Homework was completion and she always posted the solutions which was very beneficial.
Horrible professor can't explain things for her life. You are much better off watching painters videos and not going to class. But even then she add extra content that no one else teaches so.

Extremely hard in comparison to other teachers. Lectures not accessible online, and she is not accessible outside of class. Please take any other professor. This is extremely hard for no reason at all.
Extreme

There is SO MUCH hw in comparison to other teachers. She forces you to learn more content than the other classes. She also has projects, which are painful. Lectures aren't recorded and there are no online notes. Tests are all short response and FRQ questions. Other teachers have their exam on Carmen, and those exams are genuinely easier too.

There is no PowerPoint, the difficulty of the lectures and the assignments and exams don't match at all, there are extra projects and assignments compared to other teachers and there are quizzes every two weeks

The professor makes all of their own assignments, quizzes, and tests which are all way overly difficult. You will be left confused trying to do the assignments because you only got to one practice problem in class which is not at all as difficult. Loves to put difficult math tricks into problems in which the concept is not supposed to be that hard.

The lectures are difficult to follow and the notes aren't helpful at all unless you annotate heavily, which is impossible because of the fast pace. KT gives a formula and does an example or two and you're expected to be able to the HW/quizzes which go 0 to 100. The Prof Painter videos don't help at all so if you miss class you're screwed.

Great person, okay lecturer. He's clearly passionate and cares about his students but his lectures don't really align with the content on Carmen, and sometimes it's hard to tell what's going on in class. Like others have mentioned, the slides are pretty random too. The HWs aren't bad, but can't be completed using only Carmen materials.

He would show up late, give a very sporradic lecture never really connected to a common progression. So, I'm not fully sure what I learned this semester despite the A. Notes were provided but they were just as hard to follow and sometimes weren't even his. If I had to teach a course with 5 minutes of prep time I'd do about as well as him, avoid.
Not sure where the bad ratings came from- his commitment to making the student experience positive is very commendable. One of my all time favorite CSE Profs! Not a hard grader as well!
Lots of extra credit, homework/ exams graded fairly. Always asks how we are doing/ if we are enjoying the course. THE GOAT!

Prof. Blanas does a great job of ensuring those who want to achieve a high grade can do so. Homework assignments are manageable, exams are fairly graded, and there is plenty of extra credit. He often asks for feedback to ensure students are having a positive experience. Spyros Blanas is one of my all time favorite CSE Profs!
Extremely knowledgeable and competent professor. Keeps classes up to date with current CSE tech. One of the best OSU CSE professors I've had.

Labs were graded fairly and he was nice. I had an A- the whole semester and the only reason I ended with a low grade is because I had to study for another final that was much harder the day before so I bombed this one. Really doable class and kind-hearted man. Lecture was boring tho. Make sure you know how to do the quizzes correctly!
Question and grading is confusing. You don't even know what he want to ask.

Worst professor I have ever met in OSU. If I am not a data analytics student who must take this course, even anyone give me money I will not take this course. Ok, he say sent him email to get adjustment on grading but no feedback. What is meaning for sending email? Waste my time?

I really liked Prof. Blanas as an instructor for this class as he is very knowledgeable about the world of databases and brings a lot of insight to the class. Be prepared to spend a lot of time reading academic papers on databases outside of class, and for a quiz during every class period. Overall I would take a class with Prof. Blanas again.

Took days/weeks to get back to students with information needed for homework or exam studying. Project requirements sometimes vague with expectation students would take time outside of class to meet with him. Course workload way too heavy for an undergrad. Homeworks did not prepare students for exams. Really knows subject material, good lectures.
Can teach, but unprofessional and presumptuous when interacting with students both during class and office hours. If you like databases you can learn a lot.
He is extremely good at teaching. But not very helpful and expects a lot.

He is really awesome, knowledgable about various aspects of databases! I recommend taking this class if your major is databases or if you are really interested into doing further research on databases.

Hated the class structure, didn't like the way it was managed. Had a very bad experience. I do not recommend taking any class with him, I felt he is trying to promote himself and not to teach the students.

Kirby does a good job lecturing material that can be boring and super detailed. I learned a lot doing his tough labs, but I also feel like I spent so much more time and stress than I needed to to learn the same concepts. I crashed out and thought he was the devil for a month but the midterm wasn't too bad. Go in with caution. And good luck
Decently smart guy, but not a great professor whatsoever. Shows no care for students' time and well-being. Do not take this course.

I really enjoyed having Professor Kirby for this course. He was very knowledgeable and clearly passionate about the subject, which made the material much more engaging. He explained concepts well and was always willing to help during office hours or after class. One thing to note is that sometimes he could talk a bit fast during lectures.

He is by far the best professor I have had. It is a tough class but he makes the lectures enjoyable and is very knowledgeable. If you are on top of projects you will be fine. If you test your projects with the data given and pass all tests you will easily get good scores on them. Exams were a little tough but you're taking CS. Go to his lectures.

Neil Kirby is a really good guy and an amazing teacher. Systems I is definitely a difficult class and is very time consuming. But if you put in the work and do the labs you will be okay and you will learn the content so well.

Professor Kirby is one of the best professors I've had. His lectures are well-organized and have really helpful examples that help the material stick. He is always willing to provide help whenever I have any questions. Take him if you want to learn something.

Genuinely the best professor I've had at OSU. He's not for the faint of heart; the labs and the topics in the class are difficult and take a long time to understand. However, you will be better off having taken a class with Prof Kirby. Show up to class, go to office hours, and don't slack. It'll be worth it.
