This is one of the best teachers I have ever had in my life. He grades so easy compared to every other professor, especially Bucci. Avoid Bucci at all costs.

I found the lectures for this class super helpful. Max explained all the concepts really well and gave good examples. The course doesn't have a lot of assignments and the projects can take a while, but if you study the slides before tests and do all the assignments it's not too bad.

Max was always prepared for our lectures and showed up ready to help students. He explains a lot of the concepts described on the slides on the chalkboard. These are always super helpful for the exams. This course in general is very difficult and time consuming, but you will learn a great deal. Don't be afraid to ask questions or be wrong.

Definitely go to lecture, because most of it he writes and explains on the chalkboard or tells you what you need to know for exams. There are only a few assignments and exams for your grade. But, he's an easy grader and you can get extra credit on most everything. He teaches material well, is accessible for help, and is a nice person.

I really enjoyed taking Professor Taylor's class. He is passionate about the subject matter and delivers engaging lectures. He responds to emails quickly and provides great feedback. His grading is fair and he is usually flexible when it comes to homework deadlines. I learned a lot from him!

Max is horrible to listen to during lecture, he's just slow and drab. He's amazingly fast to respond to your emails, though. He was generally pretty helpful when I visited his office hours for help on labs. Most of the class with Max is based on slides, but he seriously needs to learn how to write better exams, first midterm average was like a 55%.
He is horrible at teaching. He designs the Software 1 & 2 sequence, but is the worst professor for them. He is the hardest grader of all the teachers as well.

Whatever you do even if this is the only course available with this teacher do not take his class. He likes to see people fail and is the hardest grader. You won't understand his lectures. He gets mad when you ask questions which is weird because he's supposed to be a teacher. I don't know how he is still teaching classes here. RUN

This professor does not care about you or your success. Will get violently critical to students when asked questions that off-puts asking questions in lecture ever again. Sucks because the coursework is difficult.
He just using zybook let us gain any knowledge about Java. Zybook is better than any professor
Donovin was my grader for CSE 2321 Foundations I. If you have him as a grader you are very lucky because he strives to help his students realize their mistakes.
He is awesome

Awesome instructor! Explains material well, provides good feedback, very understanding if you need an extension or cannot attend lecture or lab. Literally one of the best Software lecturers on campus.
One of the best Compsi profs I've ever had.
Great Lecturer, Clear Guidelines for HWs/Labs, Attendance not needed.
Not great at conveying material but an easy A.
Would not recomment taking her to anyone. She will literally cut marks for every small thing and make you regret taking this with her.

He is not the best, but is not the worst. He really emphasizes application over memorization. His homeworks and exams are extremely fair. The only thing weird was he would get frustrated AT his class for not understanding a topic or not participating which was kind of weird. Other than that, the class was not too hard.

Barely gives partial credit, gets mad if you ask questions. If you answer a question wrong in class, he embarrasses you. His exams are 10x harder than the homework and in class examples, yet is surprised when the class gets a similar question wrong on an exam.

The ratings below for CSE 2331 definitely does not represent Dr. Bassily's quality of teaching and the effort he made in designing his course in CSE 5523. This course is definitely challenging as it contains many heavily theoretical knowledge about Machine Learning, but he did a phenomenon job in explaining the content and helping his students.

Mistakes in slides and lectures. Slides are hand-written. The first exam was okay but the second was EXTREMELY HARDER than materials covered in lectures and homework assignments. However, go to office hours, he explains a lot and helps you on homework.

Not the worst accent but not great, generally does not speak clearly. Makes frequent mistakes in examples and is sometimes unable to explain work he has just done. Notes are not concise nor helpful, many skipped steps and messy (cursive) handwriting. Complex topics explained poorly.
Really cared about what he was teaching, offered plenty of personal experience on the topics.

Worth taking the 8am in my opinion, but only if you actually get up and go to class. Most of the time, he ends lecture before the end of the scheduled time, and you can do the worksheets in class with other people and ask him questions which is helpful. Pick responsible people to be your project groupmates or it will come back to get you.

He's a good professor don't get me wrong. But he only offers his classes at 8am and then the assignment for each lecture is due at 11. If you don't plan on going to class because of the time, these get really difficult to complete on time because of the timing of when the material is covered. Only take him if you actually plan on going to class.
Great lectures, and Parker makes the material very understandable. Tests are difficult but a strong performance in the class is manageable. Workload is not overwhelming either

Didn't get much feedback on the project until the last minute. His lectures are just reading from the slides, but everything is on Google. Attendance is not mandatory; just do the worksheet at home. Tests are not very long. Not a difficult class but not very interesting (could've done a lot more cool stuff with databases).

Databases make me sleepy but Parker did his best. No HW except for a semester-long group project (which I admit was difficult at times). Not the most accessible outside of class. Decent lecturing skills and consistent with the textbook. Show up to class, study a few days for the exams, and find a reliable group; you'll do fine.

Great professor! Very flexible and lenient grading and has industry experience with databases, so he has very practical knowledge. Also an OSU alumni so he knows what it is like to be an osu undergrad and is sympathetic. Heard he's a talented musician too!

Great all around professor, good at explaining concepts and answering questions and a very reasonable grader. Attendance wasn't required but almost every class he would give an in class assignment to complete that was basically for attendance points. Also there's a database project you work on all semester that isn't too complicated.

i could care less about databases.  he did a great job keeping us interested anyways . Lots of opportunity to get a good grade because of basically free points by doing the inclass exercises every day.
He's a really good professor. Some tricky questions on the exam's multiple choice. The project is difficult if you don't pick the right group. Time consuming

This was not a show up and pass course, but it was easy if you do what you're supposed to.  He was very organized (I referred to ppts over book) and seems to be the most interesting databases professor. I believe the lack of ratings for this professor is because people are much less likely to rate for the classes they didn't have difficulty with.
Good solid professor - if you know some SQL already it will be an easy A.

Professor Jerry Qui demonstrated that he was a caring and excellent professor in several ways. He offered test corrections, giving students an opportunity to review their mistakes and learn from them. Additionally, he had a lenient approach, understanding that students may face difficulties at times.
Refused to acknowledge absence for any reason, such as competing for Nationals. Heavy reading assignments, lots of homework.

Dr. Mallon was an engaging lecturer who really did care about her students! Although some quizzes were weirdly difficult, the way that the class is structured makes them not matter as much. Overall, a very cool instructor who I enjoyed getting to know.

Very easy class and no homework, only "labs" that can be done in class. Tests are on paper which makes no sense whatsoever but generally easy A. Didn't go to much lectures because most things are either basic excel knowledge that was already covered TWICE (FEH and ENGRECON) or can be learned in the labs.

Not as awful as people say if you study and put in the time the topics arent super hard she can be a little passive agressive in office hours lol but she isn't awful and you can get a good grade if u go to lactures and study

Professor Mallon is very helpful and cares about her students. The class can be challenging, but using resources like office hours, TAs, and study tools like Unstuck study ai can make a big difference. The projects are difficult but rewarding.

Michelle was the best! I had her over the summer term of 2024. Visit her during her office hours, she has a whole table of snacks and also has a mini fridge with drinks. Depending on how the class goes she does drop the lowest lab and project grade.  Ignore the previous comments, Michelle was the best, and would totally have her again.

Actual policies do not match syllabus. Quizzes didn't seem to correspond with book, and were very hard. Class material and book material were not taught at same time. Depended on graders heavily. Projects were hard and there were little to no examples to go off of for them. Lectures were boring. Way too hard for an intro class, wouldn't recommend.
I think she was okay. just go to her office hours and make sure she knows your name lol. will give you extensions if you need when you get to know her (office hours).

Exams are strictly written which is dumb by CSE standards. Grading is very picky. Final exam was extremely long with VERY limited time.

Lectures are unengaging with little value. She appears nice but isn't privately. Awkward professor, doesn't care about her students - probably the worst experience I had.
Genuinely a horrible professor. Worst I've ever had.
Easy course but she brought you uncomfortable. Avoid her courses. Definitely Two-faced person.

The worst lecturer I have ever seen at OSU. AVOID ANY COURSES FROM HER. Totally misleading students and not helpful at all for you. She definitely need to learn how to teach and judge students by fairness first.

Professor Mallon was very helpful during office hours and shows that she actually cares about her students. The tests are pretty difficult as is the final project so make sure to utilize office hours from her and the TA.

She puts up an overly nice front while being a very unaccommodating and unhelpful professor. She puts a lot of pressure on her students for a class that should not be so difficult. Labs were fairly easy and could be done within the lab day/after lab. The excel midterm was definitely harder than what we practiced, 2nd midterm and final were fair.

Michelle was very nice, and this class will teach you how to use the Microsoft suite very well. I hated the MyLabIT software she used for exams because it was often very buggy. If you study a lot and go to class, an A is very realistic. Extra credit is a must!

Boy, this class sucks. Imagine forcing students to take exams covering Access and Excel ON PAPER. Michelle is knowledgeable and helpful. But she can be stubborn and unnecessarily harsh about her class. She clearly has been teaching this for awhile. I feel like this class did not reflect that I know excel. Exams were ridiculously hard.
The class content is great and all, but She isn't as understanding as other professors I have come across and doesn't accommodate at all. So glad to be out of her class.
Avoid avoid avoid. All her courses are misleading people and you will receive your grades based on many other factors such as your race.
Maybe it was my fault for not going to office hours, but I felt like I have learned almost nothing about Java.
She was alright. Class content was organized. Was easy to reach outside of class, but never very helpful. Don't expect any extensions without a serious and documented reason.
Lectures were asynchronous from labs, projects, and quizzes. Very odd setup class setup but help from the professor and TAs were always available.

very nice woman who cares a lot about her students. she will make sure u understand it if u ask a question. the quizzes were hard but open note. labs were relatively easy if u ask TAs for help. projects can be hard but ask TAs for help! highly recommend her as a lecturer. she provides snacks in her office too for anyone to come grab some!

Michelle cares a great deal about her students and wants them to succeed. She was incredibly accessible outside of class via email and helpful as well. I thought she taught this class exceptionally well and was one of my favorite professors at the university through 3 years of courses.

The Java 1223 class is run by a lot of people because it is a big class but Mallon is very nice and helpful and nice and always has a good attitude. The quizzes are very hard but there is a lot of hw and projects to boost your grade. The TAs can be helpful but some have a thick accent.
'DROP' is the best action you need to perform if enrolled in her course.'RUN' if you are considering.
Like please don't take any courses with this professor. If you can complete the course with another professor please do so and her TAs are just the same so opt out if you can!

Was extremely nice, encouraged students to come to office hours with snacks she kept in her office. The class had a total of 5 HW, 4 Lab and like 4 Exams. HW and Lab you had as many attempts as you wanted to get full credit. Exams got tough as time went on but extra credit is offered. Really not that bad of a class especially to learn Excel.

Her lectures are generally pretty good and engaging for how dry the content is. It is clear that she is at least trying to be present for the class and cares if students like her. However, the grading on the paper feels really unclear and arbitrary. She will take off large amounts of points with very little given explaining why. Very frustrating.
She is fake and rude

Very caring and easy to talk to, but the exams are difficult: they cover the textbook reading, course discussions, lectures, and content on objective sections. There is no real way to practice for the multiple choice section of the exam. Also the lectures get very boring. She also often overexplains herself to the point it is annoying.
Very rude and controlling and condescending

Very easy. Labs go step by step with practice labs/homework. Spent very little time in this class and I never had to study. I did take the only version of the class, and would highly recommend it as opposed to the in-person class because I never watched the lectures or read the textbook.

A professor who truly cares about her students and wants to help them learn the material. She is always open to questions and is happy to help. Was super accommodating and understood that her students were feeling additional pressure due to COVID. While it may seem like the grading is strict, she does explicitly explain her expectations repeatedly.
Unrespectful

This instructor is not a reasonable person. If she doesn't like your bibliography, you will get a zero on that, even you strictly follow the instruction on OWL and her guidance document. Also, there are too many ways to lose points on the paper, and the way her grade your paper is completely subjective.

This class was difficult for me, however Professor Mallon was a great help and was always there for any questions I had. She was also very kind and always had a bunch of snacks in her office to incentivize people to attend office hours. I would recommend her especially because she really cares about the wellbeing of students - a rare quality!

She's an academic (in the most insulting sense). Her papers give overly rigorous specifications for how to get an A. You don't actually need to understand your topic, as long as you can find professors like her to cite within it, she will be happy.

Ive never met a more exhausting professor. Shes the worst combination of being overly excited about the material while also teaching you nothing of substance. The paper and presentation guidelines are the length of books but still gloss over things she expects in them. Thank god this class only met once a week

This class only has two assignments: one paper that is due in the middle of the semester and one presentation which is due at the end of the semester. After the grades of our papers being published, literally 1/3 of the class dropped this course. The average of the first paper is 77.8 while other sections' average are above 85.

Grades depend on only attendance, a research paper, and presentation. She has no control over the grading criteria or the course content yet she tried her best to get students the best score they could by explicitly and repeatedly explaining grading components and what should be expected. STICK to her and you can get A even in a fast-paced summer.

If you miss a class, you will not get an A. If you miss 2 classes, you will immediately fail. She is INSANE. High school like teaching method. No electronic devices in class. She never gives any constructive advice. It is nearly impossible to get an A in her class.

Amazing lecturer. Very caring, like a mother to all of her students. She gives A LOT of optional practice that is VERY helpful in studying for the midterms and final, as the questions are very similar. The material is really not hard if you have a will to work at it, and have even tried using Excel and Access beforehand.

Michelle is a good lecturer and she gives a lot of extra practice that other lecturers dont give. The class changed structure for my semester and it got a lot harder but Michelle really wanted us to succeed. The lectures are boring but Michelle is good about answering questions. Attendance is not mandatory but she does take attendance.

Dr. Mallon is so nice. The class is not easy, but she makes it so much easier to understand. You'll still need to put in the extra effort outside of class, but if you go to lecture, she is SO helpful! Take good notes and do the practice problems before class like she suggests and you'll do great!

She is a great person and really cares about your learning. However, if possible, look for any other professor. Attendance is mandatory, if you skip, prepare to lose copious amounts of points. She plays by the book. Our final presentation requires 3 questions from the audience or we get docked points. She's the only prof that enforces this.
I love this teacher. I want her to be my mom. She cares about you. Keeps class fun.

This is a rating of the instructor and not the content of the class. Mallon is great. She's exactly what I think a teacher should be. She's stern but understanding. She takes a lot of time to make sure you'll be able to follow content that she didn't create.

Well, to be honest, before I take CSE 1113 class, I am really scared cuz she has a bad reputation on Rate my professor website. But after I take her class, I find she is a really nice teacher. You can't blame her the class is hard, it is not her fault. If you are diligent and do have problems, go to her office and she will be really happy to help.

She is so helpful with questions and is completely clear on the information needed to know for exams. I hardly put any time into this class except like 2 hours every 2 weeks and got an A-. AKA you can easily get an A if you put in the effort. You do have to read a lot from the textbook and learn about computers which is kinda boring.

She takes herself and this class way too seriously, especially with the attendance component. She pulls test questions out of nowhere that can't even be answered by the book. Extra credit is your saving grace. I work harder in this 2 credit class than my other ones. Avoid if you can.
I took the distance version of CSE 1110, and Professor Mallon made it very easy to succeed. Very clear and very helpful.

Michelle Mallon might seem a little strict at times but she really is a nice person and a good teacher. She keeps lectures interesting and really cares about her students understanding the material presented. The class itself is easy; one research paper and one oral presentation. If you skip class, you lose 5% of your overall grade, so don't skip.
Never seen such bad teacher before! The person, herself is unreasonable, as well as all of her classes.

Michelle cares for her students and wants them to do well. She is always accessible and even welcoming for office hours. There is very little extra credit and no curve but with practice exams that are very similar to the actual exams. It just takes a solid understanding too do well, there won't be an curve balls.

CSE 1113 is only one session long, so you only meet once a week for 7 weeks. There is only one assignment a week, but it contains many parts so I would recommend starting them early. Having background knowledge in Excel is really pretty important. Michelle really cares about our success and explains things very clearly. She's very approachable!

Michelle honestly wants everyone to succeed. Office hours help, and practice exams prepare you for the in lab exam and final. Put the effort in and go to office hours as needed, youll get an A. Take time to learn the material before class because it will make Michelle's lessons so much clearer and more helpful. She is a good teacher overall.

The worst teacher I have ever met in OSU. Mandatory attention and tough grade on paper. Nearly sent me to school office for I didn't properly cite on my paper even it is very good citation in other writing class. Also, No Electronic Device in class and she is super boring.

Her paper requirement is unclear. A 2,000 words long research paper and a presentation. Thats all. I rewriting the paper couple times but she still not think it good. Her class is boring and make me want to fall asleep. Attendance is mandatory and not allow to use any electronic devices.

Yes attendance is mandatory, yes she grades tough on the paper but that's two thirds of your grade right there.  The other 13 is a presentation on your paper.  You get two chances to get a good grade on the paper.  Put in just a little effort and you get a good grade.  Those complaining are those who want an easy A, this is college, get used to it
The worst teacher I've ever met. Pretend to be nice but useless. Choose another section if you want to pass.

She is super passionate about ethics. Like, so passionate it makes me want to cry. She grades really hard. Assignments: one paper and one, 10 minute presentation. You must attend all lectures or you will lose a letter grade for every missed lecture. For a 1 credit hour class, it was the biggest pain in my ...

Along with every other review since the switch to semesters, I found her class expectations very confusing resulting in a poor teaching quality. She creates an atmosphere reminiscent of high school, and the course material cannot be considered higher education. If you have to take the class, take it, but do not expect to enjoy it. Score should be 0
Terrible.  I gained nothing from her ethics class, it was mostly a complete waste of time.  She takes a one credit hour far too seriously, yet still doesn't manage to teach anything.
Worst class and teacher I have ever had.
Really strict and controlling teacher. Classes are boring and there is no substance to the course.

She is not a good teacher.  I would avoid her as a teacher for this class, but as others have said she is the only one that teaches this.  She takes this class way too serious.  Our midterm exam average for the class was an F and she did not curve the class at all.  Even if you think you understand the material it won't matter.

She takes this 1 credit hour class way too seriously. She will often refuse to grade students papers and has been known to insult their presentations. I would say take a different professor for this class, but she's the only one who teaches it.
Cases in class is not meaningful in most ways. I strongly suggest not wasting life in this class because attendance is mandatory and no electronic device is allowed.

The class only had 3 grades attendance, paper, and presentation. I bs'd my way through class and only spoke occasionally in discussions.  Paper is straight forward and you get to rewrite it.  The presentation is fairly easy just make sure to not read from the slides or paper and just talk about your topic and it's an easy A. Must attend every class
She is not a good professor. Avoid this class at all costs. She is very rude, and is not lenient in any instance. If she had the chance she would fail the whole class.
Class isn't even taught by a real professor, it's done through MyItLab software. Do not take this class with Michelle, especially online.

This is an easy class if you are willing to do the necessary work. Michelle is a very organized, clear, and helpful. However, the program coordinator, Lori Rice is not and unfortunately makes the class far more confusing and inconsistent. Michelle is a great professor and to her class is not hard, but it is time consuming.

She would pit one side of the class in a debate against the other and at the end told one team they were going to be wrong no matter what (every class). After having four people with English degrees proof read my first draft, she gave me a C because my grammar was larger than she wanted. After dumbing it down, I got an A though.

Michelle is a horrible teacher. She does not teach material in a clear manner, and she makes sure to hand back all rubrics and quizzes AFTER you have taken an exam. She also treats this mandatory weed out class like it is an intense major course. Avoid this class at all costs. Seriously. Bad professor, bad material, bad workload.
She takes her job way to seriously.

I do not recommend she appears to be nice But if you want help she is  reluctant in the sense that she makes it more difficult she makes it more confusing than it ought to be. Stay away from this class terrible professor terrible decision. This class just ruined my GPA. oh and by the way its one credit hour and it feels like five credit course.

Michelle is a very kind and energetic professor. She really loves the material and gets excited and emotional sometimes. Assignments take a lot of time to complete but are not that difficult; however the graders are extremely nitpicky and its very easy to lose points over little things. Just make sure you know how to use every formula for tests.
dont recommend

1)Almost all prof have EC. 2)No review mtl, but Catherine has all past exams online. 3) No cheat-sheet, but Debbie allows for final. 4)She just signed contracts w/ OSU, not a regular formal prof. So dont count on her recommend you be the TA. While Cath&Debbie definitely highly promote their students just if you get an A. 5)Always pretend to be nice

Her class is Ok, just Ok if you compare to other CSE200 class. She doesn't offer you any study material for quizes. And she offer you everything after the quiz. So I did a bad job on all the quizes but did a good job on my exams. She just have no idea how to raise students grade. If you wanna an A or A- of this class, dont take her class. Trust me
Michelle is a good teacher.  The material is rather simple, but their is alot that you need to learn.  Do HW and go to her office.  She will help you review and likes to meet with her students.

I like Michelle. I felt that she taught the material well and answered any questions students had during lecture, and she had office hours to answer additional questions. This class is not easy though, so be prepared for a lot of work. The labs were the hardest part for me. Someone needs to fix the course notes too-there are a lot of errors!

Best teacher I've ever had.  If I didn't understand everything she covered during lecture, she'd answer my questions during office hours.  She was always respectful and nice.  As long as you are in class and put the necessary time into the course work, she will be more than willing to help you.  If you gotta take CSE 200, sign up for her section!

She is VERY excited about the material and passionate about teaching.  This class is exactly what everyone says it is: HARD and a lot of work, but it was one of the most useful classes I have taken yet.  Do the hw and go to lectures and you should be able to manage a B.

A year after taking her class, I dropped it and retook Debbie's and Got a solid A. Still don't understand why so many comments are for her. Really ask someone who took her class, without just seeing these comments. Or you'll really just got a B~A-. She'll take you down below A with a big smiling face ^_^

Go to class! She gives up to 15 pts in extra credit for showing up to the lectures.  She started giving EC after the midterm.  Also go to office hours, even if you don't need that much help, make sure she knows your name. She explains any problems you have and is very helpful.

Yes this class has an insane amount of work, but it is extremely do-able. Not a computer person, so I was nervous, but I easily got an A. Dont do prelabs the night before(takes up to 4 hrs) Do all homework/suggested work and you will do fine on quizzes. Go to class, do all your work, Mallon's a great professor and is excited about the material.

While this class was not fun, and rather difficult despite having had a lot of previous computer knowledge, she made the class as fun as possible and tried her best to engage the class and make sure everyone understood the material.  She was a great professor teaching a weed out class.

She is very energetic and funny. She is the 1st lecturer I have had that is excited about the material. If you do the practice problems and practice exams you should be able to get a B. I spent about 10 hours a week on this class and finished with 91%. Pre-labs are annoying!

Not an easy course by  any means. I put forth very little effort and barely got a B-. I would not recommend taking that route. I feel like I was lucky to even get that grade. Learn from my mistakes: DO PRACTICE PROBLEMS AND THE OPTIONAL HOMEWORK. You will be MUCH better off.  Do pre-labs early don't wait til the night before b/c they take 2-4 hours

She teaches really well. I heard her class is really tough which is one of the most difficult among Computer lecturers. However, if you study hard and do lots of practices, you are totally fine. Just do not miss any her class and listen to what she says in class. She is really good.

I did very well in this class, however, I would attribute NOTHING to Michelle Mallon. She was constantly more worried about cheating then how her students did. She liked seeing people fail. Treated her TA's as if they were dogs and was exceptionally rude to everyone. The only way I would recommend her to someone is if I was recommending her to be f

She is like a ruler, you'd better listen to every single word of hers otherwise you are gonna pay for it. Definitely the strictest professor I've ever seen. She sometimes ignores emails, so everytime you send her an email, there's a chance that it'll be ignored by her for unknown reason. Overall great class, but I'd not recommend her.

Out of the most wonderful things she did this quarter, one was that she curved the entire class DOWN. So if normally you need 85% to get a B+, now u need 86%. even u deserve a B+ according to the original university distribution, u know what, she is just going to screw u over anyways because they don't hav enough Cs and Ds this quarter

HARD class, but Michelle is the right person to teach it. if your not good w/ math or excel, than this will be a tough class. Most Prelabs are hard and take 2-4 hrs per week. Go to ALL lectures & stay the whole time & she gives extra credit for attending. the exams are on paper so U have to answer how U would as if U were doing it on the computer.

Very important to go to all lectures and pay attention because it will be much easier to complete labs and do well on quizzes. Michelle explains in detail and very well. Follow her advice, work hard, study and you will get a good grade.

Michelle knows her material and probably is the best lecturer for the course. However, she is completely self-righteous and constantly makes rude, unnecessary comments. The course is absolutely ridiculous. Be ready to devote HOURS to prelabs that are worth a minuscule percentage of your grade. You CAN do well, but you have to work hard. Good luck!
Very difficult class if you are not math/computer science oriented. I did not enjoy her class one bit.

Excellent lecturer. Out of all of the CSE teachers, I heard she was the best and so I took her class -- I am not disappointed. Has office hours with tons of food and drinks, and you can go for help or just to shoot the breeze. Material is fairly hard, and you will probably not get above A-'s on lab, if that. HW is helpful; studying is essential.

Depending on your computer skills and MATH skills,this class can be hard. GO to ALL lectures $ be there early and stay the whole time, do the hw before each lecture(which isnt worth points but do it), dont do prelabs at last minute b/c most are hard and take hrs to do,& STUDY STUDY STUDY daily(dont try to cram it all in or u will fail).

This class will take a lot of time, end of story.  However, if you are a business major, you will learn a TON of useful stuff that you will likely use every day in the real world. Michelle is amazingly helpful in office hours (even has food/drinks for you!)  Labs are a pain and are hard to get good grades on. She will catch you if you try to cheat.

The class itself was pretty boring, and the lectures were long but it definitely paid off to attend them. This class does take some time to do well in, but the material really isn't too difficult. I've talked to a few other people and from what I've heard, Mallon is the best at making the material understandable. Great profesor overall.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! This is really a 10 hr class. I did all of the studying required and got a C. Shes very condescending."I want you to do well", but tests, etc are on material that was never covered in class. Shes very rude. Calling her an awful teacher is an understatement she is an awful person. I WOULD TRANSFER BEFORE TAKING THIS CLASS AGAIN

I liked her alot. She is really nice. I had some excel experience so the class was not bad to me. Everyone complains about the prelabs but they teach you the material. I didnt do any of the homework cuz its not manditory just advised. Go to class cuz she gives out bonus for coming which helps. if you need help go to her office hours it helped alot

I had absolutly NO excel/access knowledge before this class and learned so much! Michelle is very clear and complete. Quizzes are not given much extra time for checking answers but if you actually know the material it is not difficult to finish. Taking prelabs seriously will help a lot! Always attend class- it pays off

She was my best professor for the quarter. Taught the material very clearly, and although the material is a bit challenging and sometimes boring, if you go to all the lectures, you will do well. I've talked to people with other professors and we decided that Mallon is the best one.

She's a challenging teacher but if you actually keep up with the work, it's really not too bad. And it's all material that you will use for the rest of your life so it's actually interesting and useful. Definitely recommend her.

hard class.STUDY,STUDY,STUDY & DO THE HW, DO THE HW, DO THE HW which is not worth points. if u do then u can get by with a C;B- on the quizzes. Prelabs take HOURS to do (2-3hrs). one took 30 mins and one took 4 hrs. dont do them the day of or the night b4 the lab.  Labs can be hard to but for the most part not as hard as the preLabs.

Hard class, but definately worth the work you put into it. She is a hard grader, but really teaches the material well. Go to class because every once in a while, if you stay til the end, she'll give out extra credit (which you will ABSOLUTELY need). I know everyone tells horror stories about this class but I found out most were overdramatic.

Boring class but dont skip b/c she gives 3pts extra credit for coming to class. pre-labs suck and take a chunk of your time away. she is slow @ responding to emails. it seems as if she wants people to do well but also seems like she looks forward to people failing the class. do the hw & u will do decent on quizzes/exams. Hard class overall

If u dont know anything about excel or access then u will need to put in a little more study time to do well in this course. Actually if u are not good with math then u will need to put more study time in for this class. u have to know how to convert U.S money to Euro or Peso money or convert miles to meters to yards W/OUT a CALCULATOR! Good luck

In order to do well in this class or for any other class you must do the HW & study. Michelle is willing to help u do well. The only thing bad about her class is that she only gives 20 minutes to take a quiz which is not enough time. Prelabs(2-3hrs of busy work) suck more than the Inlabs. This class will make u stress @ times but is also managable

Try taking this class with a friend so u can do the pre-labs together & share/split the cost of this>=1000 page Lab book($140 a book & most of it is not required to read in order to do the actual pre-labs) Do the HW b/c theyre similiar to the quizzes. Michelle is paranoid about cheating which can be very annoying during test. Good teacher & helpful

Michelle is good @ what she teaches. Some of the material is easy & some is hard. she does offer 3pts extra credit for low attendance days so go to every class. preLabs/labs are nothing but busy work & are sometimes very hard & stressful but it is the quizzes and exams that make or break your grade. DO THE HW OR ELSE U WILL STRUGGLE ON EXAMS.

In order to do well you must go to every class, do the HW, STUDY, and you'll do fine. Pre-labs take anywhere from 2-3 hrs average so dont do them the night B4! Mallon is VERY paranoid when it comes to cheating but is willing to help outside of class if u need help. THIS IS NOT A CLASS WHERE U CAN GET BEHIND! keep up with the studying & u'll b fine.

This lady is psychotic. She is absolutely paranoid with cheating. I got a 95% on my midterm and she accused me of cheating on one of my labs. And you think for a COMPUTER course you would use COMPUTERS but all the tests and quizzes are on paper. Definitely do some of the homeworks if you're struggling. Go to class. She gives extra credit.
I don't like the professor at all!Her exam is the hardest!No matter how many sample exams I tried and how hard I study for the class,I still get low grade.

I can't help but read these "good" ratings and feel as though she posted them herself.  Her teaching style is terrible.  Deciding to take WRITTEN exams/quizzes for a COMPUTER science class is moronic. Excel is engineered to help us catch and fix our minor mistakes. If your TA is a hard grader, good luck passing.

She always PRETEND to be nice. But her hypercritical tricks are always out of you imagination... Be conscious, be smart. Once you consider her nice, remind yourself of "illusion", cuz storm is looming
I have to say CSE200 is a tough class no matter who teaches it. There is a lot of work to do. Go to class, and listen each words she says. Choose a better TA!!

I really disliked her. My roommate had a different CSE200 professor and was allowed to have a cheat sheet on the final exam (which you must pass in order to pass the class, even if  you have perfect scores on everything else). She seemed really resentful and would freak out about every little thing. Her tests are extremely hard and unrelated.

She gave us much harder and tests than any other CSE teacher.The grade is tough and ridiculous. She would deducted FULL marks if she thought your "J" looked like"I". She also gave a rude response to a simple question.
Go to class everyday so you dont miss a thing.  Do all the practice problems because they help.  Their is a lot of work load in this class.  Expect to spend 2-4 hours outside of class on prelabs.

She was rude to me numerous times over the quarter but I can't blame her for the difficult course-load, you should expect that from anyone. Go to every class and STAY the entire time, she gives extra credit if you come and STAY.
Definitely go to class and listen to every word she says. It is really hard to stay awake, but she is a very dedicated professor. She is the best teacher for this subject.

She can be extremely OCD sometimes especially during class, does give extra credit but it hardly improves your grade. Gives a lot of practice problems which I would reccommend doing cause they show up on the quizes sometimes. Overall wasn't that bad of a teacher and a long as you pay attention and do the practice problems you should be fine.

I found her to be very helpful, I had heard prior to class that she seemed to pick favorites, however, with 160 people in every lecture i dont see how that would happen and it was not apparent to me. Go to class, and do the practice problems she provides. Its ALOT of work and time.

Horribly boring class. Attendance is mandatory.  She gives out tons of extra credit if you come too.  Nice the first few classes but not very helpful.  Very lazy and if you have a lab TA that grades hard, well good luck.  Mine was terrible.

Michelle seems really nice the first few classes, but she quickly turns on some students. She was nice, and very helpful to me, throughout the whole class, but was horribly rude and  talked down to a friend of mine in the class. Its not a hard class, but there is a lot of work involved with it. Try to be a "favorite" and shes not too bad.

Seems nice at first, but as the class goes on, reacts very snobbishly to questions she deems "stupid".  She's so paranoid about cheating that she forgets to teach the class.  The class is hard, but believe me, if you work hard and do the homework, you can definitely pull off an A.

This teacher is very nice, but her lectures are not constructive enough for the students to grasp the material successfully .  When going to her office hours, it was very hard to get her attention as she was trying to help everyone.  She seems to want her students to succeed, yet the exams were horrific and the grading was even worse.

She is a completely worthless teacher. Her lectures are pointless and you cannot get anything from them. u have to teach yourself everything. so paranoid about cheating that you cant learn anything. Harder tests and harder grader then any other CSE teacher. Sent a very rude response to a simple question. No curve. DO NOT TAKE!!! this class is hell
She's great!

Michelle Mallone is the worst teacher to ever step foot on Ohio State's campus. seriously, stay away from this woman. she is stuck up, and thinks that you know as much about computers as she does. you will hate yourself if you enroll in one of her classes.all her assignments are harder than the other cse classes and she grades ridiculously unfair.

First of all this class is unnecessarily hard. The teacher is not nice and she acts extremely snobby because she knows what she is doing. She forgets we are students who dont know anything about the subject matter. So much busy work. Try to test out of this class

Amazing teacher. Genuinely interested in teaching. Lectures flow very smoothly and coherently. The class is difficult only if you don't come to class and don't ask questions. It's a straightforward class that will need to have at least 2 or 3 hours on average for each pre-lab. Great teacher.
This class is hard, but only because they expect your life to revolve around this class. Expect pre-labs to eat up over two hours of your time.
nice teacher, tough class

easy class if you do the work, which takes time. she wants students to do well and it is really easy to follow along with problems in class. she gives you everything you need to get an A. sometimes gives extra credit if you stay the ENTIRE class

Know a little excel going in and this class is SO easy.  I didn't find it challenging at all, and only studied a little the nights before exams.  Attendance is taken and she gives bonus attendance after the test days usually.
It's a difficult course, but Michelle makes it tolerable. She is friendly, helpful, nice and has food in her office! Just put in the time and the work necessary and you'll be fine
Hard Class. Teacher was very helpful and made the class intersting. Seemed to enjoy teaching.
Michelle's lectures are interesting (compared to other instructors) and she is so smart!
Extremely interested and excited about teaching.

GREAT TEACHER! She explained everything in basic terms and showed you how to do it on the right there in lecture on a computer. Go to class!! She gave out like 15-20 extra credit points for attending. Plus some of the questions on the exam come directly from what she said in class. Exams aren't tough if you study, but they are thorough.

Overall, she is very nice, Helping me moving class while she is very busy. She is not very helpful in Lab, She doesn't want to teach you,only explaining,the TA is much more helpful. Class pretty boring though, Overall she is the only women prof that i think is good looking than any other  teacher i met
Hard class, but if you come to class and keep up with the work you should be fine. The teacher seeme to really care and knows her stuff.

Interesting.  This class in itself is very different.  You can completely understand the material but still not get an A.  We had a sub-lecturer for a day and I felt she was better at explaining material to us in a way that we can actually use it and repeat it when tested on it.  No curve.
never take any of the professor class. She is nice but she seem to run through the syllabus and all her comment is useless. I think it is better to ask question in lab rather than her useless lecture

A teacher that means well, but treats the class like a group of first graders day after day. It gets old quick. The biggest problem is with the ridiculous grading system for the course; taking .25 of a point off for some misc. error over and over, etc. Mallon isn't bad, but beware this class is the definition of busy work no matter who is the prof.
Great teacher, the class was a lot of work but the teacher is some eye candy.

It's a time consuming class, but Michelle helps students get through. She is good at explaining the material. It doesn't hurt to get to know her of first name basis, as I think that helps. Extra credit for attendance, free food in her office, good looking professor. What's not to like?

Michelle was always willing to answer questions and help with anything that was needed. She is a great teacher, very passionate, which makes the class much more enjoyable! Definitely recommend trying to sign up for her section.

Michelle is the MOST wonderful teacher for this class. She treats her students like her own children. I cannot express enough how kind and willing to help she is. She is nice on grading, and truly cares about helping her students. Take HER class...with anyone else you will HATE it

Michelle was awesome. The material is pretty boring unless you are really into computers. But if you study and do the assignments before the quizzes, you'll do fine. She's always willing to answer questions.
Great professor.  She's really helpful and actually cares if you can't understand something. Be nice to her, and she'll treat you well.  The tests aren't that hard, but you will have to study.

def a good teacher, class was boring, but i don't think anyone else could do better. Very clear and concise, willing to help! bonus for attendance...from what I have heard she is the best of the bunch!
I don't know if it's completely her fault but it is literally impossible to stay awake for the full 1 hour and 48 minutes.

shes the CS&E prof that you want, shes easy to understand, lenient, clear...i mean the class is boring and kinda hard NO MATTER WHO U HAVE so suck it up and take a teacher that will atleast give u a chance of doin well...she gives extra cred for attendence and is just realllyyyy nice...if CS&E is a requirement for u then u shud take her.
very helpful, uses food to get people to come to office hours. tried to make it interesting

It's a lot of work. Doing pre-labs and going to class isn't enough, gotta practice on your own. I feel like the professor is a smartie, she won't pass up an opportunity to get smart. And yeah, she does treat you like a little kid with her explanations. Not bad though and I think she's cute

She is the best teacher in the CSE sequence by far.  I took another professor and he was pretty much useless so I withdrew from the course and took the class again.  I found the class to be difficult, but she actually teaches you the material.  Boring class but she's the best professor to take.

If you like being talked to as if you are a third grader, take her.  She will repeat, numerous times, in agonizing detail, such exciting facts as: What is a computer?  and How to close a window.  Her shrill voice will lull you to sleep as if it were a warm glass of milk and a bedtime story from your mom. I WOULD RATHER BE BURIED ALIVE THAN BE HERE!

Not the most interesting class.  Definitely not that difficult.  Simply do the pre-labs and study the excel and access lingo (whether on your own or during lecture) and you will be fine.  Cheesy jokes, but she is a good teacher, expect same lecture before each test!

If your into taking hour-long quizzes in 25 minutes with little to no help from a professor who doesn't display an ability to teach, as well as no curve whatsoever and not rounding grades up AT ALL, then by all means try and get her.  Don't let her teaching award fool you, shes a professor to avoid.
I thought she was a really good teacher. And she really cared about us.

The class wasn't too difficult, but she is a extremely mean person. Avoid her as your professor. Also, this class has no curve plus grading scale is crazy 83.99 in that class still consider a B-, which normally other classes consider it as a B.

She is absolutely logical and reasonable. Maybe one the the most logical women I've ever met. She is clear so as an international student, I almost have no problem understanding her. She is helpful already and still trying every method to help her students study.
If you have to take cse, take it with mallon. She takes a terrible class and makes it tolerable and somewhat easy.
SHE IS AWSOME.. SWEET AND SMART! GOOD TACHER

Loved her. Thought this class was gonna be terrible but it wasn't. It's actually really easy stuff, just very tedious at times. Michelle was great, very clear, and no-nonsense. Go to class and do your pre labs and this hard class can actually be very easy.

This class is a lot of work.  Prelabs are time consuming and the quizzes are kind of hard because she doesn't give you enough time.  Labs help your grade a lot though.  She gives random bonus points for attendance.  She is nice and is helpful for the most part.

Only complaint is she only provides 25min to complete the in class quizzes. 3-4 min per problem is not enough time. It takes 3 minutes just to read the word problem, break it down, and understand it. Other than that she's very open to student’s questions and has flexible office hours. Be prepared to work hard in this class.

IDK why so many people think this class was hard...a lot of Fisher students are much dumber than I am, or a chimpanzee is, from what I've seen in other business classes. I literally never studied once and still got an A-. Prelabs are time-consuming but easy. Mallon's nice, but fairly annoying.

Great instructor. I have taken another intructor and dropped that class prior to taking Mallon. All I can say is her and other instructors are worlds apart. If you take CSE 200 with someone else you will want to kill yourself after the second lab or first quiz, but with Mallon CSE 200 seems just as easy as a 100 level GEC class.

Nice lady. Easiest of the 4 intructors who teach the CSE 200 course. Labs help your grade a lot. She gives lots of extra credit. You still need to be on top of your game no matter whose CSE 200 exam you are taking. If you're not sharp that day or have a brain fart, your grade will severely be impacted. Could mean difference between an A or an E.

This class was so hard, but I was really glad I took it. It has probably been one of the most useful classes I have ever taken in college. You can tell Mallon really enjoys the stuff she is teaching and  she tries to get the rest of us excited about it too.  That made learning it a little bit easier.

This is the worst class ever. I'd rather clamp my testicles between a vise. The homework problems make it seem easy because they are just fundamental concepts, but the questions on the quizzes and midterms are so abstract, it takes the whole test period just to figure out what the question is asking for. This is my third time repeating this class!

The class is awful. The material is boring and Access will make you want to hurt yourself. If you go to class, sit close so you can actually see what she is doing. But honestly, you don't need to go to class that often. Just do the pre-labs and make sure you can do them perfectly, and you'll do fine in the class.
A really good professor!
CS&E 200 is a really tough class, but if you take it you better take it with Mallon. She make the class tollerable.

The class is reall tough, and you certainly need to keep up on your material, however Michelle is very helpful, if you go to her office hours she is happy to help, and will even bribe you with food and drinks.  She is easy to talk to and a great teacher if you take the effort to succeed.

Sounds like somebody got into trouble for talking too much in class! Thanks for letting me know that if I take her class, she will make obnoxious poeple like you who think they can talk through the whole class be quiet so I can hear.  I can' wait to take her!

She is not a bad teacher but she is just a jerk, she stops if she believes it is too loud. We are in college, not elementary school, so shut up and keep talking. Gives extra credit for attendence, otherwise good.

easy enough, however LOTS OF WORK. i took this course at the same time as math 152 and almost failed cause there is so much to do. Lots of pre-labs, and labs are gonna take the whole time...don't miss lecture. gives a cheat-sheet for midterm!!!
Mallon is a great professor. This is a tough class which is very time consuming. so take it when your other classes aren't so hard. GO TO LECTURE or you WILL struggle mightily.
the class is an easy B you have to work for an A and i guess go to class...but the class sucks so just take the B
Nicest lady, and she really knows her stuff.  Class isn't the easiest, but she does a great job getting you through.  Great prof. stuck in a terrible subject.
hard class, but she goes over everything in class.  You just have to stay awake through her lectures and you'll do fine.  Lots of busy work at home.
Great teacher. Hard class. Mallon has to be the sweetest professor I've ever had. She presents the material in a clear manner, and isn't bad to look to boot. Once again, good teacher; hard class.
No Comments
Great Teacher....exams are reasonable

Go to lectures and listen you will do fine. There is some work involved outside of class on the labs but you will have that no matter who you take. Mallon is helpful and gives great hints for quizes and exams so go stay and listen.
shes was rude to my riend when he dint show up to class and asked her for help during office hours !
she is awaful , I HATE HER

she explains everything in great detail. is more than willing to help. sends emails to the class and quickly responds to web ct. doesnt try to trick you on tests, she sometimes tells you what problem it will resemble in the notes which is basically giving you the test. if you go to lecture and listen, you'll pass.
If you have to take CSE 200 pick her as your teacher. The class isn't the easiest, however she's cool.

I'm sick of hearing that cs&e 200 is "so hard".. cut the laziness and go to class. very easy, just time consuming. Mallon is an awsome prof. Just keep up with reading and go to lecture, you shouldn't have a problem.
great
Hottie teacher that understands what she is doing and is very helpful and approachable. Class isn't difficult if you are familiar with computers.

Michelle is such a sweet lady.  She really cares about what she is teaching, and she wants her students to do well.  The class is really time-consuming but Michelle makes it as easy as it can get.  She is wonderful!

Very nice lady. Good teacher. I didn't find the class hard at all. Make sure you go to class and pay attention. Do the practice problems in your book and you should have no problem at all getting an A or B.
Very nice and helpful.

I'm not really tickled by Michelle or the class. I did very well on the homework and practice exams/quizzes, but somehow I bombed most of the quizzes and the midterm...I dropped it, but scared to death this quarter...and the worst part...it's keeping me from my accounting courses. I have to take it!
****ing easy.. lol tis class is "hard", so i hear..   take mallon, go to class, eaaaaaaaaaaaaasssssssssssssy
I really didn't like her.

Michelle is interesting enough in class and is clear with her examples. Quizzes are fair and her voice isn't annoying like some others in the dept... go to class, do most of the work, and you should have an A.
If you go to class, this should be an easy course.  She seems pretty helpful and the lectures are a snoozefest but necessary to do well.  Gives extra credit for staying in class.  I did fairly well.
Worst Class Ever.  Enough Said.  Definitley pick her over Gross though.

It's a really hard class. She tries as much as she can to help you, even goes as far as bribing you with food if you go to office hours. She is trying to make the most out of a difficult class, gives extra credit if you show up to lectures when we don't have quizzes. Quizzes are very difficult!

Now CSE, I guess. Terrible course, test out if you can. Condescending prof (instructor?) who thinks she's doing important work raising future secretaries. Dull labs, and for those who care, teaches bad database practice.

This class is boring as hell! As long as you read the articles you dont have to sit through her boring lectures.  She also was very snotty when writing comments in discussion boards and seemed annoyed when you asked questions.  One small mistake also takes off lots of points on quizzes and exams
Good teacher for a hard class, very helpful. Visit her office before the tests!!!!!
GO TO LECTURE!!! In order to pass this class you really have to go to lecture..she will give you bonus points for going.  Overall the class is NOT hard IF you do all the work.
tends to treat students as though we're still in 2nd grade... not very helpful outside of lecture unless you grace her with your presence in her office.
fabulous teacher, will help anyone and really takes pride in what she does. take her!

A teacher that finally understands how boring most of her subject material is, but tries to make the class at least tolerable. The pre labs take forever and the way they quiz you on material (without using a computer) is ridiculous, but this isn't something she controls. Extremely helpful.

Absolutely AMAZING!  Go to lecture (she takes random attendance), go to her office hours (she gives you food), and study and her class is a BREEZE!  She is willing to help anyone out, as long as you treat her respectfully.  TAKE HER CLASS!!
A good professor, as long as you go to class and study, you'll do fine.
Great teacher, hard class, GO TO LECTURE!!!
Made it interesting and easy to learn.  Likes to take attendance randomly, but you should be going anyway for this class.
Very entertaining.  Always willing to help.  Makes a large lecture hall seem like a small classroom.  The ABSOLUTE BEST teacher you can get for this class!
Awesome!!!
She is very clear and very open to knew ideas. She allows mutiple answers which makes the class much easier. She only teaches as a night class but it is worth it.
She has been a terrific professor. She makes a dull and tough class tolerable. She also strongly encourages students to ask for her help, and will never turn anyone away.
Probably the best Professor I've had. Does a really good job relating boring material and keeping you interested. I definitely would say she's your best bet for instructors in this course.
No Comments

Very good teacher, but the class is still hard as hell.  Much better than the women who calls herself  KITTY , in fact DO NOT take this class with gross either UNLESS you wanna take the class over again.
The best damn CIS 200 teacher in the land. Seriously she is really helpfull and wants every student to do well in the course. I 100% recommend her. The course is tough though! PRACTICE!
No Comments

Not a good teacher at all. CSE 2231 exams are the hardest with him. Other SW2 class exams are open book ,open note. He makes the exams extremely hard. Doesn't do exam reviews. The median for Midterm 1 is 51 with no curve. OSU needs to make a set standard SW2 exams. Takes every question as  criticism and is defensive.
Everyone in my class received a 40% on midterm 1 and he blamed it on us...
Nice lecturer but not a good teacher, you can never get 10/10 in you project, any of the small problem will take your grades.
I'm here to get his rating down to below 3.

Easy exams with harsh points deductions for mistakes. 2221 is a horrendously designed course that is useless at teaching concepts. Be prepared for a tremendous amount of time wasted with lecture, lab, homework, and projects - none of which properly teach the core concepts of the class.
hard grader
Bad course to taken with him, heavy homework with limited percentage, strict exams which you might get deduction for not efficient of the code (the codes are written by hand based on paper)

He's notoriously hard, but if you have a strong coding background, it wasn't very hard. Midterms are a big percentage of grades, and if you have a bad day, it can drastically affect your grades. Doesn't give materials to help with exams. Project grades aren't explained with a clear rubric and I was left wondering. Pray for a good TA. Nice guy tho

the least accommodating professor i have ever had at osu. i was very ill (to the point of where i couldn't get out of bed) and it happened to be during finals week. i tried to ask him to rearrange my exam time so that i could heal before taking the exam but he was not allowing it. ended up having to retake this class b/c he is so not accommodating.

The class is challenging, but Bucci's teaching approach is effective if you put in the effort. The homework is manageable, and the tests are fair. Using resources like unstuck study alongside the lectures can really help with study prep.

His course is widely recognized as the most difficult. The exams are the hardest among all the professors, and the assignments are graded the most strictly. He designs the materials and teaches with great dedication. If you genuinely want to learn, choose him. If you're just looking for a good grade, avoid him.
C+ before curves, B after curves :)

So much homework, but it shouldn't be longer than 30 minutes and are preparation for lab the next day. Often comes off as exasperated with students when they don't raise their hands to answer questions or don't answer questions. This would be appropriate for older students, but his classes are mostly taken by freshman and sophomores. Informative.

Bucci is the head for sw 1 and 2 so the tests for all classes are very similar to his, the tests are also fair, they are hard but everything on his exams is stuff that he went over in class. tbh, most of the bad reviews come from people who don't try much. Additionally, he curves at the end by a decent amount. main advice is just put in effort.

I quickly figured out the people complaining about Bucci simply didn't put in the effort to learn OR needed their egos checked. Yes, he went off on a few people during class, but for good reasons...people being disrespectful and arguing with him or undermining his policies. He was really helpful to me outside of class, cares about what he teaches.

I had Bucci for SW1 and SW2. SW1 was a big learning curve, but I don't think that has too much to do with the way he taught. I was quite intimidated at first in SW1, but I soon realized that he is a caring teacher who is passionate about the subject. Tests are not hard to succeed on if you watch the video lectures and review labs.

He gets a bad reputation and it was intimidating at first but I would not be scared. I got a D on the first midterm and ended with an A still, very fair exams and the projects are easy points if you attend office hours. People who think his section is impossible to achieve in are simply not putting the time in.
terrible class environment, hard on grades with little grade opportunities (midterms are make or break), ego, awful experience and I recommend people to stay far away.
Among many things, doesn't communicate topics clearly

He's a very good professor in terms of teaching. If you want one 24 hour extension your probably not gonna get it. He is very passionate about the material but he does not curve and he tells the TAs to grade harder. This is good for us but I knew people who turned in significantly worse code get better grades than me in other sections.

He is a decent lecturer who conveys a clear understanding of the content, however he can be a little difficult to approach. After I started talking to him more and spent extra time practicing towards the end of the semester, I understood the content pretty well. He has a lot of insight and can genuinely make you a better programmer

Usually one of the only professors that makes attendance mandatory and teaches sections in the morning, so try not to take any software classes in the morning because you might have him. Very very tough grader. On exams, your entire code either has to be completely right or it's just wrong even if you think you deserve partial credit.
GREAT PERSOHN ONG

Whatever you do even if this is the only course available with this teacher do not take his class. He likes to see people fail and is the hardest grader. You won't understand his lectures and you will fail the class.

Anyone who complains about him likely didn't feel like putting in the effort to learn the content. Not a difficult class if you pay attention even the slightest bit. Very passionate professor, cares about what he does and wants to make you a better programmer, even if that means telling you that you are stupid because, maybe you are.

Bucci comes off as uncaring and almost rude professor. He wants everyone to participate but if you ask a question he might make you feel dumb for asking it. He understands the material, gives very informative lectures, and gives great feedback if you go his office hours prepared. The effort he demands makes all of his students better programmers.

Mr. Bucci was one of the best professors that I have had in the CSE department in terms of teaching. He cares about his students and the knowledge that they take away from the class. If you wish to actually learn Software II content, I recommend taking Paolo Bucci.

Mr. Bucci is one of the most hard-headed professors I have ever met. If you want to take a class with a living fossil schedule his section of Software 2 or 1 and have a fun time asking him for help and having him talk to you like every question you asked was the stupidest question ever and that you don't know anything. Overall, bad professor.

Bucci is an incredible lecturer, and while he comes across as a little demeaning sometimes I think it comes from the fact that he simply knows so much. If you ask him a good question he gets noticeably excited, he really likes student participation. He is the course director for 2221 so he knows what is important to study for the midterms.
Work load is not too high, however expect graders to be tough. Things like missing a name on an assignment or submitting with the wrong file type will certainly lose you some points.

I can understand why people consider Professor Bucci a difficult teacher. His grading is harsh, his exams are harder than other professors teaching the same class, and he doesn't always appear very friendly. But I honestly feel like I took away a lot from his class. I like his teaching style and it's very easy to ask questions in or out of class.

Lectures are super bland and gets mad when asked questions. Doesn't go over any practice because all he asks for are questions in the class, and then briefly go over some points in the lectures not showing how to implement the code or use it. In Labs the work is there but you can barely ask questions and hope you don't get the professor to come.
Is a very harsh grader, but does teach well
This professor is a really tough grader who captures every small mistake in the exam and then makes a big deduction. Never take any courses from him.
sooooo difficult

Not sure why Bucci gets such a bad wrap. The class is definitely hard and some professors might have easier classes but this guy knows his stuff. Pretty sure he's the one that created the 2221/2231 sequence
There's no way that he can actually be a professor

A lot of people hate on this class because it is so different from any other coding course out there and it forces you to break with bad habits. In this class, you'll learn to code with rigorous discipline. If you want to become a better programmer that can write high quality code, this class if for you. If you put in the work, it will pay off.
Need to read slides before class which difficult to understand

Bucci admits to using outdated software, coursework, and material for this class. He has been using the same format and projects for over 6 years. Do not expect to learn any actual useful information. Scratch that, do not expect to learn anything from this guy. He offers no input for the labs. His lectures are catered to people with previous exp.

Bucci is a disgrace to Computer Science and Engineering in general. The first project in the class literally states on the rubric "teach yourself." Do not expect any real teaching from Bucci. Do not be surprised if you create functional code and still receive an F because it is not how he wants it. Bucc is the most unapproachable and rude professor

You will have to do a lot of studying outside of class and if you have questions that what you do in lectures. There are labs every other day and you have to finish them within the class period. Have projects every week and homework almost everyday. Need to watch lectures every other day before classes usually and very few days with no homework. GL

only good thing about him is he is knows stuff and accessible. But dare you ask a question you will be roasted like you never have been in your entire life. He is accessible and resources are there but if you want to ask questions make sure there are not a lot of people around you so the embarrassment you feel, which you will, stays to a minimum.

Extremely tough grader. Average on our first exam was 65%; our third was 60%. Ending with my first sub-A at OSU. If you make a tiny mistake, they will lacerate you. I've heard average is 20% higher in other profs' sections. Who gets an A vs who gets a B is determined not by how much you know, but by how good you are at tip-toeing on ice.

He definitely knows his stuff and is really passionate when it comes to CSE, specifically Software 1. He is not only a really tough grader and expects specific solutions, but you do have to study a lot if you want a decent grade on the quizzes. Be prepared to get ridiculed or criticized by him if you have any questions about the covered material

He always tells the class to ask questions, but once you ask a question, he makes you feel stupid for not understanding it. Says you shouldve watched and understood the lecture. Prerecorded lectures are made and lecture time is used as a Q&A rather than an actual lecture time. I dont recommend...

Makes his students feel like they do not know anything. It makes class feel like its a competition between him and his students. In reality, he should be working with students to help them learn and not putting them down. If you have another option, do not take him as your professor.

Puts down students if they do not know an answer to one of his questions. Leaves in class lectures completely open ended. The class is fun and engaging, but frankly, he is a poor lecturer and has no respect for his students.

Paulo made the curriculum for sw1 (cse2221) and 2 (cse2231). He is respected and knows what he is talking about but he can come off as arrogant and make students feel unworthy of his time. Didn't understand a topic at first glance? Get ready to be drilled with questions in a breakout room that make you feel like you know nothing. Best of luck.

Bucci writes the Software courses, so he has the best understanding of the content and what each assignment is trying to teach. Don't expect him to be your friend, but it is clear that he cares that his students learn things properly and practices the discipline. Highly recommend because if you can't learn from him, you won't from anybody else.

Paolo is clearly very passionate about CSE, but he treats his students as if they are idiots and refuses to answer some questions that people are struggling with because if you use your head you can probably figure it out. Lectures are prerecorded and mandatory to watch, and he expects you to ALSO go to live lectures on zoom. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Taking online. Lectures are entirely per-recorded. Lecture time is "office hours" and refuses to go over content that is in the lectures even if you are still confused. Harsh grader.

In class attendance is recorded & has random 3 question quizzes on specific items. HE DOESNT CARE IF THE GRADERS DONT GRADE BY HIS CRITERIA. Grades on homework DO NOT SHOW YOUR PREPARATION FOR THE EXAMS. He grades Very harshly and questions may be very niche. He has a thick accent and talks quickly, you probably wont understand everything he says.

Paolo Bucci treats the students like they don't know anything and that us CS student are not thinking and are idiots. I guess he has the idea that he's doing it to make you better, but he does not treat any of his students with respect whatsoever. He has the idea that if scores are low, it is not because of him and his inability to teach, but on us
He explains very good, HOWEVER he's a REALLY hard grader. If you need a good grade, RUN!

Paolo is a hard grader and will pick out small details and seems angry, but in the end, he really cares about your learning and gives you very good feedback. He is willing to help outside of class if you are truly stuck. The lectures are very organized and although the slides are online, Paolo definitely clarifies and provides more details.

Paolo definitely understands the material well. However, if you ask questions he does make you feel like the stupidest person alive. If you want to succeed, you NEED to go to class. If you have the will to do well, you will. Just listen closely to what he says and remember them, because almost always he includes them on exams.

I took Dr. Bucci for both SW1 and SW2. He is a great professor that expects nothing less than excellence from his students. Prof Bucci is a professor that will make sure that you never forget the core principles of what he is teaching you. Don't miss lectures or labs (for you own sake). Maybe wear an Inter Milan jersey to get on his good side.

Got consistent 9's and 10's on the projects, studied them before exams like everybody said to, looked at past exams, still was never really prepared and couldn't get higher than a C on the exams. He's definitely very smart and maybe it's because I took it at 8am, but this class is extremely difficult. DO NOT TAKE if you have a loaded schedule.

I don't usually post here but a guy on reddit wished more people rated professors so here goes. Bucci is a good professor. His lectures are usually engaging and I, for one, find him pretty funny. He does grade exams pretty hard but usually the exam coding problems are similar to the projects. Some people practice for exams by writing code on paper.

Doesnt really explain much in class but if you so dare miss a single petty detail on an exam or a project ge will screw you over big time. The most earned grade for our MT2 was 30 and the second was an 80. Its an inverse bell curve, and no one likes that

Dr. Bucci is the embodiment of everything wrong with the CSE department at OSU. As course coordinator, he is the one responsible for the abhorrently bad material in Software I & II and his lectures show it. Exams are also significantly harder than other sections of 2231, it's seriously night and day how much harder they are.

I had Dr. Bucci for Software I and Software II. He is invested in the course material because he helped create the course content and he's a good teacher as well. However, he gets annoyed when his students don't ask questions, so be sure to do that. You must show up to lectures because there isn't a textbook for these courses.

He is a good and experienced professors. The reason why I rate him so low is because he grades strictly and may influence GPA greatly. The course is already difficult and he still grade strictly. This situation makes many common students who is not very good at CS struggle in his class. But the good students can learn more things from his class.
If you have other choice, never take his class. He has tough grading and you must have the code like his correct answer. And the exams are extremely difficult.

He is quite irritable. He gets annoyed when people don't answer questions. The reason for this is because no one ever asks questions, so he doesn't know what the students aren't understanding. He's really caring and wants the students to do well. He encourages questions, and doesn't give away answers. Sometimes may be hard to follow, but he's good.

Nice guy overall, but his foundations 1 class makes me feel hopeless at many times. Doesn't do an adequate job preparing students for the work he assigns, and as a result the average grade of the class on even the homeworks is typically below an 80% which is unheard of even in difficult classes such as Math 1172 (which I received an A in).

Although he ends class late most of the time and is a tough grader, he is one of my favorite professors. It is so refreshing to have a professor that is so excited to teach everyday. He is clearly passionate about the subject and I learned a great deal from his class.
He really wants you to learn and is very passionate about the class!

I can honestly say that he has been one of the better teachers that I have had.  He challenged me to be better and I learned a lot from his class.
