A very good teacher, she knows how to communicate the course material. If you come to class and pay attention you will succeed. She doesn't just read off slides she works through examples and really helps you understand things.
Slides are completely useless, topics are boring and repetitive. Find another professor if you want to learn something.

Dr. Close makes Foundations 1 very easy. She explains everything very clearly, and does plenty of examples. She holds frequent office hours as well, so I was always able to ask questions when I needed help. Easily one of the best CSE lecturers.

Dr. Close was an amazing professor. She was so kind, caring, and truly wanted her students to succeed. Her lectures were straightforward and clear. She never tested on anything she did not cover and never threw any curve balls. I was very successful in this difficult course and I can say I owe it all to her. She is by far my favorite professor.
Excellent professor.  Tests aren't overly difficult.  She teaches a tough class, but the she explains everything thoroughly and easy to understand, plus provides you with help outside of class.

A little disappointed this semester because she didn't give out answer sheet to hw problems which would help me prepare for exams better. I would say it's the best way for me to learn through looking at standard answers and figure out how to do similar questions. However, I can't get them in her classes.  Other than that, she is a good lecturer.

Prof. Close is definitely not the easiest professor in the department. She is, however, one of the best lecturers in the department. She puts an interest in her students you rarely see and will always go over a topic again if the class does not understand it. She is one of my favorite professor at OSU.

Prof Close is the best professor I have had at OSU. She teaches a rigorous course, but she explains topics thoroughly and gives students ample time in and out of class to ask questions. Labs were difficult, but very fair and rewarding. Close's class never feels like busy work, she puts great effort into her lesson plans and course content.

Prof. Close is quite possibly one of the best CSE professors OSU has had the fortune to have. She is very nice,  smart, and energetic in the classroom. Her classes aren't ones you want to skip though. Everything on the homework's and Exams are discussed in lectures so don't miss a single one, I mean unless if you just want to (possibly) pass.

Professor Close is one of the best professors who teaches 2321. She is very energetic giving lectures and willing to answer your question. Homework are not easy but it helps you learn the material better. Midterms and finals are fair. If you learn hard, you will get good grades.
The material is pretty boring (in my opinion), but Dr. Close is very willing to help and explain topics. The labs were pretty easy and interesting, and the exams weren't too bad.

Close is a nice teacher and is usually energetic, though sometimes the lecture material runs on the boring side. Her grading can get picky, especially if you learned runtime analysis with a different prof for 2321, but if you're willing to learn it her way and do it her way, there shouldn't be any surprises.

Make sure you read the textbook to understand every concepts. Some concepts may need to be memorized clearly. Then you will be fine on the exams... The quiz is easy, and I almost got full points on both of the two quiz  make sure you understand the chapters that she elaborates on,,,,'elaborate'..I mean, talks more than 30 minutes...

Course is set up with 1 midterm, 2 quizzes, 1 final exam, 4 labs and 3-4 homework assignments. It might not seem like a lot of work, but the labs are long and you most likely will have never done anything like it before. She's a good instructor, much better than the other guy, but grading is rough, so be ready.

Not a hard class but teacher takes off many points. Theres a grade key so grades cannot be questioned even if in my case she took off for doing it right just slightly different then on her slides. Majority of points taken off for thinking I might have been guessing. Ended up with 89.44 and wouldnt let me argue my grades. A very frustrating course.
Covers material thoroughly. Challenges students with homework but provides students with all the tools to use to solve problems. I really enjoyed this class.

Awful teacher, never answers questions, when she does always vague answers or "I don't want to give away the homework answer" Never referenced the textbook once in the class. Slides she posts don't help you at all. You must attend and take good notes to have any chance of success
She's great you have to really talk to her to completely understand where she is coming from but she is a very helpful and smart individual
HORRIBLE TEACHER.  AVOID AT ALL COST.
She is a wonderful teacher. Although her class is a little difficult, she explains topics clearly and always gives good examples to reinforce the topic matter.

It was a 7 week session, and she really explained things very well. Attending class was very helpful as well, though I didn't do well on the midterm, I did fine on the final. At times she is not as helpful on homework as you would like. But just keep trying and you'll be fine in her class. Hopefully take another of her classes in the future!

Knows her stuff, makes lectures interesting. Exams are fair, homeworks are meh, and the labs can get difficult. She uses Piazza, so you can ask anything you want and get an answer within hours. I'd recommend her.
Very good for operating systems II. She is much better at teaching this than CSE221.

Overall an excellent teacher who seemed to go at a pace that helped students understand the material. She actually genuinely cares about her students unlike some other professors. I was able to learn quite a lot because of how effective a teacher she was.

Really nice and pretty easy.  If you pay attention to her in class you should have no problem doing well.  She writes her tests to be over the material she has covered in class.  Pop quizzes every once in a while that review the previous lecture, basically just an attendance check but worth 10% of the final grade so go to class!

Gives extra credit. Best of the CSE teachers. Really nice and tries to make the class as easy as possible (which isn't a whole lot since it is such a huge class), take her if she goes back to teaching CSE 200

Lectures were pretty boring but she got through what was needed and all information is in the Lab book including slides. The textbook is required because parts of your prelabs come from them. She allowed for a cheat sheet on the final and her quizzes were fair.

Not the most pleasant experience for me, but she is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. Get to know her and go to her office hours and she will do her best to help you out.  It is obvious that she cares about her students and wants them to do well.

Class is taught completely out of the book, which you had to read in order to do the homework. She doesn't seem like she really knows what she is talking about. Every time i ask a question she can't give me a straight answer. Barely get to code or see her code. Try a different teacher.
Great instructor. If you pay attention in class, you will do well.  She does her best to make class interesting and get people involved. Very helpful and accommodating to students.
Nice lady, didn't really learn much from her though.

The class was structured so that she went over a powerpoint for the first 10-15 minutes then we were given a group activity to complete by the end of class. She was very nice and tried to be helpful, although she did not seem well versed when it came to RESOLVE. Activities were annoying at times but the class was very easy for me. YMMV

Teaches basically out of the book. Programming class; we rarely will program or see her program though... To be honest, I barely learn anything in lecture.  I either have high standards when it comes to teachers, or about half of the professors simply can't teach.On that note, I have heard that the other teachers are better for this class.
D. Close is a very nice lady. Extremely helpful, actually WANTS us to pass.. it's her boss you have to watch out for.. Enjoyed the class tho!

Lectures are boring and straight out of course books. Same with all CSE200 classes though. She does try to demonstrate examples from the book visually. Attendance is taken each time. Possible bonus points towards end of quarter.

This is a hard class. She teaches it well however. Just go to office hours-very helpful. Go to class! It helps and keep up with the work. Also do the labs ahead of time-will help with tests. She's a nice teacher.

Great professor; cares deeply about his students and their performance. His lectures are really boring tho; he talks slow, so it's easy to get distracted. Exams mimic the study guide and the slides almost perfectly, and it's multiple choice. Gives good feedback on HW and labs as well. If you want to pass, do well on exams (~75% of final grade)

Dr. Green is very dedicated to his students (to an extent I haven't seen before). His lectures are dull, but so is the content. Projects and homework are graded fairly, and the exams are all multiple choice with no surprises. I recommend going to his review sessions before the exams, they helped me more than anything else.

The most boring professor I have had in lectures by far. HOWEVER, he will tell you straight up what type of questions will be on exams, and no curveballs in the exams or labs. If you have questions, he will spend as much time as needed to help you and make sure you understand. His slow teaching unironically makes you understand the material well

CSE3430 is a pretty boring class material wise, so prepare for that in general. Lectures are even more boring though, and all attendance is mandatory. Exams, homework's, and labs are very reasonable. Mike wants to help his students and is willing to. Nice guy, very boring lecturer.

I would say being boring is better than being difficult and not try to teach you. I am 4th year so trust me. Most of CSE prof I have experienced are very terrible compared to this guy. So just be grateful.

While it was at times challenging to stay alert in class, Mike is a kind & genuine prof. It's clear that he knows and cares about the content, and the course is designed in a way that guides students to success. There are no curveballs thrown & he was always available outside of class. If I had to retake the class, I would seek out Mike's section.

Mike (George) gives the driest lectures ever. It was difficult not falling asleep in class. He takes attendance every class, but I skipped every now and then and still got full participation points. The tests are super easy, just make sure you give yourself enough time to study because it is a decent amount of memorization.

Mike is unfortunately the most boring professor I've had in my life- lectures are truly mind-numbing. However, labs & homework aren't very difficult if you review the slides. Exam averages were about 80%, but he curved my section by about 5% when final grades were entered. He's very caring & adamant about reaching out for help, just boring in class
holy hell this class is so boring. made me want to blow my brains out every time i went to class but luckily i'd just fall asleep anyway.
Best professor to take system 2. Gave a huge curve. Most of the class got A/A-.
Material can get overwhelming and boring. Pay attention and show up:)

Cool guy. Always willing to take the time out of his day to help students succeed. Homeworks and labs are directly from slides and very applicable to CS and the exams were fair albeit difficult. Generous curve is given at the end and you learn lots in the class.

Nicest and most fair CSE professor I've had. Curved the class average to a B, coming off sw1 and 2 this was so nice. If your disciplined about keeping up on material don't hesitate to take this guy. Theres a lot of information but only people who are bad at time management do bad.

Overall pretty decent. Yes his lectures might be boring but the content is not very interactive itself and reading the slides is probably the only way to learn it. He is pretty friendly and always makes time for all students. Exams are tough but do the homeworks read the slides and textbook and youll be fine

Went to the Doctor a few times over the semester because I thought I had narcolepsy but it turns out I just had Professor Greene. Nice guy, but did not seem super knowledgeable or enthusiastic. Needs to dust off his brain and turn it on. Would not take this class if you want to learn.

My favorite professor so far at OSU. Gave great lectures and explained the material really well. Class was very interesting, especially if your new to the non coding side of computer science. However, the exams are hard if you do not stay focus during the lectures. If you understand all his slides and lectures, then the rest of class is not bad.

He goes by Mike btw. Literally a god lecturer and I wish I had him for Systems I. Very detailed lectures and his slides are organized and informative. Always available to meet with students and is very flexible with assignments and the class if you communicate your needs. Haven't had any midterms yet so idk about that but so far he's pretty cool.

Mike has good (sometimes boring) lectures, and clearly knows a lot about his topics. I thought his tests were a little pedantic, but A. it's probably an effect of being online and B. he curved the class pretty decently (about 5% in my section and 8% in the other) which made up for it. He's also very helpful on piazza.

Had him for CSE 2431! Absolutely great professor, really caring and always willing to change his deadlines for students. Always gives great feedback for students and although his lectures are a little bit dry he knows his stuff and his exams are straight from the slides. He curved the class a lot and would love to take a class with him again :)

His lectures are slow and dry but as long as you're taking it online and can speed the lectures up by 2x its pretty easy. His exams are fair and straight from the lecture slides. As long as you watch all the lectures and study the slides you'll be fine.

Exams are extremely easy and straight forward. He doesn't try to trick you. You are able to make a cheat sheet of one-page front and back. If you make this cheat sheet wisely, it'll help you a lot and you won't have to memorize things. Lectures are very dry and slow. It's tough to pay attention but if you do you'll learn a lot.

Lectures are dry, but if you pay attention you will learn a lot. Exams were tough and tested knowledge of minutia. However, Prof. Green was quite helpful during office hours. Labs and homeworks were easy points as long as you put in time and they helped solidify the material.

This class is basically all slides. You don't need lectures just memorize the slides, and you will do fine on the exams. My only complaint with him is he assigned a lab that was due a week after the class was over, and this lab was about 10x longer than the previous 2 labs combined.  This lab was stupid, and pointless.

Like others have said, the lectures are a bit dry. However I believe this to be because of the material covered in the course more than it is his fault. Simply put, the material is rather dull. The class is fairly detail oriented, but I felt like he did a good job of preparing us. Tests were fair in my opinion, although they were most of the grade.

Extremely boring lectures. I would look around and 90% of the class was on their phone or asleep. Detail oriented tests. Class was way harder than it needed to be.  Could have been way worse, but could have been a better semester.

Most boring and useless lectures. He just reads the slides VERBATIM. If you want to do well in this class, skip lecture and memorize every detail on the slides. Because the tests ask you about the most trivial details ever. Don't take. I've learned nothing from him or his lectures. I'd recommend you take a more engaging and interactive professor.
First time of him teaching Operating System, but he does a nice job, and a caring instructor as well.  Many of my classmates describe him as GOAT (Greatest of all time) for a reason!
Pretty good professor. Labs and homework are very easy and if you study the slides, so are the exams. Lectures can be a pretty dry though.

Definitely my favorite professor by far. He communicates the course material clearly and goes at a reasonable pace. Not to mention that he's the most caring and understanding person ever. Who else would take their day off to hold a review session for students before the final? I highly recommend him!
Great instructor for systems. Clearly knows the material well and wants to help you. Would take again any day.

He is good at communicating the material and getting discussion going. Overall he is a nice guy with reasonable expectations about the class. He is helpful and easy to reach out to. Id be glad to have him as a professor for another class.

Took this class last year. Great professor. Midterm was fair but specific, you had to know your stuff for MC part. One two day exam and one non cumulative final, which was very tough. Partner Labs were easy. Good lecturer, very willing to answer questions. Answered all my questions after class. Def better than the other options.

This is a difficult class, but he made it more difficult than it needed to be. Homeworks and labs were very fair, but his midterm and final were extremely detail oriented. You basically have to memorize the slides to do well. Didn't feel like he explained things very well or cared about feedback from the students.

Simply amazing. He is the best option for Systems I out of the other professors available. Yeah the exams will be hard if you're not willing to actually go to class and pay attention but they are definitely fair considering what he teaches in lecture. Really cares about the students and very willing to help in office hours.
Exams are hard but they're also straight from the slides and lectures. Really helpful when you ask questions in class and wants to help you.
Horrible

Made the final exam EXTREMELY difficult, three students finished in the  allowed time and here's the thing he WILL FAIL YOU if you don't pass it! (Even if you'd pass otherwise)  Also will say you'll get points back on assignments and then change his mind and not tell you. If you can take it with someone else, take it with someone else.

Ali really cares about the students, makes funny jokes. I'm going to be real, I probably would have failed the class without the extra credit :) This class has a group project about graph theory which was a nice grade boost. I would have done better If I studied more, but Ali is great! However, his lecture recordings are not that good. GO 2 CLASS.

I loved Professor Ali's class! He gives extra credit assignments throughout each exam cycle, which are super helpful! Not only do they boost your exam grades by a huge margin, but they are also great practice. He is also very caring and funny. My only complaint was that he was rather difficult to reach by email. Highly recommend!

Genuinely cares about students. Lots of extra credit that's added to exams. Disliked that we had a final project due the day before the final over something not really covered in class. Overall, his lectures we engaging and I went to his office hours and he was very helpful

Foundations was difficult and Ali did his best to teach but he is quite fast, so make sure to ask questions if something doesn't click. There is a lot of extra credit so make sure to do it for a buffer!!! Work with others and focus on understanding in class problems and study terms and algorithms and their running times. watch YT videos, they help!

Do not take this course if you want a good grade. Especially if you're better at learning on your own. I'm a commuter and had a class directly after 2321, so I worked mostly independently. Unfortunately, this professor tends to be disorganized during lecture and even more so online. Rubrics and grading are extremely vague. Be prepared to reach out.
Decent professor and lectures.  Gives the easiest examples in class and the homework's and exam's are much harder.  Heard he is one of the harder professors for the class.

Very passionate and knowledgeable. One of the few professors that actually cares and want to teach. He would repeat each concept at least three times before moving on to make sure everyone understood. Hands out bunch of extra credits. Exams aren't hard, some of the questions were even straight out from homework / extra practices he handed out.

He was a very nice guy and actually cares about his students, but he was not the best at explaining content and would often confuse me more during lectures. His office hours were useful and helpful, but his exams were extremely hard and the final was rather unfair. His final project was harder and more work than any of my coding classes.

I found Professor Ali to be an incredibly helpful professor who was very passionate about the material. I appreciated how he gave many extra credit opportunities, as it allowed for more guided practice in class. The exams weren't bad and he also provided many study materials. If you attend lectures and ask questions, you'll probably do well.

I think Ali was a great professor. His style may not work for everyone, but for me, this is exactly the kind of teaching I like and succeed with. Extra credit for thos who come to class, always welcomes questions and trys to be helpful in every way. Lots of office hours. material is hard but offers lots of practice to know what to expect.
Extremely tough grader, homeworks are confusing/ time consuming, exams are difficult, office hours packed

Ali is a very kind professor and all of his teaching is fine before the final. However, I don't understand why there are questions about graph theory in final and if I'm remembered correctly, he even didn't finish it on class??? It cause my grade fall to B+ from A.

I don't think he have a curve since there are many optional extra credits.

I had Professor Ali for both foundations 1 &2. He is an amazing professor and cares for his students. The first best skill he presents is knowing his students' names. If you do your homework and the extra credit questions then you will do well on the exams. He has office hours every day and is very helpful and easily approachable
He is a great professor and cares for his students. He is the best professor I have taken so far here at osu!

Very difficult grader. Argues with you after asking for help. Homework confusing/ extremely long. Lectures extremely confusing. Calls out for missing even one class (even with valid excuses). Avoid at all costs!

Grading scheme is extremely difficult, and although extra credit opportunities are available, the exam averages are extremely low. Asking for help is also difficult, as office hours are usually packed, and I usually walk away from office hours feeling lost/ attacked for asking questions. Made me feel very upset on multiple occasions.

- Currently have A's in the rest of my classes so I really don't like this man and his accent.
-  No clear grading criteria. 
- I failed the midterm, but The midterm is a clone of the homework and the past papers which I got 100%
- a suspicion that he will fail you on purpose if you don't come to his classes.

I can imagine this professor being good for a certain type of student, but I could not for the life of me figure out the material. If you are good at listening to lectures and understanding them in the moment then you will do well. If you are more about figuring things out outside of class, you are screwed.

Ali is funny and cares about his students. He will learn your name quickly. He cares that you understand the content and responds well to questions. He's approachable after class. The homework is difficult and takes a long time, but it's only every 2 weeks. The exams are difficult, but he gives a lot of extra credit. He posts hw answers after.

Very nice teacher. Foundations 1 is a difficult class, but he teaches well. He also consistently stays after class to answer questions from students. One note is DO ALL EXTRA CREDIT and GO TO LECTURES. He doesn't curve but offers a lot of extra credit to make up for it, and only gives extra credit if people show up to class.

He teaches a difficult subject but makes it something that almost anyone can understand if you go to class and pay attention. He is always willing to answer questions and is very nice. He cares about his students and he is funny during class. He gives extra credit almost weekly if you come to class and do practice problems.

Ali Alilooee is an amazing professor, unarguably one of the most fun professors I've been taught by so far. He really cares about his students understanding everything, he has well paced lectures, and really wants students to do well. Thanks to him, I've really enjoyed the course, if you have him available for foundations 1, definitely go with him.

Fnd2. Tons of extra credit. Optional attendance but if u attend there is extra credit.
Easy exams, exactly like hw. Just make sure to understand hw by going to office hours (where he is super nice and will explain exactly how to do problems)
He is an incredibly nice guy and really cares about his students. Sometimes funny too.
Responds to feedback.

This class teaches important concepts that are honestly not too difficult to understand, in a way that's confusing and hard to understand. I learned more from five minutes of googling. That said, he was super nice and the class was really easy. As long as you understand the homework's (literally just go to office hours for this) you are gold.

I had him for Fnd. 1 & 2. In Fnd. 2, he apologized to me for how poorly he taught Fnd. 1 (his first time teaching it). He said he made major changes to how he taught that course and made it better. He offers ALOT of extra credit outside and in class, DO IT AND YOU'LL GET AN A. Go to lectures, and office hours, do extra credit.Ali is a wonderful man

Great professor! He cares a lot about his students and teaching well and it shows. Offers basically infinite extra credit (high on midterm 1 was 143!) and will do his best to explain any questions. Tests are fair in that if you study the material there are no curve balls. It can be hard but it is very fair. He's very passionate about what he does!

I have had him 2 semesters in a row now. I think most of the frustration on here comes from his first semester here. He was a lot more difficult in foundations 1 than when I had him again for foundations 2. The tests are always fair and based on hw and he gives lots of extra credit. He has a clear love for the subject and I learned a lot from him.

Ali is an amazing professor that is very accessible to his students outside of his office hours. He is keen to help struggling students, however, improper feedback on assignments and inconsistent grading schedule for homework and midterms are factors that make his class difficult for students. But his midterms are easy and a lot of extra credit.

Although many of the tests take from the homework, there were many instances where you would get full marks for the homework, but a 0 for the same exact problem with the same exact proof on a test. Little to no feedback from homework as well. Has written things such as did you even study on a low score test.

No feedback at all on graded assignments/tests/quizzes. Homework is often hard, points deduction are often unclear, average test/quiz scores are often on the failing zone, unclear on what he wants as the answer, doesn't give partial credit to an answer, bad at explaining complex concepts. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
Ali was a very tough and unclear grader who gave little feedback. At the least, he gave a lot of extra credit

He was one of my best Professors so far at OSU. His office hours were 24/7. He was passionate about his job and tried hard to understand materials. The extra credit helps me a lot to boost my grade. The course wasnt easy, but as long as you dont miss the class and do all your homework and extra credit, you will get a decent grade.
Homework and tests are always beyond the level of this class. He has office hour almost every day but seldom show up before tests. Be ready to learn by yourself!!!

I took his foundations 1 class. Overall, extremely difficult grader and gives literally no feedback on tests/quizzes. His extra credit is helpful but class averages even with extra credit were easily failing grades. Despite this, he says no to curving. If youre forced to take his class, make sure to ask for help and clarification on missed points.

I almost come to his office hours every week to make sure I understand all the things in the note and the questions in homework. Reading the textbook before the lecture could make sure I understand his class well. The exams and quizzes are quite easy because they are all in the homework or notes. With the extra credits, I got full marks on quizzes.

One of my biggest issues that I had in Ali's class was that the class was never provided back proper feedback on homeworks and extra credits. Another issue was that our homeworks were often graded after tests and quizzes which should not happen. The tests and quizzes are quite hard but it is offset by the fact that a lot of extra credit is provided

He's actually pretty good, except for the fact that he has his grad students make the slides, give the lectures, write the homeworks, labs and exams and then grade them. He has office hours though, even though he doesn't understand any of the content in his own course, mostly because he has his grad students do everything for him.

Only CSE prof I've had that doesn't present their own slides. Instead, has his grad students do the lecture work for him while he's sitting around on his laptop. It's clear a number of people are fairly lost since the slides aren't well made, and it's overall a shame he's not more involved keeping it together (especially given his experience).
Nice guy

Lecture/lab attendance is not required (required in some sections). Erika did her best and was ok at lecturing. Review materials were very helpful (which some other sections did not get). The cse 2221 content is easy but the course design is brutally bad. Be prepared to learn core concepts yourself. Highly recommend Goetz for 2221.

Erika was pretty decent. She didn't really know some of the stuff and I wish she would've explained some stuff better. Prepare to spend lots of time outside class (especially towards the end, the last 2 projects are horrible.). The tests in this course are awful. They are told to grade harshly and I lost points for really dumb things.

Dr. Paparrizos is a caring professor who genuinely supports his students' success. His structured lectures make modern DBMS design clear, and the class offers free-form projects to explore the material deeply. He rewards extra effort with extra credit and even curves despite the class being very fair. Highly recommend!

On day one Prof. Chiu gives the following adage: "Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself." She takes this to heart, meaning she doesn't teach much. After midterm 1, the tests are MUCH harder than the homeworks. Memorize everything on the slides. She also doesn't release practice midterms, problem sets, or reasons you missed points.
She doesn't understand the concepts taught.

her lectures are very boring and based off the textbook that she provides a digital copy of. she is very responsive through email and allowed me an extension for a project. her exams are exactly like the homeworks and she allows a cheat sheet every exam which is super helpful

She has a very poor teaching methodology that does not engage students to learn the material. She is unwilling to work with students. Most of my learning of the material had to take place outside of the classroom. It was difficult to understand what was important based on her teaching, because of that, I did not feel prepared for the coursework.
Was very impatient when I asked her questions and can make you feel dumb. Also, can't articulate clearly and doesn't seem to understand concepts herself.

Prof. Chiu is a great professor who truly cares about her students. There are a couple lectures a week for about 1 and a half hours each. There are 3 exams, where exam 2 and the final are a lot more challenging. Aside from class attendance, reading is a must, as there is a material she does not cover very much in lectures that is in the book.

Her class is all about understanding. She gives some pop quizzes as extra credit in the class and all the tests and quiz will be based on your understanding of the lecture. Just review her slides several times and you will get an A in her course.
Prof. Chiu is one of my favorite professors in CSE, she is really helpful and nice. She really cares about students.
mid 2 for cse3241 has the average 59/100. Who want to take it? At least I don't want to take it again.

Dr. OQuinn is a good lecturer who takes time to make sure students are following the material. The required/graded workload is light, but optional content is heavy: optional content consists of videos or readings (you need these to do well imo). 
Pros:
Good lecturer
Pretty easy grader
Very nice person
Cons:
Hard-ish tests
Slow grader

The lectures are interesting and he genuinely cares about and has experience in the material. The problems on the tests encourage thinking about real-life scenarios rather than regurgitating lecture notes. The only thing I'd say is that he does not give much feedback, although he is quite lenient.

The lectures are good but dry. He moves a bit fast at times but consistently checks to make sure people are following. The real reason I am writing this review is because he was so understanding and helpful when I went through a major life event. He is a very understanding and clearly wants to help students succeed and understand.
His exams are difficult and he is very heavy on participation, definitely don't recommend him.

He makes this class so much harder than it needs to be. For the project, he will make you do Java, so take it with another professor if you hate it. Also, he makes his exams unnecessarily difficult such as docking points for selecting the wrong choice on a multiple answers question. Youre better off with another prof, so avoid Leon at all costs!!

Prof. Madrid is very caring and has a great attitude towards educating his students, although his grading can be quite harsh. I learned a lot from him in CSE 1222, particularly because he made a concerted effort to explain abstract concepts clearly. English might be his first language, so I had difficulty following some of the complicated ideas.

Madrid is a very sweet professor with the cutest accent. His class might seem boring at times but he really cares about his students and their success. Always down for office hours and will be there to listen to your complaints about the awful graders. Made the most heartfelt speech that made the class tear up. Definitely recommend over Zina.
He is very lazy. The online tests and online labs are a nightmare. The tests are full of trick questions. The content is easy, but the class is very hard.

CSE 3241 is an easy subject; databases are simple and intuitive, but Leon Madrid is obsessed with making poorly-designed exams that frustrate his students. The class is a nanny-state where Leon forces students to participate in his mediocre lectures using absurdly inflated participation grades. Beware he uses Proctorio as well! Avoid at all costs!

Leon is by far the worst lecturer I've ever had. He cannot communicate information clearly, he uses TopHat obsessively, and it every test question he writes is trying to trick you. He makes grammatical mistakes on his tests, making questions even more ambiguous. Also, he makes the project way more difficult than others professors. Take the 8am!

Tests were hard, but there were a lot of projects that made it easier to get a better grade. Tophat required during class. He was very helpful over email every time that I emailed him. Always quick responses with well thought out and helpful answers. Office hours with him and the TAs were very helpful.

He was extremely kind, and made an effort to keep things fun in class. The exams are really the downfall- they're designed to be extremely difficult if you don't memorize the slides. The homework assignments, lectures, and even the group project were great learning experiences, and I was grateful to have Leon to help through everything.

Professor is nice and he will answer all the problems you meet whether it is about the project or about the content of the class. He is very generous with the points given to the project. But for the exam, he will not give any curves. In my section, there are three exams and the median score on each test is around 75. If you want A, be hard.

I'm surprised how some people here are rating him. I thought he was one of the best professors I had at OSU. Admittedly his class is not easy, it's probably about a 7 from a 1-10 scale. I think his class is hard because his exams are relatively tough, but he makes the content interesting and he is very helpful and nice.

Be prepared for an overly tedious group project. I spent about 30 hours writing Java that wasn't required for the other section, but at least he grades them pretty generously. Our average on the final was a 69 & he didn't curve anything. Wording on exam questions is sometimes confusing & he does very little to clarify questions. Not helpful

While professor Madrid might seem like a nice guy, he is not a good professor. His class consists of him reading off a PowerPoint the entire time. The examples given out in class and on the homework are no where near the level of difficulty on the exams. Exams are brutal if you have no prior database experience. Be ready for a semester long project

Don't get me wrong, super nice guy, lectures are just hard to stay awake in. The material itself is pretty interesting and not too difficult, but the thick accent and lack of teaching skills makes it hard to want to keep going. Exams were mid, not too hard if you know your stuff but be prepared to have to know almost everything and the exceptions.
Prof. Madrid is very boring, although knowledgeable of course content. The canvas page is organized really poorly and the assignments are often unclear. I would not take this course again.

Nice guy but not a good professor. He's not great at giving examples or directions. The class content was super interesting but it takes lots of learning on your own. His accent makes it hard to understand at times as well. Also not great with SLDS. I would try to take someone else if I had the option but overall not someone to actively avoid.

A great person who can sometimes struggle to get lectures across because of his accent. Lectures can be dense but he makes himself accessible outside of class which can be extremely beneficial. He clearly tries to be a great professor though not quite there yet.

He's a really nice and caring guy. Unfortunately, he is not the best professor. Our final was a miserable 36 hour long take home test that was literally the same as the group project we did over the entire course. Just in a smaller time frame. Lectures are not super clear either.
Great guy, just not a good instructor, hard to understand even when he explains things multiple times and his accent doesn't help.

Any CSE student taking this class has likely worked with SQL in some capacity via internships or freelance work, and theyre forced to not only relearn the subject, but *unlearn* it in the way they were taught. Combine all that with a group project with kids who have never written a line of code in their life... terrible class with an outdated prof

He's a nice guy, but he's kind of a tough grader, and his lectures are pretty dry. He also gets pretty off topic easily during class - he spends too much time on easier concepts and not enough time on hard concepts.

Full-term group database project--make sure you get a good group, and DON'T PUT IT OFF. It's a lot of work, but ultimately as long as you put effort into it, he doesn't grade it harshly. Gives daily in-class activities, only takes the highest 15 so you have a buffer to miss class but you can't skip on a routine basis. Exams were average difficulty.

He is one of the best professors I ever had in my entire college year. If you understand the slide and put some effort you would do good in the exam. HE is accessible outside of class and super helpful. He cares about his students. I don't know why other rating says dry lecture but I understood his lecture clearly. He is an awesome professor.

The class was surprisingly easy? The exams were all Carmen quizzes. He's an alright lecturer and takes feedback well, but he and the graders were very vague in their instructions for the final project. Mostly theoretical stuff in databases; not very applicable as far as application embedding goes, which is the main practical use of a database.

Leon was awesome, took feedback throughout the semester and applied it to improve. Took this course with little to no CSE background (non-major here :) and had no trouble keeping up, the class is pure logic.

Dr. Madrid is very caring and always asks for feedback to improve the class. There is a lot of project work, but the skills you learn are applicable to real world DB systems. The wording on his tests can be confusing and frustrating at times, but you can also explain your reasoning and he does give points back on occasion.
Very organized. Bit of an accent. Does want students to learn, acts on reasonable feedback. Semester-long group project.

Lectures are dry. Multiple choice questions on exams were sometimes confusingly worded and the "correct" answers were debatable. Lots of partner homework assignments. However, halfway through the semester he did take feedback from students and used it to improve the course immediately. Accessible outside of class and truly cares about students
unreasonable hard exam; whole class only get 3% correctness on some questions. Study by yourself. Very time consuming projects, labs and homework with tough grading. Avoid him if possible.

His lectures were  boring and it was hard to stay focused. Also the provided notes were not enough to get you to finish lab during the time period. during labs he was very clear and more helpful then in lectures but then again there's only one of him and a full class. can get though the class with stack overflow though

Leon is like any other low level CSE professor.  Reads from the slides and assigns projects and homework that have been mostly predetermined by the department.  He isn't a horrible teacher, but you have to spend some time on your own to completely understand the classes topics. Projects and tests are doable.  An A is achievable in this class.

The class itself (C++) is not bad. The in-labs were very long and time-consuming, but the homeworks were easy. That being said, I learned more from just doing the final project than going to class. Madrid basically reads off the slides in class, but took attendance even though we didn't have an attendance grade. Helpful if you ask for it.

Leon Madrid has probably been the most helpful professor I've had at OSU. He is genuinely interested in helping students succeed and loves to answer questions. CSE 2123 can be difficult, so you must study for exams. However, if you study, exams are very fair and an A is possible. I'm by no means a CSE wiz but still succeeded (A) with hard work.

Not quite sure as to why there is so much negative feedback about Leon. He is super friendly and very helpful. I really enjoyed his class; probably one of my favorites at OSU. Know the material from the powerpoints and the homework and you should be fine. Curves at the end of the semester.

Only grades were from labs, a project, and a handful of homeworks. The labs took deceptively long due to vague wording and scripting being finnicky. Project wasn't too bad, but start early. Homeworks were easy.  Kind of bad lecturer because his examples aren't fleshed out and he tends to rush through the topics. Pretty helpful in person though

He uses very technical vocab to describe new concepts that makes it difficult to understand. He reads straight off the powerpoint slides so there isn't much reason to go to class. He grades tough even on closed labs. That being said he is a nice guy and willing to work with you if you visit him during office hours.
Yeah his assignments, tests and lecture is confusing and full of ambiguity.

Had Prof. Madrid for a 1 credit hour Maymester class. Lecture slides were copied from another professor's lecture and from the textbook, we were told to read one chapter, and the next day expected to have read three different chapters. Labs were difficult and late being put up and often changed over the weekend. 2/10, would not recommend.

Tests and homework assignments are very difficult. You must know the material well, as the tests demand extending your knowledge further. While I don't have too much issue with that, no one was expecting that on the first midterm. Madrid is a nice guy and his inexperience shows, but I do feel he's gotten better over the semester.

I signed up for this class because I was generally interested in learning the material and finding out more about how computer architecture worked. However, this is probably one of the most confusing professors I've ever had in my life. His lectures are not helpful and exams verge on being extremely hard/impossible to get a great score on.

Hands down the worst professor I've had in CSE. His lectures are confusing, his homework will cover topics you haven't learned, the midterms are extremely difficult, and he expects you to be an expert to pull put a decent grade.

Terrible professor, his lectures are confusing, his answers to the questions are more confusing, bunch of errors on his slides, and extremely hard exams. If you are taking this class with him make sure to keep up with the book, and know the material really well because his exams are really hard.
really liked this class her lectures are solid and she explains the content well but this class is very homework heavy with 3-5 assignments regularly

Catherine is great! Her lectures are boring, but she is the best. If you're struggling with a lab, her explanations are great. I really struggled with the class and she did her best to accommodate me. She just wants people to get good grades! She was also really good about changing grades if the TAs graded too hard and you brought it up to her!

Catherine is lowkey the goat. Her lectures are super boring, and you can figure out how to do the work without the lectures pretty easily, but if you actually show up and listen this class is insanely easy. She's way better at excel than you would expect, and I'm pretty pleased with how easy she made everything to comprehend.

This class isn't that difficult, just don't procrastinate on pre-labs and in-labs. The tests are all multiple choice so if you know what you're doing then you can easily use process of elimination on every question. If you have a question, go to office hours! She cares about her students success and is always willing to help.

Professor Mckinley was very caring and ensured that every student understood what was being taught.  She was easily accessible during office hours and willing to help.  The class workload is manageable and everything is clearly laid out in the syllabus and on what will be graded.

The material in this class is easy its just the pre labs might take a while to do but there is always help from the TA's and I recommend them. Always go to the In-Labs to complete the in-lab assignments and it is way easier and you will get it done faster if you do. The pre-labs will take around 1 to 3 hours to complete so DON'T do it last minute.

Class is super easy and Mckinley is really good at thoroughly explain the material. She explains the concepts at scratch and at a slow pace (too slow sometimes), but that is wayyy better than professors who go too fast. She is also nice, so definitely go up and ask any questions you have.

Professor McKinley was an amazing professor. She cares a lot about her students and was very accessible outside of class. Even set aside time to help me set up Citrix when I got Covid and missed class. The class is very easy and she explains it well.
also was rude in class and never answered emails

Love catherine!! She is super helpful and accessible outside of class. Not going to lie and say her class is easy, I'm a CIS minor and coding comes easy to me but her class was definitely a solid amount of work. Wasn't 'easy' in the sense that you can skip lectures and just BS everything but it's easy where if you do the work you'll get an A.

Some of the -ve reviews are unfair and its mainly students angry because of the Covid format. SU22 We are back to in class and let me tell you, she cares a lot about her students and is willing to help you if you put to the effort to ASK. I remember her replying to my email 8:30PM at night about a question I had for the lab. Shoutout to TA Tinggang

I never met Professor McKinley once throughout this course, due to the online format. Class is structured with weekly pre-labs and in-labs, as well as a quiz over the course notes for the week. I found the coursework interesting and helpful, but I can see how many people would not like it. It is rather tedious.
packed with work, and professor seemed rude in her email responses.

Professor McKinley was a great professor. The class she taught was easy so long as you read the lecture notes. Her class consisted of weekly quizzes, 3 exams (on excel and access), and weekly pre labs & in labs. Luckily her lectures were not required as her teaching style is very boring. Reach out to her and she will be more than willing to help.
I really enjoyed this class and its very possible to do well in the class. Class could sometimes be boring and prelabs could be occasionally tricky but overall a solid class and I learned a lot.
Was a nice lady, but the class is horribly taught. Hard class

I feel like Dr McKinley gets a bad reputation sometimes, the class is definitely not amazing but it's completely doable. I went to every class and did all the practice she made available and was completely fine on her tests. The labs are collaborative so they're not bad. Sure, the lectures are a bit boring but she's willing to help if you reach out

I really enjoyed having class with Professor McKinley, she is incredibly kind and always willing to help out. I went to office hours and she explained everything well and helped me understand it. Finally a professor who actually cares about their students. Definitely would recommend class with her!

She is the nicest person I've ever met. I've gone to her office hours and she has been a huge help. I've skipped class a few times and I never felt behind although attendance is taken every day. Highly recommend taking this course with her.

She is such a great person and professor! I loved her class. The quizzes and exams are pretty easy and kind of similar to the study guides. The textbook is only used twice, so I would suggest making a friend in her class to do those book-related pre-labs together to save money (maybe split the cost or something).

Catherine is very understanding. If you ever have any trouble she is more than willing to help during office hours. She is only the 2nd professor in my entire degree who I felt like cared about me and my grade/future. Class is still difficult, prefabs take FOREVER and exams are harder than any practice problems! Good luck!

Catherine is a nice person, but her lectures are quite boring. Sometimes class ended early, which was nice. It's not really her fault that this course is poorly taught and structured. Practice problems should be your best friend. Do as many as you can. Don't procrastinate on pre-labs. The class is structured this way b/c of the course coordinator.

Honestly, just horrible. She means well, but the lectures are horrendous, and very unorganized; as are her thoughts. Hard to follow anything she's trying to teach. The practice worksheets in class are always filled with mistakes, which she just ends up putting the answers on Carmen. Basically, be prepared to do many practice problems by yourself.

a very boring lecturer. makes it difficult to concentrate. honestly, skipped most lectures bc online lectures are more helpful and you can skip around. she talks slowly and doesn't seem to know a lot about excel.

Catherine doesn't act like she knows what she is doing. Online lectures by Lori Rice proved more helpful than in class lecture, and even he videos had multiple mistakes in them. She doesn't seem to care about any of the material, and just tries getting through it every class. Catherine has only made the material more difficult by making mistakes.

Nice lady, she's understanding, but at the end of the day that's beside the point. You can do every practice problem available, attend every lecture, and study over 10 hours a week & that still will not be enough. MidtermFinal are extremely difficult; the problems on these exams are on a whole new level compared to the problems given as practice.
Lectures are long and monotonous. Hard to concentrate and it doesn't make the material easier to understand.
She is nice. She talks slowly during class. I think she is fine. It is not that hard to study for her class

Bad lecturer. Lectures are boring. Help is not given as she constantly doesn't have the time for you. She talks extremely slow. Wouldn't take this class again. Explanations are not clear and just makes things even more confusing. A lecturer whom doesn't care much about her students and just wants to get the job done.

Definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU. Extremely knowledgeable and cares a lot about his students; always willing to give extra help whether its about a topic in class, or just about your major/track in general. Even though I took this online, he still engaged really well with students. I highly recommend taking his class!

Great professor: although the course was fully online; I would love to retake his course if I could in person. He encourages you to learn via content checks/oral exams and isn't afraid to help you out. Make sure to rely on his lecture notes and don't be afraid to rewatch some of the lectures in case they don't make sense!

Helped make the material very easy to understand and was accessible outside of class for help. Uses R a lot to show and apply statistical concepts, which was great as a CS major. Be prepared to do weekly content check ins on Zoom and oral exams instead of on paper, but they're less scary than they sound.

Dr. Metzger was awesome. Any time I had a question over email or office hours, he was quick to assist and explain the process to solving whatever problem I had. He is clearly passionate about the course and engaged with the students. He holds everyone to a high standard but in a respectful way. Probably the best professor I've had at OSU so far.

He is very knowledgeable about what he teaches and is always willing to help during class or office hours. He is very accommodating with office hours and exam times. His class alternated between live lectures and pre-recorded lectures with class used as office hours, which wasn't a huge deal for me.

Dr. Metzger is a good professor (as long as you really care about statistics, and attend EVERY lecture). Attendance is 10% and he isn't very flexible. Students who attend office hours seem to get a lot out of the course. If you want to take a more passive approach, consider another professor.

Lectures were coherent and helpful.
Gives very clear lectures and somehow manages to make statistics make sense. STAT 3202 with him is pretty consistently tough but it never feels unfair or impossible to grasp. Very nice too

Professor Metzger has very clear explanations of the material and clear expectations of what you need to know. He does a fantastic job expanding on topics as the class dives deeper. He goes back and forth between written material and R code, making it easy to connect the code to the material, unlike in my 3201 class. Also, helpful during office hrs

Me and my classmates have agreed that Dr. Metzger is the best professor we've had at OSU so far. Engaging and clear lectures with very helpful office hours. He helps make the course material relatively easy, so if you go to class, pay attention, and spend a handful of hours per week on the class you'll be fine.

I do not like numbers or coding, but I enjoyed this class. He was clear, and went over pretty much everything we needed to know in some decent YouTube videos. Props to him for his comments about the N High St bikers SP2020. He was very accessible and helpful in e-mail. His notes were very insightful.
Any class that you need to take that professor Metzger teaches, take it with him. Great professor and teaches and explain statistical concepts extremely well.
Dr. Metzger was so outstanding, I don't really have much to write. I just hope he still teaches the statistics capstone by the time I take it, so I can have another class with him.
Absolute legend. Fair exams and hw, good lectures, as long as you put in the effort you'll do well.

Professor Metzger is the one of the best professor that I met in OSU. I almost went to every of his office hour, which is very helpful. He'd like to help students and he's friendly to international students. Definitely recommend taking his STAT courses!
low-key have a crush on him, he's THAT amazing. I would take all his courses and be a statistics major just for him if I could. Super down-to-earth and cool guy.

Hands down my favorite professor ever. He explains material incredibly well, even through pre-recorded lectures, and really prepares you well for the midterms & homework assignments. All 3 exams typically take 3-4 hours, but the average grade between both midterms is a 95%. Just spend the energy engaging with his class & you'll have no trouble.

Yup, definitely best Professor I've ever had. I would sometimes zone out during class thinking about how well he just explained a topic. He put in so much effort to make sure his students were able to succeed and pushed us to think for ourselves. Didn't think I liked statistics till I took his course.

Thomas is straight up the best teacher I have ever had. The material in the middle of the class is tricky but he explains it so well. You'll have to earn your grade, but its easily possible if you put the time in. If I could take this man for every stats class I would.

Metzger was one of the best professors I have ever had. He explained material in an understandable way while also challenging students to think critically. His exams were on the harder side, but he prepares students well. He spent the time to learn the name of every student in the class, and genuinely cared that his students.

Great professor. He's super caring and helpful. Never felt intimidated to ask him questions. Lectures were clear and informative and he often spent half the class going over practice examples. Projects are graded purely based on passing test cases, which you're given examples of for each project. You can definitely get an A on all projects.
Beware of COAM, he COAMed 25% of the class because there was overlap and similar code in their submission

The first lab has a pretty brutal learning curve but once you get past that one the rest of them are really interesting and enjoyable. Prof. Bond is a super nice guy and he is a very patient lecturer. There really isn't that much course content so his midterm and final weren't difficult; if you put time and effort into his labs you'll do just fine.

Professor Bond is the man. Probably the best professor I've had in CSE at OSU. Cares about students and fairness, super patient and non-judgmental of questions, extremely knowledgeable of the subject matter, humble, and super dry, funny sense of humor to boot. Definitely take 3341 with him.

Overall a great professor. He explains concepts clearly in lecture and provides you with everything you need to succeed. I wasn't originally excited to take this class at first but he made it doable and interesting as well. Projects and exams can be hard but if you put in forth effort you will be successful!

This course was definitely difficult to me, especially the projects, but they are doable if you put in the effort and go to office hours. Office hours were huge for me to ask questions and really understand what was going on in the projects. Michael is a good teacher and very willing to help you out when you are struggling.

Awesome professor! The projects were quite time consuming and a bit difficult, but the homeworks weren't too bad and the exams were fair. He is very knowledgeable about the subject and able to explain and answer questions about the material well.

The coding projects were tricky at times but fun - getting 100% on each one of them is very doable. Attendance was optional and lectures were recorded, but the blackboard was not recorded so definitely show up to lecture. He is a really good communicator and is very easy going. Exams are very fair and he provides practice problems.

Prof. Bond is one of my favorite professors in CSE. He really cares about students. His lectures sometimes involve some hands-on programming, related to our projects, which is very helpful. He has some funny jokes to tell during lectures. He is also very responsive online and offline to answering questions. Gonna miss him after leaving OSU.

Michael is a young, smart teacher. He really knows how to relate to the class and his teaching is easy to understand and entertaining. The projects in the class can be challenging, but the material is simple and makes the project easy to understand. Exams can also be challenging, but if you study well, they end up not being to difficult.

This professor is one of the best I have had at OSU in the CSE department. He really puts work into teaching and preparing for class and enjoys figuring out answers to students' questions. His projects sometimes weren't the clearest, and homework I found to be thought provoking, but they well prepared me for the exams. Would recommend!
Really good professor who enjoys his research work
One of the best professors in Ohio State CSE department. Cares a lot for students.
speaks very clearly. Explains the material well. For not understanding the material when attending classes you need to be a fool...  The grading is rough though

He's a very nice guy and very lenient with grading. Brings in snacks sometimes. Class is a little boring but that's more just the topic. He does speak a little monotone which can get old, but otherwise no complaints.

Phelps is a great guy. Has decades of experience in CS but doesn't fall under any of the bad stereotypes you might associate with that. Very clear and informative lectures but still finds time to bond with the class with segments like his "Life Lessons With Larry". Makes all course content himself and truly wants you to succeed.

He's very passionate about the material and clearly has a very deep knowledge of all things pertaining to information security. This course is not difficult, and he does a very good job at making lectures interesting and explaining the concepts well. This class is largely based around memorization of terms and subjects. Awesome professor!
Super helpful and approachable. Made the class a breeze while still being very interesting.

She's a great professor and cares about her students. Pretty easy class and it's easy to sit down and work far ahead quickly. Usually 2-3 assignments weekly that take maybe an hour if you are efficient. Would definitely take again and I wish the class dove a little deeper into Excel.

She was nice until I asked about my accommodations with SLDS. After that she was incredibly hard to reach via email and openly hostile with me. Gave me panic attacks thinking about her class. Really awful experience.

Worst professor I've ever had. Tried to accuse me of misconduct the first week of school. Harsh deadlines and exam heavy. Tons of work outside class. Does not teach the information well. I get she's reading slides someone else made but it seems shes learning it for the first time too. Yet another class I had to teach myself.

I loved having Kitty as my CSE professor. She is one of the most helpful and approachable professors I have ever had. Tests can be tough but she tells you exactly what is on the test and helps you as much as possible. Class gets easier as you go! If you practice the material you can get an A. Only thing that sucked about this class was the long lab
She is easy comparing to other cse teachers. Her exams r way easier n straightforward then other CSE classes. just study hard before exams, u will get A!

Although she can sometimes struggle with clarity and thoroughness during lecture, her willingness to help after class and enormous office hour windows ensure you will never be lost.  She almost acts like a personal tutor outside of class, and this is fantastic given the volume of problems you will unlikely be able to solve alone.

Very nice and enthusiastic, spends too much time on the early class material and too little on late class. Final was the hardest test ive ever taken. Its a 50/50. I thought she was a decent instructor but the class was hard as hell.

Extremely confusing course organization,  assignment descriptions are meticulous (ie. 3-4 hours of data entry per week).  The microphone seems to be broken during each week's lecture- can't hear a thing amidst frustrated sighs from students.  If you're a mac user, you'll definitely need Office Excel for Mac, not "Numbers."  Besides that, no advice.

Very unorganized class. Difficult to understand what's expected of you or how to complete homework assignments (most of which take 3-4 hours of data entry per week).  The lecture hall microphone seemed broken, or used improperly, and with 200 students with laptops open, it made everything even more frustrating.  I have no advice for you- good luck.

Awful class. Material covered is not comprehensive, neither is the textbook. To top it off, she is one of the worst teachers I have had at Ohio State. Don't ever take her class. She is neither helpful nor knowledgeable as far as this subject goes.

CSE 360 is an awful class covering assembly language. To top it off, Reeves isn't very knowledgeable in assembly, so even if you attend class it won't help a lot. Homework is hard and graded based on correctness. If you get the choice, take 360 with Bettina Beir. If Reeves is your only choice, don't even waste your time.
Very helpful and understanding.

CSE 200 is a hard class, but of the 4 lecturers who teach it, she is the best.  If you have the opportunity, schedule with her.  She has a lot of personality and she posts old tests and quizzes on her website.
Quizez and Exams are not hard. Just study them the day before. Be careful of the labs.
Attend every class. Concentrate on class materials. Solve every practice quizzes & exams. Prepare for labs. You can get an A, if you STUDY.

Teacher was so boring, Nothing was exciting in the class. Do not take this class at OSU, Everything was hard. I put in at least 7 quality hours every week (labs,prelabs,practice quiz/exam, hw) attended class all the time and got a C. I am a 3.85 student and now my GPA is screwed up because of this worthless class. You will never have to use Access.

Kitty was really helpful. If you have to take the class, definitely take it with her. She gives you plenty of help (all previous quizzes and keys), as well as extra time for quizzes compared to others. She's a great teacher and I really enjoyed the class because of her.

I highly recommend attending class. I feel I would've gotten an A had I not been such a bum. Labs were incredibly easy but pre-labs sometimes take a while. Study for quizzes and exams and you should be fine. Thought midterm was much easier than final. Attendance not mandatory (and she tells you this). She also has no control over the class. CURVE!

easy enough if you put in the necessary work. prior experience with excel and access is a definite benefit. prelabs take a while, don't put them off. the book was never used except for prelabs, so try to share with a friend if you can to save money; course notes are necessary though. definitely do the practice tests

This class is easy IF you attend class and do the practice problems. Labs can be long sometimes but overall are easy. Reeves is very helpful when visiting her office hours. The main thing is to practice, which she gives you plenty of sample exams, and you should get a good grade. (Not to mention her curve)

I disagree with the post below. This course is NOT easy for everyone, so don't try to show off. For me, learning the class material was like like learning stuff in a new math or language course, you either get it or you don't. Professor Reeves was very nice and understanding,was always willing to help, and curves grades to make things fair.

Look guys, this class is extremely easy...if you keep up with it and do the practice problems.  All the people that say she's hard are part of the lower learning curve here at Ohio State.  Think about it, EVERYONE in the business school is required to take this class.  You will retain the most from this class more than any other class here at OSU.

Reeves does a really good job explaining the material.  If you need help, go to her office hours!  She is really nice.  All her previous quizzes/midterms/finals are on her website so if you fail; its your own fault.  Pre labs are aweful!  You will spend hours on them.  Pre-labs are the hardest part of this class.  Oh, and leacture is really boring!

unhelpful, unclear and disorganized. Homeworks were graded extremely difficultly. Does not keep up with posting things on carmen at all. Grading goes from very hard to easy, unclear how things will be evaluated. Treats the class as if they were back in 3rd grade. High grade certainly possible if you are willing to put up with some bs along the way.

This class is unnecessarily difficult. I cant believe its just a one hundred level course.  Its ridiculous! I really didnt like her at all.  Shes phony and is definitely not on the side of the students.  Theres tons of hw, labs, and they slaughter you on the tests and hw. This class is awful and very hard to understand.  Dont take it if possible!
This class is unnecessarily hard, but if you put time into it you can get a good grade. Quiz/test format just sucks, but I guess there really isn't any better way to do them.
dont take her class ever
easy if you do all the practice quizzes/tests and labs. sit next to someone smart in labs and youll ace all of them.

Really not that hard of a class.  Don't listen to waht everyone says, this class is more than manageable.  Take advantage of the practice quizzes and exams she has on her website, it definately helps.  With a little effort you should do well.  She is willing to help if you have any questions.

Class can be boring, but the material learned helps so much in the business world. All previous quizzes and tests are on her website and are all very similar, so study from those and you wont have any problems. She is very nice and has good office hours and will always help. She also has a guaranteed curve of 20% will get A's and 30% will get B's.

I think the class is really made harder than it should be.  The subject matter is relatively easy, and I'm not even sure some of the insane things we were asked to do on tests we'll even have to do in real life.  Tests and quizzes are on paper rather than on computer.  She does put up a lot of review materials, however.  Do well on the labs though!

Not a great teacher.  The class requires a lot of work and that will determine your grade.  Puts lots of practice material online , and it helps a lot.  The material isn't too hard, it just takes a lot of work to do well.  Very organized teacher.  Seemed fairly willing to help.  Try to boost grade with good lab scores.

Good teacher for a pretty boring subject. The course itself is a hell of a lot of work, especially labs. Mid-terms and quizzes are pretty tough but she provides plenty of practice on her webpage. Even with a lot of work you can expect around a B probably.

I took this class with Mallon and   Reeves. I prefer Reeves because she gives you more time to take the 50pt weekly quizzes, 45min instead of 25min (Mallon).  I would suggest doing the homework (not required) and the practice quizzes provided on Reeves website. This class is the most time consuming class I've ever taken period, be prepared.

Ok, I think its pointless enough that we take a computer class and have tests on paper. These are computer software classes and we only work on computers in lab! The midterms are on the paper! To me that is just assinine. She wasn't much help and her tests have compliated problems that you don't know where they came from.

I thought the class was pretty easy, but Reeves wasn't much help.  Sometimes she seemed like she didn't know what she was talking about.  I probably could have done just as well without ever going to class.
the whole cse 200 department should be properly reviewed. lots of hw, lots of quizes and u have to spend like 3 hrs min on each weekly lab!! u really have to work ur a** off!!

She's willing to help students, and very friendly. But she doesnt know what she's talking about. Lectures are boring. Rambles a lot, and sometimes unclear about what she's teaching. good personality though.

Kitty would answer any questions you asked her through e-mail or after class, however asking these questions was almost imperative, becausee she was very unclear during class. Class is very hard. Avoid.

she was a very nice teacher and willing to help and improve herself as a teacher. material isnt too bad, just easy to make stupid mistakes which can bring your grade down. do the practice problems and you should be OK
Not the best teacher at OSU but definitely better than getting Mallon or Gross for this class.

kitty doesn't really know what she is talking about, and is is not willing to budge when a test is misgraded.  she is sometimes sarcastic in answering questions, and makes stupid comments. the class isn't hard...pay attention...do the work
She could be all over the place, but the class if fine. Not too hard, and I learned some things that will actually pay off.

The class is not hard if you pay attention and go to lab. "stupid mistakes" is what brings your grade down. There are so many little things to remember for the tests, and sometimes you just forget them :) Kitty was ok
good teacher

I advise NOT to take her class. She is tooo strict and difficult. She is not lenient at all when it comes to tests, labs etc. COBOL can be challenging, and she does not make it any easier. She needs to curve the class better.

like all computer info classes, this is a hard course. the key is going to class and paying attention. no matter who your professor is, this class will not be a walk in the park. kitty was cool, and a good professor though.
Do not take CSE 200 w/ Kitty Reeves, she has no clue what she is talking about   instead take with Mallon or Blair

this teacher, like other postings have said, make quizes and tests extra diffacult. she enjoyed talking about the fact even she could not get a perfect score on her own tests. but i hear that debbie gross is slightly worse.

I disagree with the negative comments.  This professor is so nice.  The material is boring no matter who teaches it.  These classes tend to be large and it's easy to get distracted.  Keep up with your work in here.  I will admit the class was very time intensive and difficult.  Teacher was extr. fai

This lady is an extremely bad teacher.  If you have any choice at all - DO NOT PICK THIS TEACHER.  As others have said, she makes the quizzes intentionally hard and confusing.  She doesnt care that her tests are so hard.  For the love of God, STAY AWAY FROM KATHY REEVES.

She was sooooooo boring. She would go on and on about things that didn't even relate to the class. My advise is to skip lecture and study on your own for the quizes and tests. Look at all the example quizes/tests, VERY similar!

not an understanding woman.  like many of the other reviews for the 200 level class said it seemed she enjoyed making the tests very tricky even though it was completely unnessecery (most of the students are just taking this class because its a requirement not because they enjoy working w/ access)
class was not interesting, and she acted like she enjoyed making test difficult.
She makes an effort to really help her students, but I don't think she's a great teacher. But the class isn't too bad
This teacher really seems to care and is willing to help if the student is willing to ask.

Great prof! Extremely nice and seemed to sincerely care about her students.  The class was very organized and she tried very hard to make it interesting (which is hard to do, but not by her fault).  She posts previous midterms, finals and quizzes to help you study.  Strongly recommended!
Avoid this teacher.

This teacher is awful.  She is not a professor, nor is she a graduate student.  Her tests are full of extremely devious and vague trick questions.  She must be trying to compensate for the boring and easy labs and classes.

She is very helpful if you ever go to her outside of class.  She pretty much completely showed me how to do one of my labs that I was having trouble on.  She makes very difficult tests, however, that it seems the only purpose is to bring down the average.
No Comments
No Comments
She's affable and extremely helpful. Our class' structure was rather disorganized but it was COBOL after all. I think she even structured it as much as she could.
hard if you are not too bright to begin with
Course was hard.

Very accessible, Very Caring guy and is very smart. He speaks very fast with a heavy accent so there will be times words merge together and you don't understand. I recommend going to office hours if you can to learn the actual content or search up privately. STUDY CALC, Linear alg and STATS it is 90% math 10% memorizing new ideas.

I would prefer to never take any of his online sections because they have awful timings and all he does in lectures is read out from the slides. This makes the class extremely boring. All these things add up to less than 10 students attending his class. He grades the projects pretty tough as well so I would strongly suggest on taking it in-person.
Super chill guy.

Pretty average lecturer (can be very boring and dry at some times). Where Dustin shines is his experience in the industry and the way he relates it to the class. He makes it very clear when something is relevant in today's careers and when something is obsolete. The class itself is pretty easy, you really have to mess up to fail. Would take again.
