Great professor, kind and down to earth, always willing to explain. Class is all based on Group Projects. He's flexible and lenient on grading, made a pretty tough class into a pretty chill class. Only criticism is that his lectures can be a bit dull and its easy to doze off. He's always accessible outside of class tho. Would recommend.

Not a very good professor. I learn by watching/doing examples, but he really didn't do a whole lot of examples and his examples weren't very good. He did a some things where he's like you won't need to know this but took 10min showing us.

This is a hard class, you must know the basics before you take this class. I needed help  with this class and Professor Pavkovich provided the time outside of class and re-explained what I needed to know. Thank you Professor Pavkovich!!!

I don't know what people are saying, this guy is the most useless lecturer I've ever had. Got an A because I can use excel but never went to class because it was a complete waste of time, even though it didn't have to be.
This class is hard, if yo need help beyond the class presentation, go see Professor Pavkovich after class... He will help you... He helped me!!!
There were 160 students, you must pay attention to his lecture. I saw him after class and he re-explained what I missed.
He often gets confused during lecture. Wants to help, just doesn't know how to explain the steps he uses.

A good starting point for an entry level programmer. Prof is very helpful outside class, even during non-office hours. Course content is not deep enough and classes can be a bit more interactive. And yeah, lots of homework.

I was a beginner in c++. I found the course content rather tough. But the good thing about this professor was you can reach out to her any time you want. She is really really helpful, compared to most others. The course load is a bit more. She was really patient with me throughout the entire course.

Reads off the powerpoint the entire class and class is super boring. Whenever she tries to create her own example, it is not correct. Very soft spoken. This class also has a LOT of homework and its incredible easy to lose points

Finn is the definition of the arrogant professor.  Posts nothing on Carmen, no notes or grades at all. Goes over everything once on the board and that is it, and typically his lessons didn't correspond to the book.  Refuses to answer email, won't use Piazza. Got a B somehow, but have no idea how I got there due to his policies.  Avoid if you can!

The course was not well-organized at all. He also gave some meaningless lab which require our computer run for more than 10 hours to get the results. He doesn't pose any thing on Carmen, and the requirements for the homework and exam were always confused. The midterms were not very tough but the grades were terrible. Try to avoid taking his class.

Dr. Finn does a great job explaining concepts, and he has industry experience which he incorporates into lectures and solid life advice.  To be successful, you have to show up and take good notes--he doesn't use Carmen or teach off of a slide deck.  He gives an interesting lecture, and he preps you well for his exams.  Highly recommend his class.
Moves very fast, only gives notes in class doesn't post grades on Carmen. Would not recommend

Assignment descriptions are generally vague and require asking questions for clarification. Assignments were very relevant to topics being discussed in class. Exam material not exceedingly difficult, but not enough time is given to complete them. Finn is funny and relatable, sometimes giving life advice. It is easy to ask him questions. Go to class

Smart man who knows his material very well. He writes everything on the blackboard and puts nothing online. Homework can be a bit tough but his office hours are incredibly helpful. Whereas some lecturers can be condescending, Finn was anything but. Midterms came right out from material we covered in class or hw, no surprises. Attend class or fail.

Not the hardest professor that I've ever had, but you should avoid him.  Hardly available for questions, sometimes contradicts himself and gives incorrect info. Also, he never set up the Carmen module and it was a 4 credit hour course.

The man is knowledgeable and lectures/teaches practical information and also likes to bring in information from his time spent in the industry. Tests are based on labs & what he goes over in class so YOU MUST GO TO CLASS.   Grades were fair and you walk away saying you learned something. I wouldn't hesitate to take another class with him!

Lectures were hard to follow, sometimes ending with incomplete code/solutions. Most questions asked were answered with "look at someone else's notes", so take this class with friends or be good at meeting new people, plus no notes posted online. Some problems on HW/exams were designed to trick students, so follow all directions exactly.

I have read many reviews about the professor before taking the his class and I was little bit scared to take his class. However, I found his class easy. Class average was 63 on midterms and he gave 12 extra points in the exams which was very helpful. Labs are hard though. His midterms contains atleast 2 questions directly from homework problems.

This class was not hard to pass but poorly organized. If you are interested in AI, take with someone else.  Finn was not a helpful instructor. He made up definitions that were contradicted to the textbook and even his own handouts, but if your answers aren't what he wants to see , you'll receive a zero.

Very degrading and unhelpful. During office hours he would google most of my questions and sometimes wouldn't even find an answer and just tell me I need to use google. Does not teach the class according to the syllabus and does what he wants. Piles on homework&doesn't teach material beforehand. TAKE WITH SOMEONE ELSE AT ALL COSTS!!!!

Not an exemplar professor: would occasionally tell students to "Google it" if asked a question, berated the class with a game of hangman when we didn't know a term, took literally months to grade assignments.

This class was poorly organized to say the least. Finn did not seem to have handles on how to present course material nor on his graders. The assignments and lecture material were haphazardly presented, and the course content was not laid out for students in a manageable way. It would have been better use of time to stay home and read the textbook.

Took his intro to AI section. Unorganized, especially on the more difficult parts of the course. Made us use MATLAB for a programming assignment for no reason. Not on top of his graders at all; only had two grades up until the last few weeks of the class. Stresses memorization to the detriment of content. Would not recommend. Kind of a jerk too.

This class is tossed together. AI is an interesting topic but I regret taking the class. Finn has no lesson plan, in fact he asks the students what to teach. The assignments are randomly dumped on the class when he feels like it. And the test get moved around too. They are difficult but cover the material. You need to read everything, just to pass.

Prof. Finn was Amazing. He's defiantly one of the better CSE instructors. The class was  challenging but he was excellent at explaining topics and helping students. I would defiantly recommend taking this class if your willing to put the work in. It is not an easy A! Based on my peers comments about their profs. for this class, Finn is the best!!
He was one of the best professors that I have had at OSU. Class was interesting, and I enjoyed attending. His personal anecdotes were enjoyable.

Fantastic professor. Classes are engaging, and it's clear that he knows the source material very well. Used to work on Wall Street and has a litany of cool experiences to share in real field work. Fair grader without making the work necessarily easy. Favorite professor at OSU yet.

Sometimes Dustin seems like he would rather not be teaching but he knows his stuff and explains it well. He goes thru lectures really fast, so be sure to ask questions if you don't understand. Overall good lecturer though and a fair grader.

Dustin was super clear in class, and gave all the information needed to be successful in the projects and homework. If I needed help, he clearly communicated info about office hours, and those were really flexible as well. As long as you ask questions in lecture, and seek him for help if you don't understand something after class, 2221 should be ez

Only a lecturelab prof, does not create the examsprojects*  He may not be the most charismatic or happy prof, but he is a great prof to learn from.  His lectures are clear cut. He knows the material and how to teach it. You will learn when sitting in that classroom during the lecture.   I would recommend.
Good guy, I had a late class so he was lookin' to get out of there.
Pretty good teacher, is thorough with explanations. Very lenient. Willing to answer questions. Good teacher.
Govind tried his best to help you in any way he could

Govind was a good teacher in my opinion. A little hard to understand at first but becomes easier as time progresses. Helps with examples given on slides during class and gave examples that prepared students well for exams.
Good teacher, was prompt answering emails, very understanding, and always there to help. Answered any questions in class that students had, overall laid back teacher.
Genuinely cares for students
Good teacher with patient.

The structure of this class is different than most. All the notes and homework are already online and it's up to the student whether to do them. Attendance isn't mandatory but it is recommended. Govind was really nice and helpful and did everything in his power to help his students understand the topics.
Govind is the man. He won't spoon feed you, but he'll give you the help you need.

Prof Fuhry knows his stuff and is a nice guy, his lectures are just really boring. Start to lose focus after 20 minutes (1 hr 20 minute class) mostly because he focuses on minutia in examples. Exams can catch you off guards in regards to representation of material covered. Attendance isnt taken but theres an in class worksheet most days
He wants to help but his lectures are extremely boring, and it is hard to pay attention

Very boring lectures. He spends too much time on certain topics and not enough time working through examples of harder concepts. Tests are surprisingly long (and difficult because of it). Otherwise, he was a good teacher. Professional and knowledgeable. Projects can be a bit challenging, but you can do it with a partner which I recommend.

Nice guy, average teacher.  Make sure you get a good group because 1/2 the course grade is group stuff.  Attendance not mandatory but you get a lot of in-class assignments (that end up being HW because you don't get enough time in class).  You get a cheat sheet for the exams.  Really late giving back grades and I'm still missing grades on carmen.
He was pretty awkward, but would help me with my projects when I needed help. Didn't mind checking code and going through it with you to correct it

She might not the the best instructor, but one thing about her is that she truly cares about her students and tries her best to make sure everyone understands the lessons. She does require active learning in the class and she is very welcomed for your guys to help her become a better instructor.

Ingy is a wild card. She is very smart and knows her stuff, but she does not excel at spreading that knowledge to her students. Her lectures are a drag and usually leave you more lost than when you came in. As unclear as she is, she does make up for it with tests. Tests usually follow examples and hw questions and there is a nice curve at the end.
Avoid it at all cost! Even if you listened to her class clearly(I know it is hard), you can still do NOTHING in any of her homework or lab or exam... I would rather take a course taught by google.

I can't believe I'm actually writing one of these but I feel like other students should know this stuff  A decent speaker but leaves students horrifically under prepared for exams that constitute 55% of the grade in her classes. Avoid and take it with Close if possible. You'll be pretty in the dark about exam topics which makes studying difficult.

This was the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. Almost all subject matter was twisted into non-related analogies. Problems on homework assignments, quizzes, and midterms were never touched upon in class. The same went for the lab assignments(Good Luck). If it were not for her quizzes (open book) I would have not gone.
She is hands down the worst teacher I've ever had at Ohio State. I know 4 (relatively smart) students completely fail and have to retake the course. Avoid at all costs.

Worst experience at OSU. Doesn't answer email, never grades assignments, and gives no help if you email (if she even emails you back). She's lazy, confusing when she teaches with long-winded analogies, and she NEVER responds to emails. She frequently cancels office hours and her graders (the poor souls) have to deal with the wrath of the students.
No syllabus, she made up the class as she went along I'm pretty sure. Ended up with a midterm and homeowrk on the same day. She is pretty forgiving on the tests though.

AVOID at all costs, entire class was either absent, playing games on their phone/computer, or doing work from other classes during every lecture. She spends a lot of time formulating really bad analogies for simple concepts that could be explained plainly.
He has good passion for teaching and tries to explain everything using board and markers rather than using presentation slides.
He was strange

I did great in Software II, which is supposed to be the weed out class for CSE at OSU. This class was 20 times harder for me. I spent at least 10 hours on every lab, and for one I spent over 30 hours. Went to every class, did every lab, asked questions all the time and I still struggled a lot.

Stephanie Preston was an okay teacher. She reads directly from the slides the whole lecture, which make lectures kind of pointless because the slides are posted online. One lab is due almost every week and they can range from 5 hours to 10 hours of work and the instructions can be vague at time, but manageable if you put the time in.

I love this class - ya its hard, but she stays for hours after class to help if you need it. It also helps that she actually knows this stuff since she works in the field. And security day was awesome its worth taking the class just for that

i just bombed the first midterm but to be fair all the questons i missed WERE right in the slides.  its hard but if you relaly study youd do fine. she explained everything logically when i asked about it
CSE2421 supposed to be hard, but she make it harder. Need  learn by yourself.

Class, labs and exams were pretty hard, but more or less the same as any other engineering. if you stay and talk to her after class, she is REALLY helpful, but she usually tries to get you to figure things out on your own.  I did learn a lot in the class- it was worth it
Tough exam, boring lectures, time consuming labs. she thinks she knows everything & is helpful. Unfortunately, she is not. PLEASE take system 1 with other instructors.

She is one of the harder professors for this class.  Expect to do a lab almost every week that sometimes may take more than 10 hours to complete.  Also, you're basically on your own because collaboration is not allowed, she doesn't hold office hours, and she isn't helpful in email responses.  The class is doable, but it's certainly  not enjoyable.

harder than the other cse 2421s. preston seems to know a lot, &is helpful, so you learn a lot. labs are ok. exams are hard. class is interesting. attendence is optional but a good idea to go, otherwise course is hard

Youssef was a decent lecturer and tried to answer questions in class, but she buries you in material. She's awful at grading and returning assignments, labs, and exams. Before the first exam absolutely no grades had been uploaded online. This made prep extremely difficult, considering the high volumes of material covered, with literally 0 exam prep
Just attend the class, pay attention and pass with flying colors.
Pretty helpful if you have any questions with the labs or prelabs. He was frequently late to the actual labs however, But pretty easy class overall.
Pretty helpful with labs
-Frequently was late -Often sat at desk and was not up and around the class like the lab graders were -Labs were generally easy and clear to understand -Easy class
Once he helped you, it was a little better. He was a little hard to understand sometimes. Not always punctual or on the ball, but he knew what he was doing.
Nice guy. Willing to help if needed
Decent TA. He sometimes runs late and can be hard to understand. The class is really hard in my opinion but he does try his best to help you.
Sam was overall pretty good and most of what I could have asked for in a CSE 2111 TA.
He gives you everything you need to be successful, however some of the directions are a little confusing but clarify-able through some intuition.

Great TA, very willing to help on any questions asked. Really nice guy, and if you have any problems at all you do not need to be afraid to ask. CSE is a challenging class for some but he helps you through the labs.
he gives you all the help you need if you ask but he is somewhat hard to understand
He was great and extremely helpful throughout the semester.

Very nice guy. Had him as a TA for lab in CSE. Some of the labs are a bit more difficult and he always assisted and helped you through the problems. He always wanted to answer all questions to his full extent. Overall, an efficient and nice guy.
He's great! Very helpful in labs.
Willing to help in lab when questions came up
Great teacher, would recommend him highly.
Sam was very helpful but late and unprepared almost every week. Very understanding about lab grades and all labs were graded extremely easy. Pay attention and you will do fine in the labs
Great Teacher!
Understands students very well and is the true team player
He is very helpful in the labs and will show you what you do not know how to do.

He is very helpful during labs. Makes grading very clear and is on top of updating grades. He wants people to do as well as possible so he will look to give people points wherever possible. He gave everyone full credit for the last in lab.
As long as you do the pre labs tou are going to do well!
Really Good
Very good instructor always offered help to those you needed it
YES I LOVE THIS MAN HE IS THE BEST GOD BLESS HIM. Really though great TA, helped me survive cse
He will often times give you the benefit of the doubt on your lab grades. This is very beneficial to students especially at end of the semester.
Helpful
It was a good time, he always showed up exactly when the class started, but other than that, he was reasonable and the class was pretty easy.
Cool teacher, willing to help a lot during lab, gave everyone a perfect score on the final lab because it had nothing to do with our final

A prince, a really nice guy that cares about his students. Always ready to help and does his best to make sure you understand. He is the kind of teacher that remembers what undergrad was like. You would be lucky to have him.
Tough course but if you do the work its okay
Gave us full credit on last lab.
I had him for the CSE 2111 lab at 8am. He overall was a good TA but was late several times He didn't make the lab harder and was understanding when students didn't know what to do.
Loved the entire semester. Very helping :)

Good teacher. Foundations was a tough class for me but the second one with him wasn't too bad. The midterms weren't bad and were graded leniently. Not an outstanding teacher, but not a bad teacher either. I'd say he is a safe professor to take. He does have an accent and is soft spoken, so sit up front.

Lectures can be a bit confusing at first.  Really bright guy who tries to make sure you know the material, that being said the homework is doable and will be very similar to the tests.  Exams ensure you know the basic concepts and if so you'll do fairly well.  Overall, I'd take another class with this professor.

I don't know about what others have said about an easy A. but if you do the homework and just study that for the exams you will be fine. You don't really need to go to class because his handwriting is atrocious and he rambles, so just do the homework and teach yourself from the book while doing it.

His class is a joke.  He'll assign some hw due the day after exams; and he'll pull half of the exam directly from these hw.  Further more the homework is not hard and nor is the exam.  He's a little hard to understand because of his accent and writing, but if all you want is an easy A he's probably the guy to take for Foundations II.
Was a nice guy with a thick accent.  Class is much easier than Foundations I
Avoid at all costs. His accent is hard to understand, his chickenscratch is hard to read. No slides given, he just writes on the board. No practice problems or practice midterms.

Go into this class with your eyes open.  Dr. Rademacher is not an easy instructor, and gives difficult assignments.  He is often hard to understand, but willing to help if you talk to him.  You will learn an enormous amount from this class if he is your instructor.  Grading is fairly liberal.

The hardest teacher I've had. He teaches as though we are all as smart as him. He's also hard to understand. His exams are given in a different time period at night, and are pretty rough. However, I noticed he does grade pretty easily.

Do not take 680 with this professor.  He has a doctorate from MIT in mathematics and assumes the entire class does as well.  Grades on a bell curve and gives overly-lengthy midterm exams during the dinner hour.
He is always scattered and rambling. It is hard to understand him and even harder to read his writing. The homeworks are near impossible considering the book is no more helpful than he is.

Overall he is a great professor. He has reasonable expectations for homework and exams. He is good at explaining the topics covered and frequently checks to make sure the students understand what is being talked about. Also, he can be pretty funny sometimes. I enjoyed going to the class.

His classes are really really good. He puts across the material in an effective way and if you attend his classes regularly, you will not need to go through any textbooks. He has a solid understanding of the concepts and comes up with examples on the fly. Also, very helpful if we have any doubts. Very cool class.
Made concepts really clear..

BOOORING! The first few classes, I was fairly interested but then just got lost in her talking nonstop from start to finish. Nobody asks questions because it's physically impossible to pay attention to her. If you have to take, be prepared to just show up and copy powerpoints because you will fall asleep if you try to listen to her lecture
Good professor, need some interaction with the students!

She needs a chill button. She talks in class from start to finish. She is so busy she barely has time aside from he set office hours to meet with students. She is a good teacher but expect a lot. Exams are hard and Tricky. Homework is good practice . Needs to spend less time cramming info into students and more time interacting and making sure ...
Great Professor. Exams are tough. Make sure you go through the homeworks before midterms and final. Gives plenty of homeworks and is also very helpful during office hours.

When the bell rings, she talks and doesn't stop till class is over.  She gives many examples in class.  Homeworks are from book and can be hard.  One midterm and was pretty hard.  Final was hard.  Averages on homework are low.  She is a great teacher, but expects a lot from her students.

The Class was difficult, however the teaching was great. I understood most of the concepts through the examples done in class and if anything was left to question, a simple trip to her office solved the problem. One of the better CSE profs in the Department. I would take another class from Yusu.

This class isn't easy, but it's manageable and actually somewhat enjoyable with Dr. Wang.  She provided TONS of examples in class, and her weekly homeworks, the midterm, and the final weren't terribly difficult.  The book isn't very helpful, so it's best to just attend class.

Very helpful and clear teacher of a pretty difficult class. The homeworks were reasonable and so were the tests. She gave as many examples as possible and was extremely helpful in office hours. Take her if you can. Much better than Supowit in my opinion.

The problems in class were explained very well in the slides and on the chalkboard.  Some words are pronounced with slightly unusual (to me) syllabic stress, so you should read the book to know what the professor is speaking about before going to class.

Paul is one of those educators you wish you had for every course. He takes some really complex content and makes it extremely easy to navigate through. His involvement in the Student Financial Planning Association is just one indication of how much he cares about his students succeeding in real life not just in college.

Paul is a great teacher, if you go to his class you will learn the material;  he wants you to do well and everything on the Exams and quizzes is covered in class. He has seen personal success as a financial planner (owns his own financial planning practice in Columbus) and will do his best to help you achieve your goals as well. Highly recommended.

I dunno what others are talking about. Programming is not an easy job. The slides were crappy which she inherited from the course coordinator. She mentioned that and wrote individual program for us. Very helpful during the lab.

She's really confusing to understand. Gets mad when people ask questions. Set up of 1222 is generally bad but its definitely passable. Syllabus said there would be no curve but obviously there was one.

Doesn't answer my emails, doesn't seem to know material that well, relies on the pre-made PowerPoints and student input too much.  It's a good thing there are people in class who already know some C++, because they often have to correct her. Not the worst I've ever had, but definitely not the best. (P.S do the zybooks - way more helpful than class)

Dunno what these other raters are talking about. If she doesn't think we get it, she'll go through an example 2-3 more times. Programming can be pretty unforgiving, especially if you're learning C++ as your first language, but it's not her fault that programming requires practice. She's nice, and completely approachable about problems.
You get the sense she doesn't really know what she is teaching the class. Among other CSE1222 teachers shes not the best but I guess shes not the worst. Just kinda in the middle.

The exams were unnecessarily difficult. She gets visibly irritated when someone asks a question. was barely knowledgeable of the material. You get the sense that she does not care about your grade, or anything about you. Definitely avoid this "teacher"
Loved her.
Never seen such a bad instructer before. If you either want to get a high GPA or learn something, she is the worst choice because she skip the key point perfectly.
bad professor

This is definitely the worst professor that I have ever met in my whole life! I can swear  to the God. She seldom prepares for the class and always misses important part of lectures which will be covered in midterms. When students ask her question after class, she is extremely inpatient!  She is not responsible for her job and students at all! !

Beth is one of the worst professors I have had. She has a condescending tone and gives flippant responses to many questions. She often will not even answer the question at all, but go off about something else entirely. She is the type of teacher to halt the whole class when two people are trying to figure out the work in class.

Worst professor. Knows nothing about teaching. Knows nothing about the class material. Attending Class  as important as peanut butter. Don't know how she got her position at Ohio State. Avoid at all costs.

She mad the class way to difficult for no reason.  Point system is so messed up.  Exams are 650 points of the class but you do 11 labs that are worth 155 points total.  Labs take hours to do.  Takes forever to grade stuff.  Generally has no idea what she is talking about.  Avoid at all costs
A great Professor

Domas is a great professor. He prepares all the lecture slides and labs himself and takes feedback from his previous classes into account to ensure a smooth learning experience for his students. Go to class, pay attention to his lecture, and apply what you've learned in midterms and lab projects and you'll ace it.

Domas is a great teacher. He is an adjunct from Battelle where he specializes in low-level computer organization & programming, so he knows his stuff. I don't see where the other reviews are coming from regarding his toughness; the exams and labs were maybe on the longer side, but only slightly. He is also completely fair in terms of grading.

Great lecturer that is genuinely interested in the content he is teaching. Extremely knowledgeable and understands the potential of his students. Responds clearly to students' questions on the discussions. His class taught me a lot and was very engaging. Tests cover only the things he's taught so put some effort into learning it and you'll get an A

Domas is a great lecturer. He knows his stuff very well and makes points clear. Extremely helpful when you ask him questions and he goes out of his way to help you. He has an extremely good knowledge of what he's teaching and makes sure everything you learn is applicable to real life. His material is stuff but worth it in the long run.

Chris is a champ! He's the best professor I've had thus far. He really goes out of his way to get a point across. His lectures are super interesting and the assignments will challenge you to think in all the right ways. By no means an easy class, especially compared to other lecturers, but SO worth the effort. You will learn so much in this class!

One of the best cse instructors I have had. Goes out of his way to show why the material is relevant and practical. Tries to get students excited about it. Lectures are clear and helpful. Is there to answer questions and give help as needed. 1010
Best professor I've had at OSU; however his class is definitely more difficult than other sections of systems 1. Would definitely recommend taking it with him though.

I can't even count the number of times I've talked this guy up. He is by far the best professor I've ever had. It's easy to see how much he loves teaching this class, and there is no fluff material. Most everything you learn, you will use. The labs are quite fun, yet very challenging, and his extra credits will push your limits (In a good way).

class is really hard, labs were really long ,but hands down the best professor i've ever had.  really engaged in teaching, made the course and material ridiculously interesting. would take this class 1000x over

Amazing lecturer. She really loves the subject. It's kinda dry at times, so attendance can be low at times. But she works hard in lecture. Provides a lot of useful in class examples, so pay attention. Workload isn't bad. Some labs are tricky, but fun if you like networking. Useful subject. Really intelligent professor. Easy grader too. Easy Exams.

Horrible professor. Flat-out refuses to help on labs and exams after handing out grades. Refuses to post solution keys, assuming that her material (horribly worded, drawn-out, incomplete, and not concise) is taken in 100 percent during the classes. Even going to class and trying to pay attention leaves you confused for the most part.

Professor Peng is really good at making you understand linguistics but the class is really dry. I do not recommend you take this class just for the credit, you must really  be interested in Linguistic Anthropology to enjoy this class.  Homeworks are fairly easy. But again the class is super boring and uninteresting.

Horrible professor. Was extremely confusing during lectures and often sped through important parts and drew out the lecture during simple parts. Does not understand basic questions that you ask her. Does not prepare you for the labs past simple methods, and does not help you at all during office hours. Avoid at all costs.

Dr. Ritter is an incredible professor with an even more incredible background. Genuinely interest in teaching and making sure his students succeed, he is willing to spend as much time as needed after and outside of class.  Unparalleled style n' steaze on top of it all.

Dr. Ritter is an awesome professor. This class was very interesting and you learn a large array of machine learning techniques.  The course project at the end of the semester is a great chance to put everything together and was single-handedly responsible for getting me an amazing internship.  Absolutely take Alan's course if you have the chance!
Sometimes he goes too fast in the class. Lots of coding HW

Mark is a good professor and loves what he does. He is a little quirky and laughs at himself a lot. He is knowledgable on computers and the material. The class isn't easy, the task based stuff (having to use word, excel, and powerpoint) is easy, but then you have to know the parts and history of computers so be sure to read the text book!

Debbie was the course coordinator but we had a guy (Bob?) as our lecturer. The course now is called CSE 1211 I think. Debbie was fair and listened to us complain about the lecturer - he was just plain awful. She gave as many tips as possible but this is definitely a more self-motivated class. DO THE LABS AND HOMEWORK EARLY! This class is worth it!
I felt as though she did a great job covering the course material. I had heard terrible things coming into the class, but she turned out to be approachable and helpful.

Gross may be a little intimidating, but she is actually a decent person and does do a great job of explaining the material. This class is not all that it is cracked up to be. Go to class, don't procrastinate on your pre-labs, and do a little studying. If you stay ahead of the game and put in a little extra work, the class is actually easy.
She was very clear with her notes and lectures, they actually kept me interested in a fairly dull subject.  I would recommend taking her.

Tough class, got a B+.  Take the prof that guarentees 20% get A's.  I'm fairly confident Gross doesn't do that.  She is the course cordinator and I have heard from upperclassmen gross gives the lowest grades...  If you want to learn alot take her though, she is actually very good teaching wise.

This class is hard, but not impossible. It is a serious time commitment. I spent a minimum of 5 hours outside of class a week, but if you put in the time and effort, you can succeed. Debbie is hard, but she is also the course coordinator so she writes the exams. Thus, she can prepare you really well! I would recommend her over other CSE professors.

Hardest class I've had at OSU so far. And it's not cause she is a great teacher and trying to make you think. She explains everything in a confusing fast way. The text and all the quizzes and exams labs and pre labs are worded terribly. Spent way to long on pre labs even though grading is all in the exams and quizzes basically.

Very difficult teacher. Her grading is very inconsistent and largely unfair. Practice problems are wildly different than quiz/exam questions. Be prepared to work your butt off for this class. Goes through material very quickly and not thoroughly & lectures are boring.

She is the hardest teacher I have ever had. I spent on average 7-8 hours a week trying to learn and complete the material.  Every question on the test and quizzes is worded terrribly which is meant to trick and confuse you.  Every little mistake such as a comma error or a wrong parenthesis will result in almost all the points marked wrong. HARD!!!!

She is helpful over email, but it is hard to understand what she says during lecture because the class is so big. You have to buy an online textbook and course notes, about $125 all together. She provides practice problems and sample midterms/finals. This class will occupy a lot of your time but it's not too difficult.

This class sucks and is aweful. Makes it hard to understand and moves so fast that it is hard to keep up with everything. Pre labs suck and the labs are time consuming that are worded weird where something simple seems difficult. Everyone I talk to hates this class.

Topics taught in this class aren't designed to be hard, the way it's taught and assessed makes it hard. Quizzes and Exams are long and tough, and little mistakes will knock you down to a B before you know it. PreLabs take 3 to 4 hours on average just to complete, and you barely finish labs in class with the amount of work and thinking required.
Terrible instructor. Period. Do not take her class. She is very annoying and very mean if you get to know her.

Don't know why so many guys hype her as a tough prof. She's definitely better than terrible Michelle, who always creates nervous atmosphere during lec&quiz. Debby is a tiny old lady with a huge sense of humor. Hilarious in class, normal questions in quizzes. Never wanna fail you with tricky questions. Just lots of people are intimidated by her cour

she is much harder than the other teachers by far. Friends took other teachers and theirs was a joke by comparison. the only advantage you get by taking her is that she makes the final so everyone else fails and you do ok. If you can, take someone else. If you dont, get ready for worst experience of your life, you do learn a lot though.

Ramasamy is an unfair grader. He doesn't realize how much work is done by the team members. He purely relies on the feedback given by your team mates and the sponsor. You can easily get a A- or an A if you beat around the bush but you are good at showing off and pretending that you work a lot.
He's pretty awesome. I maybe behind on the amount of work for this class but he is doing a great job in my eyes.

He is very good, maybe a little work on the interaction in classes, but overall he is really good. If you're going to take Introduction to Artificial Intelligence/CSE 3521 then take it with Eckroth. He is a very good teacher and knows his stuff. You learn a wide range of applicable real world topics such as K-means clustering, naive bayes, K-NN, document vectors, etc. It can be demanding at times but Josh is the best teacher to have for AI.

Awesome class. The course website is used as main resource for everything, lectures, homework, study guides, all free and open. Eckroth is not afraid to code in front of the class, really learned a lot from him. He's a chill guy, karmically righteous. Obviously remembers what its like to be an undergrad. Highly recommended.

He went out of his way to make the class interesting. Basically was like "Anything about AI you want to learn about?". We did face recognition and it was interesting. His HW takes some thinking and exams are normal difficult. Decent amount of extra credit. If he is teaching it is worth taking the class with him.

Josh is absolutely the best professor that I have had in my two years of undergrad education - and I've had some really good ones. He actually helped me with some code for a work study/undergrad research project AFTER I had taken his class. Incredibly devoted. He uses the book very little because his site is a much better resource.
Really smart guy, good teacher, good sense of humor.  Take him if you can.
Truly a great teacher; very willing to help you figure something out. Also, he has a sense of humor, a fact which cannot be over-appreciated!
Great class. He answered questions over gmail chat which is accessible on his website. Extremely convenient and useful when in need of help.

He was really helpful and very enthusiastic about what he was teaching. He made it really easy to learn. He also told us about a lot of interesting material not really related to the class but it was really cool to hear. Not the hardest class but he definitely made it a breeze.

Josh was a great teacher. He was very enthusiastic about the material (which is always refreshing) and it was obvious he really cared about helping us learn. He was very available to help, even online.
Josh epitomizes the kind of  teacher you can dream of. I cannot overstate how much he contributed to my success in this class.
Great overall teacher and a good choice for intro to programming.

Great teacher. He really loves the subject. Clear, good at explaining things. Assignments and Labs were really easy. Would take again.

Great teacher ever!!!!!!
Great professor, very helpful and interested in helping. Midterms and final were very easy.

Great guy and knows his stuff, he'll go out of his way to help you succeed too. Whether or not you're into programming I think he helps keep it interesting. Keep up with the assignments and talk to him about Lisp if you want your mind blown. Highly recommended

Great Teacher! I enjoyed going to lectures and it was quite obvious that he genuinly cared how his students did in the class. He is very willing to help in office hours as well! Could not ask for a better CSE teacher :)

Josh has mastered the skill-set of effectively teaching others.

Josh Eckroth is an awesome teacher.  He's young and knows how to keep class interesting.  I actually enjoyed going to his lectures.  I turned in 2 assignments late and he waved the late grade.  It was awesome.  Best teacher I've had so far at Ohio State!
Great teacher. Challenging but very fair assignments. Would and will take again

GREAT professor. This class is easy because he makes it easy. He teaches you what you need to know, and tells you how to do it. Amazingly helpful. If you seek help he'll make sure you understand the material/concept before leaving. Best instructor at Ohio State.
Josh was very helpful and genuinely interested in helping his students.
Josh was great. When I needed help, he was more than willing to work with me. Great teacher, very fair. Would love to have him again :)
Genuinely interested in teaching and extremely helpful when you ask.  Really nice guy.  You should do really well if you go to class.

Josh Eckroth is extremely passionate about his field, artificial intelligence, giving him insights into psychology and learning that combine to make him a superb instructor. His ability to present abstract ideas visually in several different forms caters to most any learning style.

It's the coord who writes them but yeah :

Rambles a bit while not just reading slides.  Very boring.  Not sure he fully understands his own topic...

His slides are exactly from the textbook. He just reads the slides in class. Be sure to read the textbook when taking his class. His midterm and final are dependent on you reading the textbook. Not a very good teacher as he just reads the slides in class, but he is easy and his labs are easy. Also gives a lot of extra credit.

Definitely the easiest professor to take CSE 581 with. The labs are very easy and he even provided "sample" code which meant that he made them even easier. He overall was a great teacher... his midterm and final exams were generally easy if you understood basic programing, he didn't make us stay in labs, and gave me a homework extension when I needed it. He tries to be funny and it's at least entertaining!
Good professor, class was hard as hell but very fun.
easy A-, must work hard and follow every requirement to get A
good class, hard labs, easy tests

Great prof! u'll get used to his accent in like 2 lectures. Very clear & helpful! hw's r a bit hard, but he helps u out a lot if u ask. MT was easy, final was kinda hard, but he takes either 25%MT, 30%final or 15%MT, 40%final..depending on which gets u a higher grade! overall, very good professor!
Great Instructor.
This class is very difficult and moves at a fast pace. However, it is manageable because she is very helpful and answers questions at anytime during and outside of lecture.

She's super helpful during lecture and is willing to stop and take questions at any time. She's also very approachable and helpful in office hours. The lab takes forever. Al is super helpful and super not helpful at the same time. Always call, dont email because he half reads and won't answer question. Pray for an easy/smart grader. He usually just asked if anyone had questions, then we left.  I would avoid taking 560 with him, unless you're prepared to meet with him frequently with questions.

Al is a great professor who is always willing to help. Gives his cell phone # during the first class so you can call if you need help. The class is a lot of work but that is just 560. Take 560 with Al if you can!

He's a nice Prof. But I think he can definitely improve on his course content and also his approach on how the course is conducted. I thought that we could have learnt much more about networks like NAT and so on a little more deeper than what was covered.

If you choose to take networking, at OSU, Sinha is the must have professor. Do not pick anyone else. The lab assignments are super easy (DO NOT do them last minute) and are written in python. I think that Sinha did as well as he could to teach it so it wasn't very boring, so lectures were usually very clear and straightforward. The textbook is useful.

The material is very dry, but that is the topic not the teacher. Offers two non-cumulative midterms in lieu of a final. Good lecturer, but gives poor lab documents. Ask if there is something you aren't sure about. Exams are kind of tough, but fair. Going to lectures is important, he gives good examples that the book doesn't. Found book online

He's a great lecturer when he writes things out on the board and draws pictures. He gives a space for feedback on the exams and takes it to heart to improve his class. Difficult material and difficult exams, but there's a decent curve involved.
Exams follow what he says in class, not necessarily what the slides say. Read the book. Difficult class in general, but there was a fairly generous curve. Lectures are boring.
Horrible lectures that have nothing to do with HW/Labs/Exams, other than the abstract, base content.

One of the most God-awful teachers I have ever had. The material he teaches in class has next to nothing to do with the homework, labs, or exams. He grades everything ridiculously hard. He makes his students buy a non-graphing calculator for the purpose of taking two tests. Finally, he gets the equations wrong. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
Gives pretty hard tests, doable homework assignments. Only four hws a quarter and two tests. Really not a bad class and he's a pretty good teacher. Curved the grades a lot at the end.

His class is fairly easy, exams can be a little tricky and the homeworks may take awhile but if you learn the material you should be fine. Try and do well on the homeworks they can make up for your low exam scores.
What a jerk! He told me to get out of his office, he was busy!

Gave a very thorough explanation of a deep topic.  The homeworks took some effort, but they were all quite doable (even at the last minute, when I typically did them).  If you're somewhat intelligent, go to at least 2/3 of the lectures, make an effort on the homeworks, and review notes before the tests, you should do fine (that's what I did).

Ok, the thing is, if u take this class with Dong, ure gonna do waaaay less work.  Homeworks are usless busy work and this guy teaches you everything there is to know, but the prob with that is, the main idea never gets across.  I got an A, because the tests are not hard, but the hws take you literally 9 or 10 hours and are useless busy work.
This class has alot of information. He does a pretty good job at explaining most of it. Homeworks can be a little tricky sometimes, but his tests are not too bad.

OVERLOAD! Watch out!... Probably half of the class dropped out. Sooooo much work, you wont even know where to begin... do not take more than couple other classes while taking his class, otherwise you wont have time to do anything. He really is helpful tho

very hard, fast passed course. his first time teaching, so the assignments were well above the completion possibility. Very helpful, not many professors will tell you to send them you 1000 lines of code for them to try to figure out what's wrong with it.
heavy accent but a god amongst coding. very friendly and forgiving

He knows the material and is able to explain it clearly (though really the material isn't that tough to begin with) the only issue is that he has a pretty heavy indian accent that can make him hard to understand at times. His grading is very fair and the class is quite easy to pass with high marks.
Pretty great teacher, amazing class
Gopi is a programming GOD among men. He should be worshipped, not listened to. He may not English, but his willpower and heart overcome all language obstacles. Gopi is love, Gopi is life
very good professor teachers you a lot but the course was set up for you to fail and work hard to get a decent grade.

Great instructor! Presents information in a clear fashion. Explains the material in different ways to ensure that students understand various concepts. Goes out of his way to help students who are struggling in the class. Hands down, the most important class I have ever taken outside of my major (applied math).

I like his teaching style because he starts from scratch, so you have  chance to follow him from beginning  to understand even he stops and ask students if they have questions. attending his class is very worthy also he is available through email and office hours just don't hesitate to ask him questions he knows material very well. HW should labs

He is EXTREMELY willing to help students and is an easy grader.  He would probably give everyone an 'A' if it was up to him.  He communicates well and takes extra time where more attention is do.  He does in-class examples, asking for input to help get students thinking to help solidify the material.  He Loves what he does and has fun with it.

Jason is a wonderful teacher in CSE department. He knows the stuff very well. He has a decent experience with C and assembly. There are many extra credits opportunities(although EC problems are very hard). Most labs are ok to handle except for the last one. Exams covers what was taught in class. Overall a nice professor.

She was very knowledgeable about the content and was always willing to help. Lectures weren't the most exciting things in the world but bonus points were awarded for attendance. Course wasn't difficult as long as you pay attention. SHe is very strict on following the course guidelines.

She is just the lecturer, not the main professor. The content including the slides aren't hers. She covers the material well enough, and throws in  tips for the quizzes and exams. Her lectures are pretty dry but so is the class itself.   The course is mostly self-taught. Always around afterwards to answer questions and is very pleasant to talk to.

The class itself is really easy but she is terrible as a professor. She is very dry while speaking and moves very quickly. For someone who has trouble with the material I feel like they would not be successful in the class.

Dauntrica is very clear about explaining quite a dry subject. She always knows what she is doing and lays a good foundation upon which you can build. I say this because the content is very repetition and problem oriented, like math. You must do problems. Or you will flounder. Don't buy the access textbook. Buy myitlab.

Dauntrica seems to really care about her students and their understanding in the class. She is super approachable and happy to help if you ask for it. Pay attention in lecture and do the pre-labs, and you'll be fine. Lowest quiz gets dropped.

While she isn't the main professor for CSE 2111, she is knowledgable about the subject. The power points usually aren't hers and contain some errors, but the class definitely are attainable. If you do all the pre labs and focus during class, an A is easily attainable. Only basic knowledge of excel is necessary for this class.
TERRIBLE PROFESSOR. VERY BAD AT EXPLAINING
Having slides that are unclear without the lecture itself. Must attend to understand where the material goes. Lecture is more like a discussion.

I think he is a good Prof! And cracks some decent jokes, too :) However, I believe the course does not cover as much as I would've wanted to from a Grad level OS course. It has some extremely dry topics (we mostly know em already) in between which in my opinion could be swapped for newer architectures like Distributed Cloud Computing and so on.
I enjoyed the class a lot. Not the conventional lectures, but well organized and interesting discussions in class. The exam is relevant and to the point.
You'd better know the stuff before you come to the class. Otherwise, you can easily get screwed if you don't study very hard and on your own!

I used to like Operating systems. He made me hate the subject and he is the meanest professor I have seen. He shouted at me for no apparent reason. He hates answering question and if he feels its not a good enough question he insults you.
He barely knows what is on his powerpoint slides.  If you ask questions about some of the claims on his slides he is never sure if they are correct or how to prove them.  Tests are unexpectedly hard.
Great Class
Don't know his stuff very well.
No Comments
No Comments

Not bad for a CSE TA. He spoke a bit too quickly during lecture but he genuinely tried to help students. His programming assignments and labs aren't terrible if you put in a little effort. He also turned the last lab of the quarter into extra credit.
Very knowledgeable professor and good teacher
Great professor . Came across as very smart . Quite friendly .

Unless you are genuinely extremely interested in parallel computing, I would NOT recommend taking this class. It is incredibly difficult, and the content is very esoteric and boring. Professor Sad is a good lecturer, but can be dry at times, and makes a large amount of mistakes in his notes and homeworks
Very articulate during lectures and comes across as really smart . Also very helpful and the course work was exceptional .

Brilliant professor. Go to class with an open mind (basically, no text book) and listen to every word he says and you'll enjoy it thoroughly. The classes are problem-solving intensive and may get heavy, but I find that to be a really great way to ingrain concepts in your brain. Also, you won't see a prof utilize board space as effectively as Saday.

Good and helpful teacher. Very Very hard questions so that he can choose his GRA, so affects grades if people who just want to learn the subject. But if dont care for grades a must course for everyone. 1 of the few good courses.

Completely disorganized teacher. Don't even bother doing the homework until he has had a chance to correct it. He will skip class completely without warning. Exams are brutal and coding and analysis based. Don't bother memorizing anything. Final had an average of ~50%.
Good Teaching and very helpful.

Knows his stuff from experience, but admits when he doesn't know about something.  Very research oriented prof., so go into class recognizing that it isn't his top priority.  Expects a lot of work for this level of course.  Put in the effort, and you'll learn a lot.
No Comments
Had a little difficulty with this class. It seemed more geared toward graduate students.
alex is extremely curti-ous.  me and my classmate mike camaglia got extra tutoring at no charge. very helpful tight cig bro
Funny and sarcastic but very helpful when you need him.  Doesn't hurt that he's really good looking.

He's a brilliant guy, very well-spoken, and an excellent teacher. Make sure you ask questions if you don't understand something: unlike most CSE professors, he hasn't suffered permanent damage to the Broca's area of his brain, and is an excellent communicator. He does NOT use the book, so make sure you attend class (somewhat) regularly.
Significantly easier than the other CSE 200 professors. His tests are much easier. Explains things pretty clearly for the most part. Kinda boring in class though.
Best teacher ever.  Very laid back, knows material very well, very clear an consise in information, always responded to questions wicked fast!
best youre gonna get in cse from what i hear. hes a big nerd but its cute haha. not the easiest.=.
Class was easy.  He was OK but didn't always answer questions on Carmen fast enough.  Kinda boring.  Showing up to class wasn't really necessary.

Richard is a great teacher and a very nice guy. He always answers e-mails and works very hard to make you understand what is going on. He also shows a lot of empathy towards students and is very laid back when it comes to extra credit. His tests are very fair. They are not too easy, but not too hard. He also prepares you well for them. Great guy!

By far the best teacher i have EVER had.  He was awesome in lecture, and I have never learned so much in labs because of his explanations and knowledge of the subject.  You much schedule a class with this teacher AT ALL COSTS.. Very laid back, A+ -mikez
My first CIS instructor, and still among the best i have seen at OSU. Friendly, helpful, good at explaining topics both in lecture and in office hours. Definately recommended.
Makes the subject matter very easy.  Extremely laid back.  Highly recommended.
ok

Na Li is very knowledgable on the subject but is very soft spoken and she has a strong accent.  It didn't bother me, but there were a lot of students in the class who had trouble hearing or understanding what she was saying.  She offers great help if you ask for it though.

In terms of teaching Weide is great. He is very good at explaining things and making them easy to understand. Unfortunately the course material sucks. In my opinion, and the opinion of many others, RESOLVE is a useless framework. I am sick of working with programmers at OSU who know nothing but bad coding habits that they learned from RESOLVE.
Abstract and general. Depends on whether you need to detailed explaination.

Best professor I have had so far at OSU. Explained concepts extremely clearly and helped me understand the value of RESOLVE. I left every day of class feeling that I had learned something new. Honors version avoids annoying activities and if you deserve an A you will get it. I personally really liked this class.

Weide is awesome.  His language not only enforces a programming discipline that prevents long term problems such as hard to find bugs / memory leaks, but his commenting structure allows for a team of programmers to communicate with no ambiguity.  I would rather work with a programmer who follows this format than a half-ass "super" hacker any day.
he's the one who creates Resolve C++, and applied it to teaching for 3 Quarters. no good!!!, useless programming courses i have ever done. don't waste ur time!!!
Pretty good professor, overall seems interested in teaching. More than will to help during office hours and class.

I doubt these students claiming RESOLVE has no benefit have done much real programming, or even taken CSE 560. I'm in both 222 and 560 right now, and our group found RESOLVE to be very worthwhile. As for professor Weide, the work he has done in the field of SCE is very good, yet he still truly cares about teaching. One of my best teachers at OSU.

I would have to say that in two classes and 8 credit hours I learned next to nothing. The SCE sequence of classes are taught using RESOLVE, which is probably one of the most forced languages I have ever encountered. When asked about some aspects of the language, Bruce(one of its founders) had a hard time demonstrating any real world practicality.
Super nice guy, very helpful if you seek him out, though think he needs to provide more real world examples of stupid things that happen to justify what coding practices are taught.

decent teacher, but responsible for the idiotic "language" RESOLVE/C++ which is basically C++ with extra, unneccessary typing with little real benefit.  I am going to be thrilled to be out of the initial CSE 221-222-321 sequence after winter quarter so that I can learn in a language I will use...
useless
Excellent teacher in terms of explaining and teaching, a little too attatched to the theoretical superiority of his RESOLVE baby to recognize/discuss practical limitations.

Seemed to know just enough information to teach. Always creeping over shoulders during projects but never helping. Negative comments made about her after course completed by both grader and a professor in charge of the SCE series.

She is very arrogant and seems uninterested in genuinely helping students learn, although she would "help" when you asked (or sometimes just give you the answer without explaining it).  Didn't seem to understand material well enough to teach it.

Aditi was a decent teacher. She was fine at teaching the material that needed to be covered, but a lot of times it just felt like she went through the motions. She didn't seem particularly interested in the class, but she provided help whenever I needed it.
Helpful, but she's definitely wary of students who aren't trying. She really gets annoyed if you're being stupid. She's tough but her class isn't. You just have to work hard and you'll be fine.

Um this is one of the worst teachers i have ever had, please do not take her class, she is a terrible teacher that doesn't care at all about her class. She isn't a teacher, just a researcher... and i dont know why this other person rated her as "great" everyone I've talked to has thought this teacher can't teach aswell.

The material is HARD but Michael does a fairly good job at explaining it- as well as anyone can really "teach" Excel/Access in lecture format. Seemed to care about his students, gave a very generous curve.

I was directly admitted to FCB due to my high GPA and this class crushed it. He cannot teach/extremely confusing. Many times students had to correct his teaching. Over half his class received "E's" on the midterm. With a HUGE grading curve, those that did well in this class were mostly already proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access.
Very hard to understand. Tests and labs are no where close to the material he covers in class.

He's very clear, and tries to help you as long as you asks questions. He gives you chances to work on things in groups during class. This lets you really make sure that you understand the material. Be careful doing labs and homeworks though, because he's very particular about things being exactly as they were in the examples.

Overall a very easy class.  You have a few basic lab assignments on Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Access to do.  You also create a website, have an online scavenger hunt, and send and email (Yes this is your first homework).  The quizzes are really easy if you miss a questions just write the answers down and restart.  Exams are very easy also.

You have to really be doing something wrong not to get an A in this class. Piece of cake. My class was online and it was great. Very helpful teacher, though the TA's took their time to answer your questions. The quizzes and the questions at the end of the book will be the ones on the exams. Very easy class and a great professor.
Extremely easy class... Midterm/final requires tons of studying and memorization... You would have to be really stupid to not get at least a C+ in this class... Easy A.
super easy class. i only studied right before exams and only misssed 6 points in the whole class out of 1200
Very easy A.. He is very helpful and responses right away if you have any questions about the material. Good teacher! Recommend taking if you need it, or just want to pick up some extra credit hours!

Nice guy. Very willing to help with anything and very flexible when it came to the labs and quizzes. Very laid back and interested in what the student has to say. Brought current issues up in the class to make it more interesting.

Had him for C++ in his first class that he taught. Really good in terms of communicating the material to us. (Especially when compared to the other programming teachers.) Also has a cool sense of humor. If he starts teaching again, I'd try to get him.

Professor did not seem to be knowledgeable in the material, and the TA did not know how to program in the recommended/forced "language".  Subject matter was disorganized, and weekly presentations completely noneducational.   Never received a single grade all quarter, and he had no idea what he was doing.  Do not take 758 with him.
the class can be boring sometimes...contrary to what the other review said, he does give 3 homeworks and a project, all of which aren't too bad.  all in all its a pretty easy class though
Great teacher.  Show up for class and you'll be fine.  Hot,too.
Horrible!
Very easy and helpful. Recommend him to anyone. Does not burden students with homework.
Great teach! Funny and informative. Will take his class again.
Did probably a total of 10 hours of work for this class and got an A. Easy but SO BORING. Reads Powerpoint slides instead of teaching.

very good teacher. if you dont want to buy the book then you have to go to class as if you go to class theres no need for a book and he will tell you straight up that u dont need one. but if you know ur not going to class follow along in the book and you will get an easy A.
Vignesh is very good in helping out students.  Attendance is not mandatory for CSE 201, but if you go to every lecture you do not need the book.  Overall a very good teacher.

He was very enthusiastic and his teaching was crystal clear.  Definitely one of the best instructors I've had during my time at OSU.  My only complaint about this course is that it could have been a little more intensive on diving deep into C++.  But this is likely how the curriculum intends it.

He tries hard and is more than willing to help.  This course is a snoozer for experienced programmers and anyone with moderate programming experience should be able to pull an A with very limited effort. Weaker or inexperienced programmers should expect a time commitment closer to that of a normal course.  HW could be a bit time consuming.
Helpful if you ask. I should have done more for this class and I would have been fine. He was incredibly kind.
Very Helpful if you take the time to ask. Good teacher
I had no programming background but thought this class was a breeze. It really made me like programming, I almost considered double majoring in CIS. Overall, pretty easy.

Well he is good if you have a basic idea about Java, but if you are a complete newbie, Tim probably isn't the best instructor. He assumes students to be familiar with the programming terminology already and  one thing that sucked about him the most was that he was highly UNHELPFUL. I had a really hard time figuring out the labs in this class.
He was a good teacher but sometimes he had us turn homework in then showed us how to do the homework. The class is easy enough, just go to class.

Took this Winter of 07.  Great teacher, funny and interested in teaching.  Explains stuff pretty well but the logics behind basic programming is also pretty easy to understand.  He made class  enjoyable even with a student who never stopped asking dumb questions for example copyright for programs written in entry level programming class...

This guy is a good teacher if you never have to ask him questions.  If you already know the basics behind java Tim would probable be a good teacher.  He might be the worst when it comes to helpfulness.  The class average for our class on midterm 1 was a 51 and he refused and did not curve. he is a jerk I wouldnt recomend him to anyone.

For me, this class is very easy and haven't needed much help from this professor.  Don't get me wrong though, this isn't the easiest material to grasp for a complete newbie.  He is very clear in his teaching, using mainly powerpoint and an informative section website.  This class, like any other class, is easily passable if you put the work in.
Funny guy. Easy class. All around good.

This guy is about the best CS prof at Ohio State. I took Lisp with the Paul Graham book. Great teacher. You can tell he is a hacker extraordinaire. Smart as heck, very deep understanding of LISP - considered taking the course again just to build on it. Also, the guy is very funny if you listen. On comedy value alone his class is worth it.

His teaching style is best described as "cool". He explains a complex language in simple terms, and his choice of text made for an interesting read. He was always accessible before and after class to offer his opinion on my code, and he was very flexible on assignments (no exams and multiple chances at labs). A very rewarding class.
This teacher is great and hilarious, one of the best CSE courses there is.

If you ask questions, matt will give whatever sort of answer you require.  So the class is in part stand up comedy, part self-motivated learning, and part case study of why matt thinks lisp is a cool language.  Matt is also very help during office hours.
Stop doing stand-up comedy!  It's like you're stuck in a bad Sinbad movie.
He is a great prof and knows what he's talking about. Real mercy in grading
Excellent professor, even if this wasn't his specialty area.  He's the king at graphics, but he was able to teach this stuff well too.

I took his Graphics courses in the late 80's, so I don't know how he's faired in a modern world where much of the info is obsoleted by dedicated hardware abilities/limitations.  Still, he's one of the only guys I ever saw who could walk in with a start/end equation/theory and prove it and discuss it from front to back with no notes. :) Good guy.

Laid back indeed. Dr Parent is as informal and "whatever" cool as it gets. Explains what he believe you need to know in class, skims thru somethings (keep up with reading!), be sure to ask questions in class if you are unsure... he explains pretty well. Grading curve is okay.
Not very hard, not very interesting. Seemed like he was as bored with the class as I was. Very laid back. HW/exams/labs not too hard.
Very laid back but very knowledgeable. Great professor.
I was really happy with my 360 class, and I credit some of that to Dr. Parent's teaching
AWESOME PROFESSOR!

Probably the worst teacher in the entire CSE department. Do not ask him questions. He will yell at you. According to Dr. Liu, Floating Point Multiplication should be taught in high school math classes and an explanation of such is not worthy of his time. His English is incomprehensible. Go to class and read the book and his class can be easy.

"Can you give us an example of floating point multiplication?" Answer: "no" "Can you speak up?" answer: "no".   Horrible horrible teacher can't understand a damn thing.  Refuses to answer most questions.

Very generous in grading.  Makes the average a B.  The problem is, hes nuts. He sits up at the front of the room, sips a sprite in his purple shirt, spits on himself and giggles.  Nothing is coherent at all.  Read the chapter day before the test.  Once told me to ask the grader because professors dont help "they administer tests"  WTF?

While he seemed to try hard to be understood, it is simply impossible to understand his quiet, heavily accented voice. This means he goes slowly in lecture and doesn't get through the necessary material, yet he still tests on all of it for the exams. I am hesitant to give negative ratings, but this is probably the worst experience I've had so far.
He talks to his feet, almost impossible to hear him (he mumbles) from more than 10 feet away. (I mean he literally talks while looking at his feet.)

Firstly, let me say that he is a nice guy. If you are willing to try and understand his explanation in terms of homework or test materials, you will find this class isn't that bad. But you MUST be prepared to do A LOT of self-study. And keep in touch with your TA/grader to discuss homework!

OK I can forgive the accent. But I can't forgive the volume of the voice that you can't even hear 2 feet away let alone 5 rows back in a class. He's a good teacher if you can understand him, very generous on the grading. Just nod your head when he mumbles
THe case study of why tenure sucks. DOn't bother trying to understand him. Teach yourself. OPnly plus is the curve is fairly decent.
going to class is completely unneccesary as you cannot understand a word that he says.  This may as well be an individual studies course with him teaching.
Chinese 103 should be a prerequisite class. Don't bother going to class because you can't understand a word he says. Just pray you can learn from the book.
Speaks very softly. Knowledgeable, but doesn't communicate well. Avoid if possible.
To reiterate the the other posts, this is the worst teacher I have ever had at Ohio State.  I wish I could give him less then a 1 in clarity.

The worse teacher I ever came across with in Ohio State University.
Mr. Miyagi (Liu) is a muttering fruitcake. Good textbook and curve though..
Knows a lot, but not speaking in English

This prof it the worst I have ever had at OSU, he does not explain the material very well at all and his writing is atrocious. He does not even know what times his office hours are or what the lab wants you to do, he writes the code without explaining it. teaches it as if we are professionals when this is beginner course. avoid at all costs!

Steve is hard to follow, he has small, sloppy writing.  I attended all but 2 lectures due to midterms.  He is knowledgeable, but too much so that he has a hard time coming down to a beginner's level to explain things simply.  Write down examples, figure it out later.  Labs are your savior.  Homework is graded VERY hard.  Good luck.

A very good teacher, doesn't make you learn anything painful or unnecessary.  He legitimately wants you to learn CSE.  If you're good at CSE, take him so you can skip class.  If not, take him so you can actually learn it.  Highly recommend.

I ABSOLUTELY love this guy! He was a great teacher, Very helpful, I never went to lecture because the class was  too easy and I knew everything already, but this guy is funny and really cool.
